data.v: तपःस्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् । नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: Ascetic Valmiki enquired of Narada, preeminent among the sages ever engaged in the practice of religious austerities or study of the Vedas and best among the eloquent.

data.v: को न्वस्मिन्साम्प्रतं लोके गुणवान्कश्च वीर्यवान् । धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च सत्यवाक्यो दृढव्रतः ।।
data.es: "Who in this world lives today endowed with excellent qualities, prowess, righteousness, gratitude, truthfulness and firmness in his vows?

data.v: चारित्रेण च को युक्तः सर्वभूतेषु को हितः । विद्वान्कः कः समर्थश्च कश्चैकप्रियदर्शनः ।।
data.es: Who is that one gifted with good conduct, given to the wellbeing of all living creatures, learned in the lore (knowledge of all things that is known), capable of doing things which others can not do and singularly handsome?

data.v: आत्मवान्को जितक्रोधो द्युतिमान्कोऽनसूयकः । कस्य बिभ्यति देवाश्च जातरोषस्य संयुगे ।।
data.es: Who (among men) is selfrestrained? Who has conquered anger? Who is endowed with brilliance and free from envy? Who is that when exited to wrath even the devatas, are afraid of (let alone foes)?

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे । महर्षे त्वं समर्थोऽसि ज्ञातुमेवंविधं नरम् ।।
data.es: O Maharshi, I intend to hear about such a man whom you are able to place? Indeed great is my curiosity".

data.v: श्रुत्वा चैतत्त्रिलोकज्ञो वाल्मीकेर्नारदो वचः । श्रूयतामिति चामन्त्र्य प्रहृष्टो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Invited by Valmiki to take his seat Narada, knower of the three worlds heard him and said with delight "listen to me". And thus spoke.

data.v: बहवो दुर्लभाश्चैव ये त्वया कीर्तिता गुणाः । मुने वक्ष्याम्यहं बुद्ध्वा तैर्युक्तः श्रूयतां नरः ।।
data.es: "O sage rare indeed are men endowed with the many qualities you have described. I ascertained one. Listen carefully.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभवो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः । नियतात्मा महावीर्यो द्युतिमान्धृतिमान्वशी ।।
data.es: People have heard his name as Rama, who was born in the race of king Ikshvaku, having steady nature, possessing incomprehensible prowess, selfeffulgent, selfcommanding and subjecting senses under his control.

data.v: बुद्धिमान्नीतिमान्वाग्मी श्रीमाञ्शत्रुनिबर्हणः । विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवो महाहनुः ।।
data.es: He (Sri Rama) is a great intellectual, adherent to rules, eloquent, handsome, destroyer of foes (sins), broadshouldered, strongarmed, having conchshaped neck and prominent cheeks.

data.v: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिंदमः । आजानुबाहुः सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Possessing a broad chest, armed with a great bow, with fleshy collar bones, kneelong arms, a noble head, a graceful forehead and great prowess, he is the destroyer of foes (sins).

data.v: समः समविभक्ताङ्गः स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान् । पीनवक्षा विशालाक्षो लक्ष्मीवाञ्शुभलक्षणः ।।
data.es: Mighty and powerful, he has a wellproportioned body, neither tall nor short, shining complexion, welldeveloped chest, large eyes, lustrous body and good qualities.

data.v: धर्मज्ञः सत्यसंधश्च प्रजानां च हिते रतः । यशस्वी ज्ञानसंपन्नः शुचिर्वश्यः समाधिमान् ।।
data.es: Pious, firm in his vows, he is ever intent on doing good to his subjects. He is, illustrious, wise, and pure at heart. He is obedient to elders (or accessible to those who are dependent on him) and ever meditating (on the means of protecting those who take refuge in him).

data.v: रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य परिरक्षिता । वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञो धनुर्वेदे च निष्ठितः ।।
data.es: He has performed the duties of a king and protected his subjects. knowledgeable in the true nature of the Vedas he is accomplished in military science (he is a great archer).

data.v: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञ स्मृतिमान्प्रतिभानवान् । सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama knows the true meaning of all scriptures and has a retentive memory. He is talented (possessing brightness of conception). He is beloved and welldisposed towards all people (and courteous even towards those who have done him harm). He has an unperturbed mind (even in times of extreme grief) and is circumspect (in doing right things at the right time).

data.v: सर्वदाभिगतः सद्भिः समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः । आर्यः सर्वसमश्चैव सदैकप्रियदर्शनः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama, like sea to rivers, is accessible to men of virtue and has equal disposition towards all. He always has a pleasing appearance.

data.v: स च सर्वगुणोपेतः कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः । समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये धैर्येण हिमवानिव ।।
data.es: Sri Rama, bestowed with all virtues, enhanced the joys of Kausalya, He is like the sea in deportment and like Himavant in fortitude.

data.v: विष्णुना सदृशो वीर्ये सोमवत्प्रियदर्शनः । कालाग्निसदृशः क्रोधे क्षमया पृथिवीसमः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama is like Visnu in prowess, the Moon in pleasing appearance, the allconsuming fire in anger, the earth in patience, Kubera in chartiy and the Sun in steadfastness.

data.v: धनदेन समस्त्यागे सत्ये धर्म इवापरः । तमेवंगुणसंपन्नं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् ।।
ज्येष्ठं श्रेष्ठगुणैर्युक्तं प्रियं दशरथः सुतम् । यौवराज्येन संयोक्तुमैच्छत्प्रीत्या महीपतिः ।।
data.es: With a desire to promote the welfare of the people king Dasaratha decided to install Sri Rama, his eldest and affectionate son as heir (apparent) who was bestowed with all excellent qualities and true prowess, beloved of the people he was ever intent in the welfare of the people.

data.v: तस्याभिषेकसंभारान्दृष्ट्वा भार्याथ कैकयी । पूर्वं दत्तवरा देवी वरमेनमयाचत । विवासनं च रामस्य भरतस्याभिषेचनम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, having seen the preparations for installation of Rama, queen Kaikeyi who had been promised earlier with boons by Dasaratha demanded of him the exile of Rama and enthronement of Bharata.

data.v: स सत्यवचनाद्राजा धर्मपाशेन संयतः । विवासयामास सुतं रामं दशरथः प्रियम् ।।
data.es: Dasaratha, true to his word and restrained by the bond of duty, sent his beloved son Rama to the forest.

data.v: स जगाम वनं वीरः प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन् । पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्कैकेय्याः प्रियकारणात् ।।
data.es: Mighty Sri Rama inorder to please Kaikeyi and obey the word of command of his father, went to the forest and help the king to keep his promise to Kaikeyi.

data.v: तं व्रजन्तं प्रियो भ्राता लक्ष्मणोऽनुजगाम ह । स्नेहाद्विनयसंपन्नः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana beloved brother to Rama is drawn towards him. Endowed with modesty he is an enhancer of the joy of his mother Sumitra. Displaying his fraternal love, he followed Rama who was departing to the forest.

data.v: सर्वलक्षणसंपन्ना नारीणामुत्तमा वधूः । सीताप्यनुगता रामं शशिनं रोहिणी यथा ।।
data.es: Born in the race of Janaka and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, Sita, beloved spouse of Rama is like his vital breath always desired the wellbeing of Rama she followed him like Rohini, the Moon. Endowed with all virtues she is the foremost woman.

data.v: पौरैरनुगतो दूरं पित्रा दशरथेन च । शृङ्गवेरपुरे सूतं गङ्गाकूले व्यसर्जयत् ।।
data.es: The citizens and Dasaratha followed Rama for a long distance. Rama of righteous nature having approached Guha, king of nishadas, at Shrungiberapura sent back charioteer Sumantra and Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana crossed river Ganga.

data.v: ते वनेन वनं गत्वा नदीस्तीर्त्वा बहूदकाः । चित्रकूटमनुप्राप्य भरद्वाजस्य शासनात् ।।
data.es: Moving from one forest to another and crossing deep and wide rivers with plenty of waters, reached the Chitrakuta mountain by the command of sage Bharadwaja. They raised a hut made of leaves in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain. and dwelt there happily resembling devas and gandharvas.

data.v: रम्यमावसथं कृत्वा रममाणा वने त्रयः । देवगन्धर्वसंकाशास्तत्र ते न्यवसन्सुखम् ।।
data.es: Moving from one forest to another and crossing deep and wide rivers with plenty of waters, reached the Chitrakuta mountain by the command of sage Bharadwaja. They raised a hut made of leaves in the forest located in Chitrakuta mountain. and dwelt there happily resembling devas and gandharvas.

data.v: चित्रकूटं गते रामे पुत्रशोकातुरस्तदा । राजा दशरथः स्वर्गं जगाम विलपन्सुतम् ।।
data.es: When Rama had set out to Chitrakuta, king Dasaratha, stricken by the grief over the separation from his son and mourning over him departed to heavens.

data.v: मृते तु तस्मिन्भरतो वसिष्ठप्रमुखैर्द्विजैः । नियुज्यमानो राज्याय नैच्छद्राज्यं महाबलः । स जगाम वनं वीरो रामपादप्रसादकः ।।
data.es: After Dasaratha had passed away, mighty Bharata did not desire to rule the kingdom against the orders by Vasishta and other brahmins.

data.v: पादुके चास्य राज्याय न्यासं दत्त्वा पुनः पुनः । निवर्तयामास ततो भरतं भरताग्रजः ।।
data.es: Having handed over his sandals to Bharata as symbol of authority for ruling the kingdom, Rama persuaded him again and again to return to the capital.

data.v: स काममनवाप्यैव रामपादावुपस्पृशन् । नन्दिग्रामेऽकरोद्राज्यं रामागमनकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: Disaaponted in his mission to take Rama back, Bharata worshipped the sandals of Rama and ruled the kingdom from Nandigrama, awaiting his return.

data.v: रामस्तु पुनरालक्ष्य नागरस्य जनस्य च । तत्रागमनमेकाग्रे दण्डकान्प्रविवेश ह ।।
data.es: When Bharata departed, Sri Rama, a man of good fortune and steadfast in vows one who had conquered under control perceiving that the citizens from Ayodhya would arrive there, entered the Dandaka forest with single minded determination (so that there would not be breach of his promise).

data.v: विराधं राक्षसं हत्वा शरभङ्गं ददर्श ह । सुतीक्ष्णं चाप्यगस्त्यं च अगस्त्य भ्रातरं तथा ।।
data.es: Having entered the dense forest Dandaka, Rama slew the demon Viradha and saw the sages Sarabhanga, Sutikshna and Agastya with his brother.

data.v: अगस्त्यवचनाच्चैव जग्राहैन्द्रं शरासनम् । खड्गं च परमप्रीतस्तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ ।।
data.es: As directed by sage Agastya, Rama received with extreme delight a bow, a sword and quivers with inexhaustible arrows, given by Indra to Agastya (to be passed on to Rama).

data.v: वसतस्तस्य रामस्य वने वनचरैः सह । ऋषयोऽभ्यागमन्सर्वे वधायासुररक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: While Rama was dwelling in the forest (in the hermitage of sage Sarabhanga), all the ascetics along with others (sages) inhabiting the forest approached Rama requesting for the destruction of the asuras and rakshasas seizing upon their lives.

data.v: तेन तत्रैव वसता जनस्थाननिवासिनी । विरूपिता शूर्पणखा राक्षसी कामरूपिणी ।।
data.es: During his stay there a demon called Surpanakha living in Janasthana (resting place for the army of Ravana in Dandakaranya) and capable of assuming any form at will was rendered deformed by Lakshmana.

data.v: ततः शूर्पणखावाक्यादुद्युक्तान्सर्वराक्षसान् । खरं त्रिशिरसं चैव दूषणं चैव राक्षसम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Rama killed in the fight all the rakshasas, Khara, Trisira, and Dushana with their followers in a battle who were instigated by Surpanakha's words.

data.v: निजघान रणे रामस्तेषां चैव पदानुगान् । रक्षसां निहतान्यासन्सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ।।
data.es: During his stay in that forest Rama killed fourteen thousand rakshasas who were inhabitants of Janasthana.

data.v: ततो ज्ञातिवधं श्रुत्वा रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः । सहायं वरयामास मारीचं नाम राक्षसम् ।।
data.es: Having heard the slaughter of fellow rakshasa, Ravana became violent with anger and sought the help of a rakshasa named Maricha.

data.v: वार्यमाणः सुबहुशो मारीचेन स रावणः । न विरोधो बलवता क्षमो रावण तेन ते ।।
data.es: Maricha repeatedly dissuaded him saying, 'O Ravana It is not proper for you to enter into hostility with the mighty and powerful Rama'.

data.v: अनादृत्य तु तद्वाक्यं रावणः कालचोदितः । जगाम सहमारीचस्तस्याश्रमपदं तदा ।।
data.es: Disregarding his words Ravana incited by fate left for the hermitage of Rama along with Maricha.

data.v: तेन मायाविना दूरमपवाह्य नृपात्मजौ । जहार भार्यां रामस्य गृध्रं हत्वा जटायुषम् ।।
data.es: He with the help of deceitful Maricha drew the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) far away from their hermitage abducted Sita the wife of Rama and slaughtered vulture Jatayu,

data.v: गृध्रं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा हृतां श्रुत्वा च मैथिलीम् । राघवः शोकसंतप्तो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Having seen and heard from the eagle Jatayu struck down by Ravana that Sita had been abducted Rama bewailed, choked with tears his senses dulled by distress.

data.v: ततस्तेनैव शोकेन गृध्रं दग्ध्वा जटायुषम् । मार्गमाणो वने सीतां राक्षसं संददर्श ह ।।
data.es: Then he performed in the midst of tears the funeral rites of the vulture Jatayu. Wandering in search of Sita, he beheld a rakshasa named Kabandha who was dreadful, in deformed in appearance.

data.v: कबन्धं नाम रूपेण विकृतं घोरदर्शनम् । तं निहत्य महाबाहुर्ददाह स्वर्गतश्च सः ।।
स चास्य कथयामास शबरीं धर्मचारिणीम् । श्रमणीं धर्मनिपुणामभिगच्छेति राघव । सोऽभ्यगच्छन्महातेजाः शबरीं शत्रुसूदनः ।।
data.es: Mightyarmed Rama, having killed Kabandha, consigned his body to flames. While leaving for heavens he informed him saying, 'O Raghava, there is a female ascetic in Sabara community, performing religious duties and proficient in practising austerities. You may visit her'.

data.v: शबर्या पूजितः सम्यग्रामो दशरथात्मजः । पम्पातीरे हनुमता संगतो वानरेण ह ।।
हनुमद्वचनाच्चैव सुग्रीवेण समागतः । सुग्रीवाय च तत्सर्वं शंसद्रामो महाबलः ।।
ततो वानरराजेन वैरानुकथनं प्रति । रामायावेदितं सर्वं प्रणयाद्दुःखितेन च । वालिनश्च बलं तत्र कथयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Sugriva, king of monkeys filled with sorrow narrated to Rama out of friendship the entire account of his hostilities (with Vali).

data.v: प्रतिज्ञातं च रामेण तदा वालिवधं प्रति । सुग्रीवः शङ्कितश्चासीन्नित्यं वीर्येण राघवे ।।
data.es: Then Rama vowed to slay Vali. The monkey (Sugriva) described about Vali's prowess to Rama.

data.v: राघवः प्रत्ययार्थं तु दुन्दुभेः कायमुत्तमम् । पादाङ्गुष्ठेन चिक्षेप संपूर्णं दशयोजनम् ।।
data.es: The strongarmed Rama, who was endowed with great strength looked at the skeleton and smiled within himself for a while. He kicked off the skeleton with the great toe of his foot completely to a full distance of ten yojanas (eighty miles).

data.v: बिभेद च पुनः सालान्सप्तैकेन महेषुणा । गिरिं रसातलं चैव जनयन्प्रत्ययं तदा ।।
data.es: Again inorder to create confidence (in Sugriva), he released a single mighty shaft which penetrated seven palmyra trees, a mountain and the Rasatala.

data.v: ततः प्रीतमनास्तेन विश्वस्तः स महाकपिः । किष्किन्धां रामसहितो जगाम च गुहां तदा ।।
data.es: Pleased with Rama's action and convinced of his prowess he left thereafter with Rama he left for Kishkindha which was like a cave.

data.v: ततोऽगर्जद्धरिवरः सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः । तेन नादेन महता निर्जगाम हरीश्वरः ।।
data.es: On entering the city of Kishkindha, Sugriva the best of monkeys of reddish yellow hue roared with a great voice. There upon Vali, the lord of monkeys came out (of the cave).

data.v: ततः सुग्रीववचनाद्धत्वा वालिनमाहवे । सुग्रीवमेव तद्राज्ये राघवः प्रत्यपादयत् ।।
data.es: After he killed Vali in the combat in compliance with the words of Sugriva, Rama installed Sugriva as king.

data.v: स च सर्वान्समानीय वानरान्वानरर्षभः । दिशः प्रस्थापयामास दिदृक्षुर्जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: The best of monkeys (Sugriva) gathered his monkey forces and despatched them in various directions in search of Janaka's daughter (Sita).

data.v: ततो गृध्रस्य वचनात्संपातेर्हनुमान्बली । शतयोजनविस्तीर्णं पुप्लुवे लवणार्णवम् ।।
data.es: At the suggestion of the vulture, Sampathi mighty Hanuman leapt over the saltocean extending over a hundred yojanas.

data.v: तत्र लङ्कां समासाद्य पुरीं रावणपालिताम् । ददर्श सीतां ध्यायन्तीमशोकवनिकां गताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman arrived at the city of Lanka ruled by Ravana and found Sita in the Ashoka garden meditating on Rama.

data.v: निवेदयित्वाभिज्ञानं प्रवृत्तिं च निवेद्य च । समाश्वास्य च वैदेहीं मर्दयामास तोरणम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman delivered Rama's ring to Sita as a token of recognition, related the whole story and consoled her. He then crushed the arch (of the outer gate of the garden) before leaving.

data.v: पञ्च सेनाग्रगान्हत्वा सप्त मन्त्रिसुतानपि । शूरमक्षं च निष्पिष्य ग्रहणं समुपागमत् ।।
data.es: After killing five commanders, seven sons of the counsellors, stamping out valiant Akshayakumara, the son of Ravana, Hanuman got himself captured (to be taken as captive).

data.v: अस्त्रेणोन्मुहमात्मानं ज्ञात्वा पैतामहाद्वरात् । मर्षयन्राक्षसान्वीरो यन्त्रिणस्तान्यदृच्छया ।।
data.es: The heroic Hanuman came to know that he could be released from the entanglements of the weapon granted to him through a boon by Brahma. He allowed himself to be restrained by the rakshasas with the ropes for the sake of achieving his other objective of seeing Ravana. Thereafter, he burnt the whole of Lanka except the place where Sita was and returned to deliver the good news to Rama.

data.v: ततो दग्ध्वा पुरीं लङ्कामृते सीतां च मैथिलीम् । रामाय प्रियमाख्यातुं पुनरायान्महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The heroic Hanuman came to know that he could be released from the entanglements of the weapon granted to him through a boon by Brahma. He allowed himself to be restrained by the rakshasas with the ropes for the sake of achieving his other objective of seeing Ravana. Thereafter, he burnt the whole of Lanka except the place where Sita was and returned to deliver the good news to Rama.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं कृत्वा रामं प्रदक्षिणम् । न्यवेदयदमेयात्मा दृष्टा सीतेति तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: Reaching Rama the great Hanuman gifted with boundless intellect circumambulated him and infact informed him that he had seen Sita.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवसहितो गत्वा तीरं महोदधेः । समुद्रं क्षोभयामास शरैरादित्यसंनिभैः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Rama reached the shore of the ocean together with Sugriva and saw the ocean agitated with shafts burning like the Sun.

data.v: दर्शयामास चात्मानं समुद्रः सरितां पतिः । समुद्रवचनाच्चैव नलं सेतुमकारयत् ।।
data.es: Samudra, lord of rivers, (afraid of Rama's anger) and having appeared in his own form, and on his advice got a bridge built with the help of Nala.

data.v: तेन गत्वा पुरीं लङ्कां हत्वा रावणमाहवे । अभ्यषिञ्चत्स लङ्कायां राक्षसेन्द्रं विभीषणम् ।।
data.es: Rama entered the city of Lanka by means of that bridge, killed Ravana in the battle and recovered Sita. Thereafter he felt greatly embarassed (for accepting his wife who had stayed in an others.

data.v: कर्मणा तेन महता त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम् । सदेवर्षिगणं तुष्टं राघवस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: All the animate and inanimate beings, gods and sages in the three worlds were very pleased at this noble deed of the great Rama.

data.v: तथा परमसंतुष्टैः पूजितः सर्वदैवतैः । कृतकृत्यस्तदा रामो विज्वरः प्रमुमोद ह ।।
data.es: After coronating the rakshasa chief Vibhishana in the city of Lanka, Rama free from distress, exceedingly rejoiced after having accomplished his objective.

data.v: देवताभ्यो वरान्प्राप्य समुत्थाप्य च वानरान् । पुष्पकं तत्समारुह्य नन्दिग्रामं ययौ तदा ।।
data.es: Having obtained a boon from the devatas (who had come to see him) Rama, revived all monkeys (fallen in the battle) and set out for Ayodhya accompanied by friends in the pushpaka (aerial car).

data.v: नन्दिग्रामे जटां हित्वा भ्रातृभिः सहितोऽनघः । रामः सीतामनुप्राप्य राज्यं पुनरवाप्तवान् ।।
data.es: At Nandigrama sinless Rama arrived, met his brothers. They shed their matted locks. With Sita restored he regained his kingdom.

data.v: प्रहृष्टमुदितो लोकस्तुष्टः पुष्टः सुधार्मिकः । निरायमो अरोगश्च दुर्भिक्षभयवर्जितः ।।
data.es: The entire world rejoiced with happiness with their desire fulfilled they were content. All people were following the path of righteousness. There was no fear of sufferings or agonies, diseases or famine.

data.v: न पुत्रमरणं केचिद्द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुरुषाः क्वचित् । नार्यश्चाविधवा नित्यं भविष्यन्ति पतिव्रताः ।।
data.es: During the period of Rama's rule, no where would men witness the death of their sons or women widowed. They would ever remain chaste and devoted to their husbands.

data.v: न वातजं भयं किंचिन्नाप्सु मज्जन्ति जन्तवः । न चाग्रिजं भयं किंचिद्यथा कृतयुगे तथा ।।
data.es: There (in the kingdom of Rama) was no fear of fire, water, wind, disease, hunger and also theft.

data.v: अश्वमेधशतैरिष्ट्वा तथा बहुसुवर्णकैः । गवां कोट्ययुतं दत्त्वा विद्वद्भ्यो विधिपूर्वकम् ।।
data.es: Highly renowned Rama, having satisfied the gods with the performance of a hundred of aswamedhas and many suvarnakas bestowing hundreds of thousands of cows and immense wealth on the brahmins, will return to Brahmaloka.

data.v: राजवंशाञ्शतगुणान्स्थापयिष्यति राघवः । चातुर्वर्ण्यं च लोकेऽस्मिन्स्वे स्वे धर्मे नियोक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: Rama will establish hundredfold royal dynasties and employ the four castes to do their respective duties, in this world.

data.v: दशवर्षसहस्राणि दशवर्षशतानि च । रामो राज्यमुपासित्वा ब्रह्मलोकं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: Rama, reigning the kingdom for eleven thousand years, will attain Brahmaloka.

data.v: इदं पवित्रं पापघ्नं पुण्यं वेदैश्च संमितम् । यः पठेद्रामचरितं सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ।।
data.es: This story of Rama is sacred and holy. It destroys sins and is equal to the Vedas. Whosoever reads it will be freed from all sins.

data.v: एतदाख्यानमायुष्यं पठन्रामायणं नरः । सपुत्रपौत्रः सगणः प्रेत्य स्वर्गे महीयते ।।
data.es: This story of Ramayana enhances longevity of those who read it and recite it. They will be worshipped in heavens after their death along with their sons and grandsons, servants and relations.

data.v: पठन्द्विजो वागृषभत्वमीया;त्स्यात्क्षत्रियो भूमिपतित्वमीयात् । वणिग्जनः पण्यफलत्वमीया;ज्जनश्च शूद्रोऽपि महत्त्वमीयात् ।।
data.es: A brahmin becomes proficient in the eighteen branches of learning a kshatriya gets lordship over landed possessions a vaisya gets the fruits of his business and sudra also attains greatness by reading Ramayana". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे (श्रीमद्रामायणकथासङ्क्षेपो नाम) प्रथम: सर्ग:।। Thus ends the first sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: नारदस्य तु तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वाक्यविशारदः । पूजयामास धर्मात्मा सहशिष्यो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Narada the distinguished and righteous sage Valmiki, proficient in composing slokas worshipped him along with his disciples.

data.v: यथावत्पूजितस्तेन देवर्षिर्नारदस्तदा । आपृष्ट्वैवाभ्यनुज्ञातः स जगाम विहायसम् ।।
data.es: The divine sage Narada after having been worshipped by Valmiki in a befitting manner sought his leave and went to heaven.

data.v: स मुहूर्तं गते तस्मिन्देवलोकं मुनिस्तदा । जगाम तमसातीरं जाह्नव्यास्त्वविदूरतः ।।
data.es: After Narada had gone to devaloka, sage Valmiki reached the bank of river Tamasa which is not very far from the Ganges for morning ablutions.

data.v: स तु तीरं समासाद्य तमसाया महामुनिः । शिष्यमाह स्थितं पार्श्वे दृष्ट्वा तीर्थमकर्दमम् ।।
data.es: The eminent sage Valmiki reached the bank of Tamasa and seen a descent into the river with pellucid waters, spoke to the disciple standing by the side.

data.v: अकर्दममिदं तीर्थं भरद्वाज निशामय । रमणीयं प्रसन्नाम्बु सन्मनुष्यमनो यथा ।।
data.es: "O Bharadwaja, behold the beautiful and pleasant waters of this river. This holy spot is as clear and pure as the mind of a virtuous man.

data.v: न्यस्यतां कलशस्तात दीयतां वल्कलं मम । इदमेवावगाहिष्ये तमसातीर्थमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: O dear one Put down the pitcher on the ground. Give me my garment. I shall take a dip in Tamasa, the holiest of places".

data.v: एवमुक्तो भरद्वाजो वाल्मीकेन महात्मना । प्रायच्छत मुनेस्तस्य वल्कलं नियतो गुरोः ।।
data.es: Asked thus by the nobleminded master Valmiki, Bharadwaja, ever obedient to his spiritual master, gave the sage the bark garment.

data.v: स शिष्यहस्तादादाय वल्कलं नियतेन्द्रियः । विचचार ह पश्यंस्तत्सर्वतो विपुलं वनम् ।।
data.es: Valmiki who had his senses under his command received the barkgarment from the hands of his disciple and wandered about in that extensive forest, looking all around.

data.v: तस्याभ्याशे तु मिथुनं चरन्तमनपायिनम् । ददर्श भगवांस्तत्र क्रौञ्चयोश्चारुनिस्वनम् ।।
data.es: Sage Valmiki espied a pair of melodious kraunchas. Flying about in each other's in separable company there in its vicinity.

data.v: तस्मात्तु मिथुनादेकं पुमांसं पापनिश्चयः । जघान वैरनिलयो निषादस्तस्य पश्यतः ।।
data.es: A sinful and cruelhearted hunter struck down the male bird of the pair in his very presence.

data.v: तं शोणितपरीताङ्गं वेष्टमानं महीतले । भार्या तु निहतं दृष्ट्वा रुराव करुणां गिरम् ।।
data.es: The female companion saw the male bird struck down by the hunter and rolling on the earth, drenched in blood. Separated from her winged comparion with coppercrested head intoxicated with her love, the female companion lifted a piteous wail.

data.v: तथा तु तं द्विजं दृष्ट्वा निषादेन निपातितम् । ऋषेर्धर्मात्मनस्तस्य कारुण्यं समपद्यत ।।
data.es: Then, having seen the bird struck down by the fowler, the pious sage Valmiki was filled with compassion.

data.v: ततः करुणवेदित्वादधर्मोऽयमिति द्विजः । निशाम्य रुदतीं क्रौञ्चीमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the wailing of the female bird, the sage (Valmiki) moved to pity at this irreligious act uttered the following words.

data.v: मा निषाद प्रतिष्ठां त्वमगमः शाश्वतीः समाः । यत्क्रौञ्चमिथुनादेकमवधीः काममोहितम् ।।
data.es: "O fowler, since you have killed one of the pair of infatuated kraunchas you will be permanently deprived of your position".

data.v: तस्यैवं ब्रुवतश्चिन्ता बभूव हृदि वीक्षतः । शोकार्तेनास्य शकुनेः किमिदं व्याहृतं मया ।।
data.es: Brooding over his utterances, he reflected, 'What is this that I uttered in reaction to the grief of this bird?'

data.v: चिन्तयन्स महाप्राज्ञश्चकार मतिमान्मतिम् । शिष्यं चैवाब्रवीद्वाक्यमिदं स मुनिपुंगवः ।।
data.es: Very wise and learned, he (Valmiki), preeminent among sages, pondered over it (for a while) and spoke these words to his disciple.

data.v: पादबद्धोऽक्षरसमस्तन्त्रीलयसमन्वितः । शोकार्तस्य प्रवृत्तो मे श्लोको भवतु नान्यथा ।।
data.es: "Occasioned by the griefstricken (state of the bird) and composed in rhymed lines each of equal number of syllables tuned to the accompaniment of stringed instruments, let it be known as a sloka and not by any other name".

data.v: शिष्यस्तु तस्य ब्रुवतो मुनेर्वाक्यमनुत्तमम् । प्रतिजग्राह संहृष्टस्तस्य तुष्टोऽभवद्गुरुः ।।
data.es: His disciple, delighted by the excellent verse composed by the sage, committed it to memory which left his spiritual preceptor pleased.

data.v: सोऽभिषेकं ततः कृत्वा तीर्थे तस्मिन्यथाविधि । तमेव चिन्तयन्नर्थमुपावर्तत वै मुनिः ।।
data.es: After having performed his ablution at that holy spot according to the prescribed ritual, the sage (Valmiki) returned (to his hermitage), pondering over the matter.

data.v: भरद्वाजस्ततः शिष्यो विनीतः श्रुतवान्गुरोः । कलशं पूर्णमादाय पृष्ठतोऽनुजगाम ह ।।
data.es: Then saint Bharadwaja, his disciple humble and learned in scriptures, followed him with a pitcher full (of water).

data.v: स प्रविश्याश्रमपदं शिष्येण सह धर्मवित् । उपविष्टः कथाश्चान्याश्चकार ध्यानमास्थितः ।।
data.es: Valmiki who knows dharma entered the hermitage along with his disciple and sat in meditation and composed other stories.

data.v: आजगाम ततो ब्रह्मा लोककर्ता स्वयं प्रभुः । चतुर्मुखो महातेजा द्रष्टुं तं मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: At that moment, the effulgent, fourfaced Brahma, creator and lord of the world, himself, desirous of seeing him (Valmiki), the best among sages, arrived.

data.v: वाल्मीकिरथ तं दृष्ट्वा सहसोत्थाय वाग्यतः । प्राञ्जलिः प्रयतो भूत्वा तस्थौ परमविस्मितः ।।
data.es: Greatly surprised to see him, Valmiki, purified by austerities and disciplined in speech, immediately got up and with folded palms stood before him.

data.v: पूजयामास तं देवं पाद्यार्घ्यासनवन्दनैः । प्रणम्य विधिवच्चैनं पृष्ट्वानामयमव्ययम् ।।
data.es: Bowing with reverence as enjoined by tradition and having enquired of his well being, Valmiki worshipped the immutable Brahma by falling at his feet and welcoming him with a seat and water to wash his feet with.

data.v: अथोपविश्य भगवानासने परमार्चिते । वाल्मीकये महर्षये संदिदेशासनं ततः ।।
data.es: Lord Brahma sat down on a highly worshipful seat and showed a seat for the ascetic Valmiki to be seated.

data.v: उपविष्टे तदा तस्मिन्साक्षाल्लोकपितामहे । तद्गतेनैव मनसा वाल्मीकिर्ध्यानमास्थितः ।।
data.es: Having been ordered by Brahma, he also sat down on a seat. Although seated in the presence of the lord of the worlds, he was absorbed in the thought of events (leading to the death of the krauncha ).

data.v: पापात्मना कृतं कष्टं वैरग्रहणबुद्धिना । यस्तादृशं चारुरवं क्रौञ्चं हन्यादकारणात् ।।
data.es: The hunter killed the sweetvoiced krauncha without any cause. That sinfulminded one with hostile feeling of capturing it, had perpetrated this cruel act, he thought.

data.v: शोचन्नेव मुहुः क्रौञ्चीमुपश्लोकमिमं पुनः । जगावन्तर्गतमना भूत्वा शोकपरायणः ।।
data.es: Griefstricken, Valmiki having become introspective and lamenting the plight of the female krauncha again and again, recited this sloka.

data.v: तमुवाच ततो ब्रह्मा प्रहसन्मुनिपुंगवम् । श्लोक एव त्वया बद्धो नात्र कार्या विचारणा ।।
data.es: Thereafter lord Brahma smilingly addressed Valmiki, the preeminent among sages, saying, "You have indeed composed a sloka.There is no doubt about it".

data.v: मच्छन्दादेव ते ब्रह्मन्प्रवृत्तेयं सरस्वती । रामस्य चरितं सर्वं कुरु त्वमृषिसत्तम ।।
data.es: "OBrahmarshi, at my will, this speech had originated from you. Most excellent ascetic, compose the history of Rama in its entirety (in this metre).

data.v: धर्मात्मनो गुणवतो लोके रामस्य धीमतः । वृत्तं कथय धीरस्य यथा ते नारदाच्छ्रुतम् ।।
data.es: Narrate the history of Rama who is renowned for righteousness, virtues, wisdom and steadfastness in the manner you have heard it from sage Narada.

data.v: रहस्यं च प्रकाशं च यद्वृत्तं तस्य धीमतः । रामस्य सह सौमित्रे राक्षसानां च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: The incidents pertaining to sagacious Rama together with Lakshmana, Sita, Bharata, etc. and the rakshasas their deeds, thoughts, unknown or known to everybody and even not known to you, will be revealed to you by my grace.

data.v: वैदेह्याश्चैव यद्वृत्तं प्रकाशं यदि वा रहः । तच्चाप्यविदितं सर्वं विदितं ते भविष्यति ।।
data.es: The incidents pertaining to sagacious Rama together with Lakshmana, Sita, Bharata, etc. and the rakshasas their deeds, thoughts, unknown or known to everybody and even not known to you, will be revealed to you by my grace.

data.v: न ते वागनृता काव्ये काचिदत्र भविष्यति । कुरु रामकथां पुण्यां श्लोकबद्धां मनोरमाम् ।।
data.es: Not even a single word of yours in this epic will ever prove untruthful. Compose this sacred, delightful story of Rama, set in the form of slokas.

data.v: यावत्स्थास्यन्ति गिरयः सरितश्च महीतले । तावद्रामायणकथा लोकेषु प्रचरिष्यति ।।
data.es: As long as the mountains and rivers exist on this earth, the story of Ramayana will prevail among the people.

data.v: यावद्रामस्य च कथा त्वत्कृता प्रचरिष्यति । तावदूर्ध्वमधश्च त्वं मल्लोकेषु निवत्स्यसि ।।
data.es: So long as the story of the Ramayana composed by you is remembered in this world, you will live in the upper world, the nether world and Brahmaloka".

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा भगवान्ब्रह्मा तत्रैवान्तरधीयत । ततः सशिष्यो वाल्मीकिर्मुनिर्विस्मयमाययौ ।।
data.es: Having spoken these words, lord Brahma vanished. At this he and his disciples were astonished.

data.v: तस्य शिष्यास्ततः सर्वे जगुः श्लोकमिमं पुनः । मुहुर्मुहुः प्रीयमाणाः प्राहुश्च भृशविस्मिताः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the disciples of Valmiki chanted this sloka again and again in delight. They were greatly astonished and spoke about it often.

data.v: समाक्षरैश्चतुर्भिर्यः पादैर्गीतो महर्षिणा । सोऽनुव्याहरणाद्भूयः शोकः श्लोकत्वमागतः ।।
data.es: This sloka of four lines, each consisting of equal number of syllables, was recited by the maharshi. Constant recitation (by others) elicited admiration (from the listeners).

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिरियं जाता वाल्मीकेर्भावितात्मनः । कृत्स्नं रामायणं काव्यमीदृशैः करवाण्यहम् ।।
data.es: A thought occurred to Valmiki, who is capable of putting thoughts into action "I shall compose the epic named Ramayana entirely in this metre".

data.v: उदारवृत्तार्थपदैर्मनोरमै;स्तदास्य रामस्य चकार कीर्तिमान् । समाक्षरैः श्लोकशतैर्यशस्विनो; यशस्करं काव्यमुदारधीर्मुनिः ।।
data.es: The renowned and sagacious sage composed a kavya with hundreds of charming verses, each containing equal number of syllables and excellent meaningful words set in metre, conferring glory on celebrated Rama.

data.v: श्रुत्वा वस्तु समग्रं तद्धर्मात्मा धर्मसंहितम् । व्यक्तमन्वेषते भूयो यद्वृत्तं तस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: Hearing the entire story of Rama from the intellecual Narada, the righteous (Valmiki) sought to know clearly more about the history of Rama endowed with wisdom.

data.v: उपस्पृश्योदकं संयन्मुनिः स्थित्वा कृताञ्जलिः । प्राचीनाग्रेषु दर्भेषु धर्मेणान्वेषते गतिम् ।।
data.es: Having performed achamana, Valmiki seated on kusha grass with folded palms, searched for the course of past events in the history of Rama by his power of penance.

data.v: जन्म रामस्य सुमहद्वीर्यं सर्वानुकूलताम् । लोकस्य प्रियतां क्षान्तिं सौम्यतां सत्यशीलताम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the birth of Rama, his great prowess, benevolence, pleasant disposition, forbearance, handsome looks and his adherence to truth.

data.v: नानाचित्राः कथाश्चान्या विश्वामित्रसहायने । जानक्याश्च विवाहं च धनुषश्च विभेदनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) Rama's association with Viswamitra, a variety of wonderful stories, the breaking of the great bow and his (Rama's) marriage with Janaki.

data.v: रामरामविवादं च गुणान्दाशरथेस्तथा । तथाभिषेकं रामस्य कैकेय्या दुष्टभावताम् ।।
data.es: (He described) Rama's altercation with Parasurama, his noble qualities, the preparations for his coronation and the wicked nature of Kaikeyi.

data.v: व्याघातं चाभिषेकस्य रामस्य च विवासनम् । राज्ञः शोकविलापं च परलोकस्य चाश्रयम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the obstacles to the coronation of Rama, his departure to the forest, the wailing and death of king Dasaratha with sorrow.

data.v: प्रकृतीनां विषादं च प्रकृतीनां विसर्जनम् । निषादाधिपसंवादं सूतोपावर्तनं तथा ।।
data.es: (He described) the grief of people of Ayodhya and his (Rama's) abandoning them and his (Rama's) conversation with Guha, the ruler of nishadas, the charioteer (Sumantra)'s return (after leaving Rama in the forest).

data.v: गङ्गायाश्चापि संतारं भरद्वाजस्य दर्शनम् । भरद्वाजाभ्यनुज्ञानाच्चित्रकूटस्य दर्शनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) Rama, Lakshmana and Sita ferrying the river Ganges, the visit to holy sage Bharadwaja and the departure to Chitrakuta mountain.

data.v: वास्तुकर्मनिवेशं च भरतागमनं तथा । प्रसादनं च रामस्य पितुश्च सलिलक्रियाम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the making of, and dwelling in, a hut, the arrival of Bharata, Bharata's persuasion to Rama (to return to the kingdom), and Rama's performance the funeral ablution for his father.

data.v: पादुकाग्र्याभिषेकं च नन्दिग्राम निवासनम् । दण्डकारण्यगमनं सुतीक्ष्णेन समागमम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the installation of sandals (of Rama as the symbol of authority), Bharata is residing at Nandigrama (and his ruling the kingdom from there), Rama's departure for Dandakaranya, and the killing of Viradha.

data.v: अनसूयासमस्यां च अङ्गरागस्य चार्पणम् । शूर्पणख्याश्च संवादं विरूपकरणं तथा ।।
वधं खरत्रिशिरसोरुत्थानं रावणस्य च । मारीचस्य वधं चैव वैदेह्या हरणं तथा ।।
राघवस्य विलापं च गृध्रराजनिबर्हणम् । कबन्धदर्शनं चैव पम्पायाश्चापि दर्शनम् ।।
शर्बर्या दर्शनं चैव हनूमद्दर्शनं तथा । विलापं चैव पम्पायां राघवस्य महात्मनः ।।
ऋष्यमूकस्य गमनं सुग्रीवेण समागमम् । प्रत्ययोत्पादनं सख्यं वालिसुग्रीवविग्रहम् ।।
data.es: (He described) Rama's departure for Rishyamuka mountain, his meeting with Sugriva and the pact of friendship with him, inspiring confidence in him and the combat between Sugriva and Vali.

data.v: वालिप्रमथनं चैव सुग्रीवप्रतिपादनम् । ताराविलापसमयं वर्षरात्रिनिवासनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the killing of Vali (by Rama), the installation of Sugriva, the mourning of Tara, the waiting (for the search of Sita as per the pact of friendship with Sugriva), and the sojourn on the mountain during the rainy season.

data.v: कोपं राघवसिंहस्य बलानामुपसंग्रहम् । दिशः प्रस्थापनं चैव पृथिव्याश्च निवेदनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the anger of Rama, the lion in the race of the Raghus (over the delay by Sugriva), the consolidation of the monkey forces, the despatch of envoys to different directions, the report (about the different places) on earth.

data.v: अङ्गुलीयकदानं च ऋक्षस्य बिलदर्शनम् । प्रायोपवेशनं चैव संपातेश्चापि दर्शनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the delivery of the ring (to Hanuman by Rama), the entry into the cave of the riksha, the preparations for their fast unto death, and the meeting with Sampati.

data.v: पर्वतारोहणं चैव सागरस्य च लङ्घनम् । रात्रौ लङ्काप्रवेशं च एकस्यापि विचिन्तनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the climbing of Mahendra mountain (by Hanuman), crossing the sea emergence of Mainaka hill at the command of the lord of ocean.

data.v: आपानभूमिगमनमवरोधस्य दर्शनम् । अशोकवनिकायानं सीतायाश्चापि दर्शनम् ।।
अभिज्ञानप्रदानं च सीतायाश्चापि भाषणम् । राक्षसीतर्जनं चैव त्रिजटास्वप्नदर्शनम् ।।
मणिप्रदानं सीताया वृक्षभङ्गं तथैव च । राक्षसीविद्रवं चैव किंकराणां निबर्हणम् ।।
ग्रहणं वायुसूनोश्च लङ्कादाहाभिगर्जनम् । प्रतिप्लवनमेवाथ मधूनां हरणं तथा ।।
राघवाश्वासनं चैव मणिनिर्यातनं तथा । संगमं च समुद्रस्य नलसेतोश्च बन्धनम् ।।
प्रतारं च समुद्रस्य रात्रौ लङ्कावरोधनम् । विभीषणेन संसर्गं वधोपायनिवेदनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) the meeting with the (lord of the) seas, the construction of bridge by Nala, the crossing of the ocean and the seige of Lanka during night.

data.v: कुम्भकर्णस्य निधनं मेघनादनिबर्हणम् । रावणस्य विनाशं च सीतावाप्तिमरेः पुरे ।।
बिभीषणाभिषेकं च पुष्पकस्य च दर्शनम् । अयोध्यायाश्च गमनं भरतेन समागमम् ।।
रामाभिषेकाभ्युदयं सर्वसैन्यविसर्जनम् । स्वराष्ट्ररञ्जनं चैव वैदेह्याश्च विसर्जनम् ।।
data.es: (He described) Rama's return to Ayodhya, the reunion with Bharata, the festive occasion of Rama's coronation disbanding the entire forces, keeping his subjects happy and banishing Sita (in the forest).

data.v: अनागतं च यत्किंचिद्रामस्य वसुधातले । तच्चकारोत्तरे काव्ये वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषिः ।।
data.es: Divine sage Valmiki composed events yet to happen on this earth in the history of Rama in Uttarakanda. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the third sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: प्राप्तराज्यस्य रामस्य वाल्मीकिर्भगवानृषिः । चकार चरितं कृत्स्नं विचित्रपदमात्मवान् ।।
data.es: The divine sage Valmiki, composed in wonderful lines the entire lifestory of Rama who regained his kingdom.

data.v: कृत्वा तु तन्महाप्राज्ञः सभविष्यं सहोत्तरम् । चिन्तयामास को न्वेतत्प्रयुञ्जीयादिति प्रभुः ।।
data.es: The great intellectual and competent Valmiki having composed the Ramayanam including the events of Uttarakanda as well as future events, reflected as to who could translate into performance the epic.

data.v: तस्य चिन्तयमानस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । अगृह्णीतां ततः पादौ मुनिवेषौ कुशीलवौ ।।
data.es: While the highly honoured sage Valmiki was thus pondering over, Kusa and Lava came to him in the garb of ascetics and bowed at his feet.

data.v: कुशीलवौ तु धर्मज्ञौ राजपुत्रौ यशस्विनौ । भ्रातरौ स्वरसंपन्नौ ददर्शाश्रमवासिनौ ।।
data.es: The sage saw the two illustrious princely brothers, wellversed in dharma and endowed with a sweet voice living in the hermitage.

data.v: स तु मेधाविनौ दृष्ट्वा वेदेषु परिनिष्ठितौ । वेदोपबृह्मणार्थाय तावग्राहयत प्रभुः ।।
data.es: Valmiki, the master, having found both Kusa and Lava endowed with intellect and accomplished in the Vedas initiated them into the Ramayana composed by him for the purpose of nourishing the Vedas.

data.v: काव्यं रामायणं कृत्स्नं सीतायाश्चरितं महत् । पौलस्त्य वधमित्येव चकार चरितव्रतः ।।
data.es: Valmiki who practised religious austerities composed this entire epic named the Ramayana which constitutes the great history of Sita and the killing of Paulastya (Ravana).

data.v: पाठ्ये गेये च मधुरं प्रमाणैस्त्रिभिरन्वितम् । जातिभिः सप्तभिर्बद्धं तन्त्रीलयसमन्वितम् ।।
हास्यशृङ्गारकारुण्यरौद्रवीरभयानकैः । बीभत्सादिरसैर्युक्तं काव्यमेतदगायताम् ।।
तौ तु गान्धर्वतत्त्वज्ञौ मूर्च्छनास्थानकोविदौ । भ्रातरौ स्वरसंपन्नौ गन्धर्वाविव रूपिणौ ।।
data.es: The sage saw the two illustrious princely brothers, wellversed in dharma and endowed with a sweet voice living in the hermitage.

data.v: रूपलक्षणसंपन्नौ मधुरस्वरभाषिणौ । बिम्बादिवोद्धृतौ बिम्बौ रामदेहात्तथापरौ ।।
तौ राजपुत्रौ कार्त्स्न्येन धर्म्यमाख्यानमुत्तमम् । वाचो विधेयं तत्सर्वं कृत्वा काव्यमनिन्दितौ ।।
data.es: These two princes blameless, disciplined and wellversed, committed to memory the whole epic and chanted as instructed in the assembly of rishis, brahmins and saints.

data.v: ऋषीणां च द्विजातीनां साधूनां च समागमे । यथोपदेशं तत्त्वज्ञौ जगतुस्तौ समाहितौ । महात्मानौ महाभागौ सर्वलक्षणलक्षितौ ।।
तौ कदाचित्समेतानामृषीणां भावितात्मनाम् । आसीनानां समीपस्थाविदं काव्यमगायताम् ।।
data.es: On a particular occasion both the great princes who were dignified and endowed with good features, chanted this great epic in the presence of honoured ascetics who assembled at one place.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा मुनयः सर्वे बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणाः । साधु साध्वित्य्तावूचतुः परं विस्मयमागताः ।।
data.es: All the sages having heard the chanting (of that glorious kavya), experienced great astonishment. Overcome with tears of joy in their eyes, they praised them, exclaiming "Excellent, Excellent".

data.v: ते प्रीतमनसः सर्वे मुनयो धर्मवत्सलाः । प्रशशंसुः प्रशस्तव्यौ गायमानौ कुशीलवौ ।।
data.es: All the sages steeped in dharma, pleased with them, praised the admirable Kusa and Lava as they sang.

data.v: अहो गीतस्य माधुर्यं श्लोकानां च विशेषतः । चिरनिर्वृत्तमप्येतत्प्रत्यक्षमिव दर्शितम् ।।
data.es: How melodious is this chanting, especially the verses Though it (the events) had happened long ago, it is described as if it is happening at the present moment, exclaimed the audience.

data.v: प्रविश्य तावुभौ सुष्ठु तदा भावमगायताम् । सहितौ मधुरं रक्तं संपन्नं स्वरसंपदा ।।
data.es: They both chanted in perfect unison in theme and passion, with their charming melodious voice endowed with the rich notes of music (sadja and other).

data.v: एवं प्रशस्यमानौ तौ तपःश्लाघ्यैर्महर्षिभिः । संरक्ततरमत्यर्थं मधुरं तावगायताम् ।।
data.es: Praised in this manner by the great sages commendable for their austerities, they chanted even with greater charm and sweetness.

data.v: प्रीतः कश्चिन्मुनिस्ताभ्यां संस्थितः कलशं ददौ । प्रसन्नो वल्कलं कश्चिद्ददौ ताभ्यां महायशाः ।।
data.es: Pleased with the singing, one of the sages seated in the assembly presented them a pitcher. Another sage of renown got so delighted that he gave them garments.

data.v: आश्चर्यमिदमाख्यानं मुनिना संप्रकीर्तितम् । परं कवीनामाधारं समाप्तं च यथाक्रमम् ।।
data.es: This wonderful epic chronologically composed and completed by the sage (Valmiki), is the supreme source for poetry.

data.v: प्रशस्यमानौ सर्वत्र कदाचित्तत्र गायकौ । रथ्यासु राजमार्गेषु ददर्श भरताग्रजः ।।
data.es: The two singers, proficient in all kinds of notes recited the epic in the streets and on the principal roads. It was pleasing to hear for all. It gave long life and prosperity to the listeners. People admired them. Once Rama happened to see them.

data.v: स्ववेश्म चानीय ततो भ्रातरौ सकुशीलवौ । पूजयामास पूजार्हौ रामः शत्रुनिबर्हणः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Rama, the destroyer of enemies, having invited the two brothers Kusa and Lava who deserved honour. He brought them to his royal palace and extended respectful hospitality.

data.v: आसीनः काञ्चने दिव्ये स च सिंहासने प्रभुः । उपोपविष्टैः सचिवैर्भ्रातृभिश्च परंतपः ।।
data.es: Rama, the tormentor of enemies, surrounded by his ministers and brothers occupied the splendid golden throne.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तु रूपसंपन्नौ तावुभौ वीणिनौ ततः । उवाच लक्ष्मणं रामः शत्रुघ्नं भरतं तथा ।।
data.es: Then selfpossessed Rama, having seen those very handsome brothers (Kusa and Lava), addressed Lakshmana, Satrughna and Bharata, saying:

data.v: श्रूयतामिदमाख्यानमनयोर्देववर्चसोः । विचित्रार्थपदं सम्यग्गायतोर्मधुरस्वरम् ।।
data.es: "Listen to this story sung by both of them, portraying excellent sense and words". Having said this, Rama urged the singers with the lustre of devatas to commence.

data.v: इमौ मुनी पार्थिवलक्ष्मणान्वितौ; कुशीलवौ चैव महातपस्विनौ । ममापि तद्भूतिकरं प्रचक्षते; महानुभावं चरितं निबोधत ।।
data.es: Addressing the assembly of men Rama said "Both Kusa and Lava, even though ascetics, are endowed with the attributes of royalty. Eventhough they are singers, they are ascetics. This is even conducive to my wellbeing. Listen to the meaningful story with concentration".

data.v: ततस्तु तौ रामवचः प्रचोदिता;वगायतां मार्गविधानसंपदा । स चापि रामः परिषद्गतः शनै;र्बुभूषयासक्तमना बभूव ह ।।
data.es: Encouraged by the words of Rama, the two brothers chanted according to marga mode of singing (classical style). Even Rama who was in the assembly desirous of peace, concentrated his mind on that chanting.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana in synopsis of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: सर्वापूर्वमियं येषामासीत्कृत्स्ना वसुंधरा । प्रजापतिमुपादाय नृपाणां जयशालिनाम् ।।
data.es: Formerly, this entire earth belonged to those victorious kings starting from Prajapati (Manu).

data.v: येषां स सगरो नाम सागरो येन खानितः । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि यं यान्तं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: Among them a king named Sagara got the ocean dug and his sixty thousand sons surrounded him whenever he went (to battle).

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणामिदं तेषां राज्ञां वंशे महात्मनाम् । महदुत्पन्नमाख्यानं रामायणमिति श्रुतम् ।।
data.es: It was from the family of mighty monarchs with Ikshvaku as its founder and the kings born in that race, the celebrated epic known as the 'Ramayanam' arose.

data.v: तदिदं वर्तयिष्यामि सर्वं निखिलमादितः । धर्मकामार्थसहितं श्रोतव्यमनसूयया ।।
data.es: I shall propagate this Ramayanam, incorporating the merits of dharma, artha and kama, and complete in all respects. It deserves to be heard right from the start without prejudice.

data.v: कोसलो नाम मुदितः स्फीतो जनपदो महान् । निविष्टः सरयूतीरे प्रभूतधनधान्यवान् ।।
data.es: On the banks of river Sarayu, a great and prosperous country named Kosala, abundant in foodgrains and wealth and inhabited by contended people, was situated.

data.v: अयोध्या नाम नगरी तत्रासील्लोकविश्रुता । मनुना मानवेन्द्रेण या पुरी निर्मिता स्वयम् ।।
data.es: In the country called Kosala was the famous capital city of Ayodhya built by the lord of men, Manu .

data.v: आयता दश च द्वे च योजनानि महापुरी । श्रीमती त्रीणि विस्तीर्णा सुविभक्तमहापथा ।।
data.es: With welllaid out thoroughfares, the beautiful and prosperous city of Ayodhya extended for twelve yojanas in length and three yojanas in breadth.

data.v: राजमार्गेण महता सुविभक्तेन शोभिता । मुक्तपुष्पावकीर्णेन जलसिक्तेन नित्यशः ।।
data.es: It looked splendid with its welllaid out and broad highway strewn with flowers and regularly sprinkled with water.

data.v: तां तु राजा दशरथो महाराष्ट्रविवर्धनः । पुरीमावासयामास दिवि देवपतिर्यथा ।।
data.es: King Dasartha, augmenting the prosperity of the great kingdom, lived in the city of Ayodhya like Indra in heaven.

data.v: कपाटतोरणवतीं सुविभक्तान्तरापणाम् । सर्वयन्त्रायुधवतीमुपेतां सर्वशिल्पिभिः ।।
data.es: The city where all kinds of artificers lived had arched outer gateways, wellarranged local markets and all kinds of instruments and weapons.

data.v: सूतमागधसंबाधां श्रीमतीमतुलप्रभाम् । उच्चाट्टालध्वजवतीं शतघ्नीशतसंकुलाम् ।।
data.es: With matchless splendour, it abounded in eulogists and genealogists. It contained stately edifices decorated with flags and hundreds of sataghnis (missiles).

data.v: वधूनाटकसङ्घैश्च संयुक्तां सर्वतः पुरीम् । उद्यानाम्रवणोपेतां महतीं सालमेखलाम् ।।
data.es: The city with suburban towns on all sides had several female dancers and actors.It was filled with gardens and mangogroves. And girdled by sal trees.

data.v: दुर्गगम्भीरपरिखां दुर्गामन्यैर्दुरासदाम् । वाजिवारणसंपूर्णां गोभिरुष्ट्रैः खरैस्तथा ।।
data.es: It was enclosed by strong fortifications and a deep moat. No enemy can ever enter and occupy that city. It abounded with several elephants and horses, cattle, camels and mules.

data.v: सामन्तराजसङ्घैश्च बलिकर्मभिरावृताम् । नानादेशनिवासैश्च वणिग्भिरुपशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: It was embellished with a host of tributary kings who used to pay tributes and with merchants from different countries.

data.v: प्रसादै रत्नविकृतैः पर्वतैरुपशोभिताम् । कूटागारैश्च संपूर्णामिन्द्रस्येवामरावतीम् ।।
data.es: Like Indra's Amaravati, it was adorned by mountains and mansions with precious stones.

data.v: चित्रामष्टापदाकारां वरनारीगणैर्युताम् । सर्वरत्नसमाकीर्णां विमानगृहशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: With groups of men and women and adorned with sevenstoried palaces, it looked wonderful like a board where the game of ashtapada, is played. It was rich in all kinds of gems.

data.v: गृहगाढामविच्छिद्रां समभूमौ निवेशिताम् । शालितण्डुलसंपूर्णामिक्षुकाण्डरसोदकाम् ।।
data.es: Its dwellings were constructed on levelled ground with no space left unutilised it was abundant stocked with fialgrained rice and water which fasted sweet like sugarcane juice.

data.v: दुन्दुभीभिर्मृदङ्गैश्च वीणाभिः पणवैस्तथा । नादितां भृशमत्यर्थं पृथिव्यां तामनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: The city echoed with the sounds of trumpets, mrudangas, vinas and panavas. There was no city on earth superior to Ayodhya.

data.v: विमानमिव सिद्धानां तपसाधिगतं दिवि । सुनिवेशितवेश्मान्तां नरोत्तमसमावृताम् ।।
data.es: Like an aerial car acquired by the siddhas in heaven through their austerities, the palaces were perfectly constructed in rows and inhabited by the noblest of men.

data.v: ये च बाणैर्न विध्यन्ति विविक्तमपरापरम् । शब्दवेध्यं च विततं लघुहस्ता विशारदाः ।।
सिंहव्याघ्रवराहाणां मत्तानां नदतां वने । हन्तारो निशितैः शस्त्रैर्बलाद्बाहुबलैरपि ।।
तादृशानां सहस्रैस्तामभिपूर्णां महारथैः । पुरीमावासयामास राजा दशरथस्तदा ।।
तामग्निमद्भिर्गुणवद्भिरावृतां; द्विजोत्तमैर्वेदषडङ्गपारगैः । सहस्रदैः सत्यरतैर्महात्मभि;र्महर्षिकल्पैरृषिभिश्च केवलैः ।।
data.es: That city (of Ayodhya) was filled with excellent dwijas (brahmana, kshatriya and vaisyas) performing rituals of sacrificial fire, virtuous and wellversed in the Vedas and Vedangas. They were generous, truthful and dignified. They were almost equal to rishis and maharshis.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fifth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: पुर्यां तस्यामयोध्यायां वेदवित्सर्वसंग्रहः । दीर्घदर्शी महातेजाः पौरजानपदप्रियः ।।
इक्ष्वाकूणामतिरथो यज्वा धर्मरतो वशी । महर्षिकल्पो राजर्षिस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ।।
बलवान्निहतामित्रो मित्रवान्विजितेन्द्रियः । धनैश्च संचयैश्चान्यैः शक्रवैश्रवणोपमः ।।
यथा मनुर्महातेजा लोकस्य परिरक्षिता । तथा दशरथो राजा वसञ्जगदपालयत् ।।
तेन सत्याभिसंधेन त्रिवर्गमनुतिष्ठता । पालिता सा पुरी श्रेष्ठेन्द्रेण इवामरावती ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha, who always kept his word and followed dharma, attained prosperity and pleasure in equal measure by righteous means ruled that best of the cities as Indra ruled Amaravati.

data.v: तस्मिन्पुरवरे हृष्टा धर्मात्मना बहुश्रुताः । नरास्तुष्टाधनैः स्वैः स्वैरलुब्धाः सत्यवादिनः ।।
data.es: The people living in that excellent city were happy, virtuous, wellread (in the Vedas and the sastras) and content with the possessions of their own. They were free from avarice. And always spoke the truth.

data.v: नाल्पसंनिचयः कश्चिदासीत्तस्मिन्पुरोत्तमे । कुटुम्बी यो ह्यसिद्धार्थोऽगवाश्वधनधान्यवान् ।।
data.es: In that best of cities, there was not even a single householder who had not adequate wealth or who had not achieved dharma, artha and kama or who did not possess the wealth of foodgrains, cattle and horses.

data.v: कामी वा न कदर्यो वा नृशंसः पुरुषः क्वचित् । द्रष्टुं शक्यमयोध्यायां नाविद्वान्न च नास्तिकः ।।
data.es: The lustful, the miserly, the unscholarly and atheists were not to be seen anywhere in the city of Ayodhya.

data.v: सर्वे नराश्च नार्यश्च धर्मशीलाः सुसंयताः । मुदिताः शीलवृत्ताभ्यां महर्षय इवामलाः ।।
data.es: All men and women (in the city) were of righteous conduct, fully selfcontrolled and prosperous with good conduct and behaviour. They were pure like maharshis.

data.v: नाकुण्डली नामुकुटी नास्रग्वी नाल्पभोगवान् । नामृष्टो नानुलिप्ताङ्गो नासुगन्धश्च विद्यते ।।
data.es: In the city, there was none without earornaments, without coronet, without wearing garlands and none unclean. And none without the anointment of fragrants on the body.

data.v: नामृष्टभोजी नादाता नाप्यनङ्गदनिष्कधृक् । नाहस्ताभरणो वापि दृश्यते नाप्यनात्मवान् ।।
data.es: (In the city of Ayodhya) there was no one who did not eat food to full satisfaction and was not charitable. None was found without wearing ornaments on the hands and bracelets on the upper arms and around the neck. Also no one could be seen who had not restrained his passions and emotions.

data.v: नानाहिताग्निर्नायज्वा विप्रो नाप्यसहस्रदः । कश्चिदासीदयोध्यायां न च निर्वृत्तसंकरः ।।
data.es: In the city of Ayodhya there was none who did not kindle the sacrificial fire. There was none who did not perform a sacrifice. There were no thieves or meanminded persons or persons of improper descent of mixed castes.

data.v: स्वकर्मनिरता नित्यं ब्राह्मणा विजितेन्द्रियाः । दानाध्ययनशीलाश्च संयताश्च प्रतिग्रहे ।।
data.es: The brahmins were always interested in the performance of their duties. They had control over their senses. They were charitable and studious. They were selfcontrolled while accepting charity and maintaining marital relations.

data.v: न नास्तिको नानृतको न कश्चिदबहुश्रुतः । नासूयको न चाशक्तो नाविद्वान्विद्यते तदा ।।
data.es: That time there was no atheist, no liar and none ignorant of the sastras. There was no one who was jealous, incompetent or illiterate.

data.v: न दीनः क्षिप्तचित्तो वा व्यथितो वापि कश्चन । कश्चिन्नरो वा नारी वा नाश्रीमान्नाप्यरूपवान् । द्रष्टुं शक्यमयोध्यायां नापि राजन्यभक्तिमान् ।।
data.es: In Ayodhya, there was no man or woman who was not endowed with wealth or beauty. It was not possible to see any one who had no devotion for the king.

data.v: वर्णेष्वग्र्यचतुर्थेषु देवतातिथिपूजकाः । दीर्घायुषो नराः सर्वे धर्मं सत्यं च संश्रिताः ।।
data.es: There in Ayodhya the best of cities, the first of the four castes (brahmins) used to worship gods and guests. They had the sense of gratitude. They were munificient, heroic and possessed prowess. They lived long. They were righteous and truthful. And they lived together with their sons, grandsons and wives.

data.v: क्षत्रं ब्रह्ममुखं चासीद्वैश्याः क्षत्रमनुव्रताः । शूद्राः स्वधर्मनिरतास्त्रीन्वर्णानुपचारिणः ।।
data.es: The kshatriyas were obedient to brahmins and vaisyas followed kshatriyas. Sudras assisted the three castes and all were fully occupied in their respective professions.

data.v: सा तेनेक्ष्वाकुनाथेन पुरी सुपरिरक्षिता । यथा पुरस्तान्मनुना मानवेन्द्रेण धीमता ।।
data.es: That city was ably governed by Dasaratha, scion of the Ikshvakus, in the same way as it was previously administered by (Manu), the foremost among men and and the most intelligent.

data.v: योधानामग्निकल्पानां पेशलानाममर्षिणाम् । संपूर्णाकृतविद्यानां गुहाकेसरिणामिव ।।
data.es: It abounded with warriors, like a cave with lions. They were almost like flaming fire, the most determined among experts and accomplished in learning (the science of arms).

data.v: काम्बोजविषये जातैर्बाह्लीकैश्च हयोत्तमैः । वनायुजैर्नदीजैश्च पूर्णाहरिहयोपमैः ।।
data.es: The city was full of excellent horses born in the regions of Kambhoja, Bahlika, Vanayu and Sindhu, similar to that of Indra's horse (called Ucchaisrava).

data.v: विन्ध्यपर्वतजैर्मत्तैः पूर्णा हैमवतैरपि । मदान्वितैरतिबलैर्मातङ्गैः पर्वतोपमैः ।।
data.es: It was full of intoxicated elephants born in Vindhya mountains, elephants of enormous strength looking like mountains and born in the Himalayas. Elephants of good breed hailing from the family of Airavata (Indra's vehicle), Mahapadma, Anjana and Vamana.

data.v: अञ्जनादपि निष्क्रान्तैर्वामनादपि च द्विपैः । भद्रमन्द्रैर्भद्रमृगैर्मृगमन्द्रैश्च सा पुरी ।।
नित्यमत्तैः सदा पूर्णा नागैरचलसंनिभैः । सा योजने च द्वे भूयः सत्यनामा प्रकाशते ।।
तां सत्यनामां दृढतोरणार्गला;म्गृहैर्विचित्रैरुपशोभितां शिवाम् । पुरीमयोध्यां नृसहस्रसंकुलां; शशास वै शक्रसमो महीपतिः ।।
data.es: The king who equalled Indra (in splendour) ruled the invincible city of Ayodhya true to its name with its strong gates and solid locks. It was adorned with wonderful edifices teeming with thousands of men. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अष्टौ बभूवुर्वीरस्य तस्यामात्या यशस्विनः । शुचयश्चानुरक्ताश्च राजकृत्येषु नित्यशः ।।
data.es: The mighty and glorious (king Dasaratha) had eight ministers who were free from blemish in their dealings and ever devoted to royal duties.

data.v: धृष्टिर्जयन्तो विजयः सिद्धार्थो अर्थसाधकः । अशोको मन्त्रपालश्च सुमन्त्रश्चाष्टमोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: The eight ministers were Dhrishti, Jayanta,Vijaya, Siddhartha, Arthasadhaka, Ashoka, Mantrapala and Sumantra.

data.v: ऋत्विजौ द्वावभिमतौ तस्यास्तामृषिसत्तमौ । वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च मन्त्रिणश्च तथापरे ।।
data.es: He had two wellchosen excellent rishis, Vasishta and Vamadeva, as family priests besides some other counsellors.

data.v: श्रीमन्तश्च महात्मानः शास्त्रज्ञा दृढविक्रमाः । कीर्तिमन्तः प्रणिहिता यथावचनकारिणः ।।
data.es: They were welleducated in all branches of knowledge and deemed unjust acts shameful. They were renowned, proficient, versed in sastras, wealthy and magnanimous. They had their senses restrained and their deeds were in accordance with their words. They acted with determination. They were brilliant, forgiving and reputed. And always spoke with a smile.

data.v: तेजःक्षमायशःप्राप्ताः स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषिणः । क्रोधात्कामार्थहेतोर्वा न ब्रूयुरनृतं वचः ।।
तेषामविदितं किंचित्स्वेषु नास्ति परेषु वा । क्रियमाणं कृतं वापि चारेणापि चिकीर्षितम् ।।
data.es: Either in anger or for pecuniary gains or for fulfilment of desire, they never uttered an untrue or unjust word. In the midst of their own people or among their enemies, they knew, through spies everything being done or had been done or intended to be done in future.

data.v: कुशला व्यवहारेषु सौहृदेषु परीक्षिताः । प्राप्तकालं यथा दण्डं धारयेयुः सुतेष्वपि ।।
data.es: They knew how to deal (with people). They were true to their friends. They used to impose appropriate punishment even on their own sons.

data.v: कोशसंग्रहणे युक्ता बलस्य च परिग्रहे । अहितं चापि पुरुषं न विहिंस्युरदूषकम् ।।
data.es: They were experts in replenishing the exchequer and in collecting the army. They never inflicted any punishment even on those who were not their wellwishers, if they did not commit any offence.

data.v: वीराश्च नियतोत्साहा राजशास्त्रमनुष्ठिताः । शुचीनां रक्षितारश्च नित्यं विषयवासिनाम् ।।
data.es: They were heroic. They possessed steady perseverance. They followed the state policy and always protected the virtuous people living in the state.

data.v: ब्रह्मक्षत्रमहिंसन्तस्ते कोशं समपूरयन् । सुतीक्ष्णदण्डाः संप्रेक्ष्य पुरुषस्य बलाबलम् ।।
data.es: While ensuring that they did not cause pain to brahmanas and kshatriyas (in thought, word and deed), they filled the treasury. They inflicted stringent punishments on a man after examining his strength and weakness.

data.v: शुचीनामेकबुद्धीनां सर्वेषां संप्रजानताम् । नासीत्पुरे वा राष्ट्रे वा मृषावादी नरः क्वचित् ।।
data.es: While the ministers of chaste conduct administered the kingdom with unanimous decisions, there was no one who was a liar, either in the city or in the kingdom.

data.v: कश्चिन्न दुष्टस्तत्रासीत्परदाररतिर्नरः । प्रशान्तं सर्वमेवासीद्राष्ट्रं पुरवरं च तत् ।।
data.es: In that kingdom no one was wicked or enamoured of others' wives. Serenity prevailed over the entire kingdom including the city of excellence.

data.v: सुवाससः सुवेशाश्च ते च सर्वे सुशीलिनः । हितार्थं च नरेन्द्रस्य जाग्रतो नयचक्षुषा ।।
data.es: They all were welldressed in fine clothes. They possessed good character with an eye on justice and vigilant about the king's welfare.

data.v: गुरौ गुणगृहीताश्च प्रख्याताश्च पराक्रमैः । विदेशेष्वपि विज्ञाताः सर्वतो बुद्धिनिश्चयात् ।।
data.es: They imbibed virtues from the elderlies. They were renowned in prowess. They were guided by their intellect in all affairs. They were wellknown everywhere.

data.v: ईदृशैस्तैरमात्यैस्तु राजा दशरथोऽनघः । उपपन्नो गुणोपेतैरन्वशासद्वसुंधराम् ।।
data.es: The faultless king Dasaratha, with the assistance of such ministers endowed with virtues, ruled the earth.

data.v: अवेक्षमाणश्चारेण प्रजा धर्मेण रञ्जयन् । नाध्यगच्छद्विशिष्टं वा तुल्यं वा शत्रुमात्मनः ।।
तैर्मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रहितैर्निविष्टै;र्वृतोऽनुरक्तैः कुशलैः समर्थैः । स पार्थिवो दीप्तिमवाप युक्त;स्तेजोमयैर्गोभिरिवोदितोऽर्कः ।।
data.es: Accompanied by the ministers who were devoted to his welfare, adept in counselling, skilful, capable and loyal towards him, the king acquired glory like the rising Sun with luminous rays.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्ग: ।। Thus ends the seventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तस्य त्वेवं प्रभावस्य धर्मज्ञस्य महात्मनः । सुतार्थं तप्यमानस्य नासीद्वंशकरः सुतः ।।
data.es: Such a majestic, righteous, and magnaninous king had no son to perpetuate the race even though he performed austerities for one.

data.v: चिन्तयानस्य तस्यैवं बुद्धिरासीन्महात्मनः । सुतार्थं वाजिमेधेन किमर्थं न यजाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: While reflecting over the matter, a thought struck the magnanimous king: 'Why not invoke gods by performing a horsesacrifice for a son'.

data.v: स निश्चितां मतिं कृत्वा यष्टव्यमिति बुद्धिमान् । मन्त्रिभिः सह धर्मात्मा सर्वैरेव कृतात्मभिः ।।
data.es: Having made up his mind to perform the sacrifice, that sagacious and pious king, in consultation with his wise ministers, issued the following command to Sumantra, the best of ministers "Bring all my spritual preceptors along with family priests."

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीदिदं राजा सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रिसत्तमम् । शीघ्रमानय मे सर्वान्गुरूंस्तान्सपुरोहितान् ।।
data.es: Having made up his mind to perform the sacrifice, that sagacious and pious king, in consultation with his wise ministers, issued the following command to Sumantra, the best of ministers "Bring all my spritual preceptors along with family priests."

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा रहः सूतो राजानमिदमब्रवीत् । ऋत्विग्भिरुपदिष्टोऽयं पुरावृत्तो मया श्रुतः ।।
data.es: After sending away the brahmins, the king said to his ministers: "Let this sacrifice be performed as enjoined by scriptures and as directed by the officiating priests".

data.v: सनत्कुमारो भगवान्पूर्वं कथितवान्कथाम् । ऋषीणां संनिधौ राजंस्तव पुत्रागमं प्रति ।।
data.es: "O king, the divine Sanatkumara had narrated a story about your posterity in the presence of sages.

data.v: काश्यपस्य तु पुत्रोऽस्ति विभाण्डक इति श्रुतः । ऋश्यशृङ्ग इति ख्यातस्तस्य पुत्रो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Kasyapa has a famous son named Vibhandaka. It was prophesied that he would have a son named Rsyasringa.

data.v: स वने नित्यसंवृद्धो मुनिर्वनचरः सदा । नान्यं जानाति विप्रेन्द्रो नित्यं पित्रनुवर्तनात् ।।
data.es: Grown up in the forest and always moving with his father, that sage knows none other than his father.

data.v: द्वैविध्यं ब्रह्मचर्यस्य भविष्यति महात्मनः । लोकेषु प्रथितं राजन्विप्रैश्च कथितं सदा ।।
data.es: O eminent king, sage Rsyasringa celebrated in the three worlds who practises a twofold brahmacharya life (life of celebacy) described by brahmins (as vratitva and prajapatya).

data.v: तस्यैवं वर्तमानस्य कालः समभिवर्तत । अग्निं शुश्रूषमाणस्य पितरं च यशस्विनम् ।।
data.es: Worshipping the firegod and attending on his renowned father, he will spend a long time living in this manner (practising vratitva mode of brahmacharya).

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु लोमपादः प्रतापवान् । अङ्गेषु प्रथितो राजा भविष्यति महाबलः ।।
data.es: At this time a powerful king Romapada, mighty and celebrated would be living in the country of Anga.

data.v: तस्य व्यतिक्रमाद्राज्ञो भविष्यति सुदारुणा । अनावृष्टिः सुघोरा वै सर्वभूतभयावहा ।।
data.es: Because of violation of code of conduct by the king, a terrible, dreadful drought frightening all living beings will set in the kingdom.

data.v: अनावृष्ट्यां तु वृत्तायां राजा दुःखसमन्वितः । ब्राह्मणाञ्श्रुतवृद्धांश्च समानीय प्रवक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: With drought prevailing, the griefstricken king, would summon all those grown old with learning and tell them.

data.v: भवन्तः श्रुतधर्माणो लोकचारित्रवेदिनः । समादिशन्तु नियमं प्रायश्चित्तं यथा भवेत् ।।
वक्ष्यन्ति ते महीपालं ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । विभाण्डकसुतं राजन्सर्वोपायैरिहानय ।।
data.es: Those brahmins versed in the Vedas, said, to 'O king bring here Rsyasringa, son of the sage Vibhandaka by all means'.

data.v: आनाय्य च महीपाल ऋश्यशृङ्गं सुसत्कृतम् । प्रयच्छ कन्यां शान्तां वै विधिना सुसमाहितः ।।
data.es: "O monarch, on having brought Rsyasringa here, honour him, and offer him your daughter Santa with due reverence.

data.v: तेषां तु वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा चिन्तां प्रपत्स्यते । केनोपायेन वै शक्यमिहानेतुं स वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: On hearing their words, the king in a thoughtful mood said, 'How can the mighty sage be brought here'?

data.v: ततो राजा विनिश्चित्य सह मन्त्रिभिरात्मवान् । पुरोहितममात्यांश्च प्रेषयिष्यति सत्कृतान् ।।
data.es: Thereafter the confident king, having decided, in consultation with his ministers to bring him (Rsyasringa), sent the priest with the counsellors on this mission.

data.v: ते तु राज्ञो वचः श्रुत्वा व्यथिता वनताननाः । न गच्छेम ऋषेर्भीता अनुनेष्यन्ति तं नृपम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the king's words, distressed and frightened by rishi's power, they appealed to the king, faces bent down, 'We will not go'.

data.v: वक्ष्यन्ति चिन्तयित्वा ते तस्योपायांश्च तान्क्षमान् । आनेष्यामो वयं विप्रं न च दोषो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: After thinking about the means to be employed to bring the rishi to the court, they told him they would bring the sage if they are not to blame (in case anything untoward happens).

data.v: एवमङ्गाधिपेनैव गणिकाभिरृषेः सुतः । आनीतोऽवर्षयद्देवः शान्ता चास्मै प्रदीयते ।।
data.es: Thus with the help of courtesans of the king of Anga, when the son of the sage (Rsyasringa) was brought rains followed. The king offered his daughter Santa (in marriage to the sage).

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गस्तु जामाता पुत्रांस्तव विधास्यति । सनत्कुमारकथितमेतावद्व्याहृतं मया ।।
data.es: 'Risyasringa, your soninlaw, would help you to obtain sons'. Thus said Sanathkumara which I have related to you.

data.v: अथ हृष्टो दशरथः सुमन्त्रं प्रत्यभाषत । यथर्ष्यशृङ्गस्त्वानीतो विस्तरेण त्वयोच्यताम् ।।
data.es: Thereupon Dasaratha, pleased, (with him), said to Sumantra, "Describe in detail the means by which Rsyasringa was brought (to the court of Romapada)".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे नवमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the ninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana of the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: सुमन्त्रश्चोदितो राज्ञा प्रोवाचेदं वचस्तदा । यथर्ष्यशृङ्गस्त्वानीतः शृणु मे मन्त्रिभिः सह ।।
data.es: Thus prompted by king Dasaratha, Sumantra said, "I shall relate to you the manner in which Rsyasringa was brought to the court. Listen to me along with your ministers".

data.v: लोमपादमुवाचेदं सहामात्यः पुरोहितः । उपायो निरपायोऽयमस्माभिरभिचिन्तितः ।।
data.es: The priest accompanied by ministers said to Romapada, "We have thought over a plan which will never fail."

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गो वनचरस्तपःस्वाध्यायने रतः । अनभिज्ञः स नारीणां विषयाणां सुखस्य च ।।
data.es: "Rsyasringa, residing in the forest, is engrossed in the study of the Vedas. He is not acquainted with women and sensual pleasures.

data.v: इन्द्रियार्थैरभिमतैर्नरचित्तप्रमाथिभिः । पुरमानाययिष्यामः क्षिप्रं चाध्यवसीयताम् ।।
data.es: By means of such things that can cause sensual pleasures and overpower the minds of men, we shall be able to bring him to the town. Let it be decided quickly (said the ministers)

data.v: गणिकास्तत्र गच्छन्तु रूपवत्यः स्वलंकृताः । प्रलोभ्य विविधोपायैरानेष्यन्तीह सत्कृताः ।।
data.es: Beautiful and welladorned courtesans, may be sent there. They will allure him by various means and honourably bring him here.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तथेति राजा च प्रत्युवाच पुरोहितम् । पुरोहितो मन्त्रिणश्च तथा चक्रुश्च ते तदा ।।
data.es: The king, having listened to these words, conveyed his approval saying, 'Let it be done that way'. The priests and ministers acted accordingly.

data.v: वारमुख्यास्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा वनं प्रविविशुर्महत् । आश्रमस्याविदूरेऽस्मिन्यत्नं कुर्वन्ति दर्शने । ऋषिपुत्रस्य घोरस्य नित्यमाश्रमवासिनः ।।
data.es: Having heard this, beautiful courtesans entered the great forest and remaining at a place not far from the hermitage made efforts to steal a sight of this son of a sage (Rsyasringa), this forest dweller, this controller of the senses.

data.v: पितुः स नित्यसंतुष्टो नातिचक्राम चाश्रमात् ।।
न तेन जन्मप्रभृति दृष्टपूर्वं तपस्विना । स्त्री वा पुमान्वा यच्चान्यत्सत्त्वं नगरराष्ट्रजम् ।।
data.es: He (Rsyasringa) was always content and never stirred out of his father's hermitage. Absorbed in penance he had never seen a woman or a man nor any of the creatures born in towns or cities right from his birth.

data.v: ततः कदाचित्तं देशमाजगाम यदृच्छया । विभाण्डकसुतस्तत्र ताश्चापश्यद्वराङ्गनाः ।।
data.es: One day this son of Vibhandaka (Rsyasringa) accidentally came to the place where he saw the beautiful women.

data.v: ताश्चित्रवेषाः प्रमदा गायन्त्यो मधुरस्वरैः । ऋषिपुत्रमुपागम्य सर्वा वचनमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Those wonderfully attired women singing with sweet voices approached the son of the sage (Rsyasringa) and said:

data.v: कस्त्वं किं वर्तसे ब्रह्मञ्ज्ञातुमिच्छामहे वयम् । एकस्त्वं विजने घोरे वने चरसि शंस नः ।।
data.es: 'O brahman Who are you? How are you subsisting? We wish to know why you are roaming alone in this dreadful forest? Could you tell us.'

data.v: अदृष्टरूपास्तास्तेन काम्यरूपा वने स्त्रियः । हार्दात्तस्य मतिर्जाता आख्यातुं पितरं स्वकम् ।।
data.es: He had never seen such charming women in the forest. He developed affection towards them and a desire arose in him to speak about his father.

data.v: पिता विभाण्डकोऽस्माकं तस्याहं सुत औरसः । ऋश्यशृङ्ग इति ख्यातं नाम कर्म च मे भुवि ।।
data.es: 'My father is Vibhandaka. I am his own son. My name is Rsyasringa. I am known the world over by this name associated with my karma'.

data.v: इहाश्रमपदोऽस्माकं समीपे शुभदर्शनाः । करिष्ये वोऽत्र पूजां वै सर्वेषां विधिपूर्वकम् ।।
data.es: 'O auspiciouslooking women, our hermitage is nearby. I will extend to you due hospitality'.

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वासां मतिरास वै । तदाश्रमपदं द्रष्टुं जग्मुः सर्वाश्च तेन ह ।।
data.es: After listening to the words of the sage's son (Rsyasringa), all the beautiful women with a desire to see the hermitage accompanied him.

data.v: गतानां तु ततः पूजामृषिपुत्रश्चकार ह । इदमर्घ्यमिदं पाद्यमिदं मूलं फलं च नः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the son of ascetic respectfully received the the strangers saying, "(Accept) our offerings, here is water for washing feet and here are roots and fruits".

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य तु तां पूजां सर्वा एव समुत्सुकाः । ऋषेर्भीताश्च शीघ्रं तु गमनाय मतिं दधुः ।।
data.es: The anxious courtesans received the offerings and afraid of the ascetic's return, made up their minds to withdraw immediately.

data.v: अस्माकमपि मुख्यानि फलानीमानि वै द्विज । गृहाण प्रति भद्रं ते भक्षयस्व च मा चिरम् ।।
data.es: 'O brahmin, these are excellent fruits. May prosperity be to you. Accept them and eat them without delay.'

data.v: ततस्तास्तं समालिङ्ग्य सर्वा हर्षसमन्विताः । मोदकान्प्रददुस्तस्मै भक्ष्यांश्च विविधाञ्शुभान् ।।
data.es: Then, all the courtesans embracing him with joy, offered plentiful sweetmeats and various items of food.

data.v: तानि चास्वाद्य तेजस्वी फलानीति स्म मन्यते । अनास्वादितपूर्वाणि वने नित्यनिवासिना ।।
data.es: The lustrous (Rsyasringa) who had never tasted any food other than what was offered by the permanent forestdwellers mistook them for fruits.

data.v: आपृच्छ्य च तदा विप्रं व्रतचर्यां निवेद्य च । गच्छन्ति स्मापदेशात्ता भीतास्तस्य पितुः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: The ladies apprehensive of (the arrival of) his father took leave of him on the pretext of observance of (evening) rites.

data.v: गतासु तासु सर्वासु काश्यपस्यात्मजो द्विजः । अस्वस्थहृदयश्चासीद्दुःखं स्म परिवर्तते ।।
data.es: When they all departed, Kasyapa's son, the brahmin roamed (Rsyasringa) with a restless mind charged with sorrow.

data.v: ततोऽपरेद्युस्तं देशमाजगाम स वीर्यवान् । मनोज्ञा यत्र ता दृष्टा वारमुख्याः स्वलंकृताः ।।
data.es: On the following day, the sage armed with the power of penance, came to the place where he had seen those enticing, welladorned courtesans.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव च तदा विप्रमायान्तं हृष्टमानसाः । उपसृत्य ततः सर्वास्तास्तमूचुरिदं वचः ।।
data.es: All of them were rejoiced on seeing the brahmin approaching them, came nearer to him and said:

data.v: एह्याश्रमपदं सौम्य अस्माकमिति चाब्रुवन् । तत्राप्येष विधिः श्रीमान्विशेषेण भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'O handsome one, come to our hermitage. A special, sumptuous hospitality will be extended to you', they said.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तासां सर्वासां हृदयंगमम् । गमनाय मतिं चक्रे तं च निन्युस्तदा स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Having heard their words pleasing to the mind, he agreed to go with them. And the women took him away.

data.v: तत्र चानीयमाने तु विप्रे तस्मिन्महात्मनि । ववर्ष सहसा देवो जगत्प्रह्लादयंस्तदा ।।
data.es: As the illustrious sage was being brought (to Anga) the god of rain (Parjanya) suddenly inundated the earth which looked cherful (with rain).

data.v: वर्षेणैवागतं विप्रं विषयं स्वं नराधिपः । प्रत्युद्गम्य मुनिं प्रह्वः शिरसा च महीं गतः ।।
data.es: The king (Romapada) went out to welcome the ascetic, the brahmin who brought along with him rains to his country. He humbly bowed down his head and prostrated before him.

data.v: अर्घ्यं च प्रददौ तस्मै न्यायतः सुसमाहितः । वव्रे प्रसादं विप्रेन्द्रान्मा विप्रं मन्युराविशेत् ।।
data.es: He gave that Indra among the brahmins offerings righteously with unstinted devotion and asked for his favour that he should not incur the wrath of the sage (his father Vibhandaka for having brought him to Anga).

data.v: अन्तःपुरं प्रविश्यास्मै कन्यां दत्त्वा यथाविधि । शान्तां शान्तेन मनसा राजा हर्षमवाप सः ।।
data.es: The king entered the inner apartment, duly offered him his daughter Shanta in marriage and experienced peace and satisfaction.Thus he (Rsyasringa) lived there, with all his desires fulfilled" (said Sumantra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे दशमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the tenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवं स न्यवसत्तत्र सर्वकामैः सुपूजितः । ऋश्यशृङ्गो महातेजाः शान्तया सह भार्यया ।।
भूय एव च राजेन्द्र शृणु मे वचनं हितम् । यथा स देवप्रवरः कथायामेवमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "Great king, I shall tell you the way Sanatkumara, great among the celestials further narrated the story. Listen to my words which may prove useful to you (said Sumantra)".

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातो भविष्यति सुधार्मिकः । राजा दशरथो नाम्ना श्रीमान्सत्यप्रतिश्रवः ।।
अङ्गराजेन सख्यं च तस्य राज्ञो भविष्यति । कन्या चास्य महाभागा शान्ता नाम भविष्यति ।।
data.es: That king (Dasaratha) will develop friendship with the king of Anga. A highly virtuous daughter named Santa will be born to king of Anga.

data.v: पुत्रस्त्वङ्गस्य राज्ञस्तु लोमपाद इति श्रुतः । तं स राजा दशरथो गमिष्यति महायशाः ।।
data.es: The famous king Dasaratha will approach the son of the king of Anga known as Romapada.

data.v: अनपत्योऽस्मि धर्मात्मञ्शान्ताभर्ता मम क्रतुम् । आहरेत त्वयाज्ञप्तः संतानार्थं कुलस्य च ।।
data.es: O righteous king I am issueless. Let Rsyasringa, husband of Santa be ordered to perform the a sacrificial ceremony so that I shall be blessed with I son for the perpetuaion of my race.

data.v: श्रुत्वा राज्ञोऽथ तद्वाक्यं मनसा स विचिन्त्य च । प्रदास्यते पुत्रवन्तं शान्ता भर्तारमात्मवान् ।।
data.es: On hearing his words and deeply thinking over the matter, the prudent Romapada agreed to send, Santa's husband (Rsyasringa), capable of blessing him with a son.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तं विप्रं स राजा विगतज्वरः । आहरिष्यति तं यज्ञं प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: The king relieved of his suffering, was highly delighted. He would take the brahmin with him and perform the sacrificial ritual.

data.v: तं च राजा दशरथो यष्टुकामः कृताञ्जलिः । ऋश्यशृङ्गं द्विजश्रेष्ठं वरयिष्यति धर्मवित् ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha, lord of the people, and knower of dharma and truth, desirous of performing the sacrifice would ask Rsyasringa, with folded palms for granting a boon to perform a sacrifice in order to obtain children and to attain heaven. The king will get those desires fulfilled through that chief brahmin.

data.v: यज्ञार्थं प्रसवार्थं च स्वर्गार्थं च नरेश्वरः । लभते च स तं कामं द्विजमुख्याद्विशां पतिः ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha, lord of the people, and knower of dharma and truth, desirous of performing the sacrifice would ask Rsyasringa, with folded palms for granting a boon to perform a sacrifice in order to obtain children and to attain heaven. The king will get those desires fulfilled through that chief brahmin.

data.v: पुत्राश्चास्य भविष्यन्ति चत्वारोऽमितविक्रमाः । वंशप्रतिष्ठानकराः सर्वलोकेषु विश्रुताः ।।
data.es: Four sons of immense prowess would be born to him bringing glory and fame to their dynasty. They would be renowned in all the worlds.

data.v: एवं स देवप्रवरः पूर्वं कथितवान्कथाम् । सनत्कुमारो भगवान्पुरा देवयुगे प्रभुः ।।
data.es: In early times of Kritayuga, this story was narrated by the holy and competent Sanatkumara, the great one among the devatas".

data.v: स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल तमानय सुसत्कृतम् । स्वयमेव महाराज गत्वा सबलवाहनः ।।
data.es: "Greatest among men, O king, along with vehicles and retinue, you may go and bring him (Rsyasringa) personally with due respect".

data.v: अनुमान्य वसिष्ठं च सूतवाक्यं निशम्य च । सान्तःपुरः सहामात्यः प्रययौ यत्र स द्विजः ।।
data.es: Having heard the charioteer's words and having obtained the consent of Vasishta, he along with his queens and courtiers departed to the place where the brahmin (Rsyasringa) resided.

data.v: वनानि सरितश्चैव व्यतिक्रम्य शनैः शनैः । अभिचक्राम तं देशं यत्र वै मुनिपुंगवः ।।
data.es: Crossing forests and rivers slowly, the king reached the place where that foremost of ascetics lived.

data.v: आसाद्य तं द्विजश्रेष्ठं लोमपादसमीपगम् । ऋषिपुत्रं ददर्शादौ दीप्यमानमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: He reached the spot and saw the son of the ascetic, the best of brahmins glowing like fire seated next to Romapada.

data.v: ततो राजा यथान्यायं पूजां चक्रे विशेषतः । सखित्वात्तस्य वै राज्ञः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: Then the king (Romapada), delighted at heart out of friendship with the king (Dasaratha), offered special hospitality with respectful salutations in accordance with propriety.

data.v: लोमपादेन चाख्यातमृषिपुत्राय धीमते । सख्यं संबन्धकं चैव तदा तं प्रत्यपूजयत् ।।
data.es: Romapada explained his friendship and relationship with him (Dasaratha). Rsyasringa of great intellect in return felicitated Dasaratha.

data.v: एवं सुसत्कृतस्तेन सहोषित्वा नरर्षभः । सप्ताष्टदिवसान्राजा राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: In this manner, the great among men, the king wellhonoured by Romapada, spent seven or eight days there.And then spoke this to Romapada:

data.v: शान्ता तव सुता राजन्सह भर्त्रा विशाम्पते । मदीयं नगरं यातु कार्यं हि महदुद्यतम् ।।
data.es: O lord of people, O king, It has been decided to commence an important sacrificial rite. You may send your daughter Santa along with her husband to my city.

data.v: तथेति राजा संश्रुत्य गमनं तस्य धीमतः । उवाच वचनं विप्रं गच्छ त्वं सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: Having agreed to the departure of the sage Romapada said, 'Be pleased to go (to Ayodhya) together with your wife'.

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रः प्रतिश्रुत्य तथेत्याह नृपं तदा । स नृपेणाभ्यनुज्ञातः प्रययौ सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: The son of the sage assented to the king's command saying 'So be it'. And permitted by him, departed along with wife (for Ayodhya).

data.v: तावन्योन्याञ्जलिं कृत्वा स्नेहात्संश्लिष्य चोरसा । ननन्दतुर्दशरथो लोमपादश्च वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Dasaratha and Romapada, pleased with this, wished each other with folded palms and hugged each other with love.

data.v: ततः सुहृदमापृच्छ्य प्रस्थितो रघुनन्दनः । पौरेभ्यः प्रेषयामास दूतान्वै शीघ्रगामिनः । क्रियतां नगरं सर्वं क्षिप्रमेव स्वलंकृतम् ।।
data.es: Then king Dasaratha, took leave of his friend and set out. He despatched swiftfooted messengers to the citizens with the command.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टाः पौरास्ते श्रुत्वा राजानमागतम् । तथा प्रचक्रुस्तत्सर्वं राज्ञा यत्प्रेषितं तदा ।।
data.es: The people of the city having heard the king's arrival were overjoyed. They did everything as by the king.
