data.v: ततः स्वलंकृतं राजा नगरं प्रविवेश ह । शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषैः पुरस्कृत्य द्विजर्षभम् ।।
data.es: Then the king entered that welldecorated city amidst blares of conches and the beating of drums, with the best of the brahmins (Rsyasringa) in the forefront.

data.v: ततः प्रमुदिताः सर्वे दृष्ट्वा तं नागरा द्विजम् । प्रवेश्यमानं सत्कृत्य नरेन्द्रेणेन्द्रकर्मणा ।।
data.es: The citizens were delighted to behold that brahmin entering the city duly honoured by the king who was equivalent to Indra in valiance৷৷

data.v: अन्तःपुरं प्रवेश्यैनं पूजां कृत्वा तु शास्त्रतः । कृतकृत्यं तदात्मानं मेने तस्योपवाहनात् ।।
data.es: He (king Dasaratha) took him in to the inner apartment and extended welcome. He thought that he has as enjoined by the sastras accomplished his objective by bringing him (Rsyasringa).

data.v: अन्तःपुराणि सर्वाणि शान्तां दृष्ट्वा तथागताम् । सह भर्त्रा विशालाक्षीं प्रीत्यानन्दमुपागमन् ।।
data.es: All the royal ladies, experienced immense delight when they saw the largeeyed Shanta arriving along with her husband in that manner.

data.v: पूज्यमाना च ताभिः सा राज्ञा चैव विशेषतः । उवास तत्र सुखिता कंचित्कालं सह द्विजा ।।
data.es: Honoured and worshipped by royal ladies, especially by king Dasaratha, Santa dwelt there for some time comfortably with the sage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततः काले बहुतिथे कस्मिंश्चित्सुमनोहरे । वसन्ते समनुप्राप्ते राज्ञो यष्टुं मनोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: After a long time, at the advent of charming spring a desire arose in the mind of the king (Dasaratha) to perform the sacrifice.

data.v: ततः प्रसाद्य शिरसा तं विप्रं देववर्णिनम् । यज्ञाय वरयामास संतानार्थं कुलस्य वै ।।
data.es: Then bowing his head in respect to that brahmin who was effulgent like a celestial and having won his grace he chose him to conduct a sacrifice for a son for (the continuity of) his dynasty.

data.v: तथेति च स राजानमुवाच च सुसत्कृतः । संभाराः संभ्रियन्तां ते तुरगश्च विमुच्यताम् ।।
data.es: Highly pleased, they all said to king Dasaratha, "Requisite articles be collected for the sacrifice and the horse be released."

data.v: ततो राजाब्रवीद्वाक्यं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रिसत्तमम् । सुमन्त्रावाहय क्षिप्रमृत्विजो ब्रह्मवादिनः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the king said to Sumantra, "Summon immediately, Suyajna, Vamadeva, Jabali and Kasyapa, family priest Vasishta and other foremost and learned brahmins who are the official priests wellversed in the Vedas".

data.v: ततः सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितं गत्वा त्वरितविक्रमः । समानयत्स तान्विप्रान्समस्तान्वेदपारगान् ।।
data.es: Then Sumantra, a man of smart movement went immediately and brought all those brahmins who were wellversed in the Vedas.

data.v: सुयज्ञं वामदेवं च जाबालिमथ काश्यपम् । पुरोहितं वसिष्ठं च ये चान्ये द्विजसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the king said to Sumantra, "Summon immediately, Suyajna, Vamadeva, Jabali and Kasyapa, family priest Vasishta and other foremost and learned brahmins who are the official priests wellversed in the Vedas".

data.v: तान्पूजयित्वा धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथस्तदा । इदं धर्मार्थसहितं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Virtuous king Dasaratha paid homage to them (the ministers) and uttered these gracious, righteous and meaningful words.

data.v: मम लालप्यमानस्य पुत्रार्थं नास्ति वै सुखम् । तदर्थं हयमेधेन यक्ष्यामीति मतिर्मम ।।
data.es: There is no happiness for one who has no son. This is the cause of my intense suffering. Therefore, I have made up my mind to perform a horsesacrifice.

data.v: तदहं यष्टुमिच्छामि शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा । ऋषिपुत्रप्रभावेन कामान्प्राप्स्यामि चाप्यहम् ।।
data.es: Therefore, I intend to perform a horsesacrifice in accordance with the scriptures. How can I fulfil my desire in this regard? You may deliberate and find a solution".

data.v: ततः साध्विति तद्वाक्यं ब्राह्मणाः प्रत्यपूजयन् । वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सर्वे पार्थिवस्य मुखाच्च्युतम् ।।
data.es: The brahmins along with Vasishta in the forefront extolled the king's decision, exclaiming, 'Well, Well'.

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गपुरोगाश्च प्रत्यूचुर्नृपतिं तदा । संभाराः संभ्रियन्तां ते तुरगश्च विमुच्यताम् ।।
data.es: Highly pleased, they all said to king Dasaratha, "Requisite articles be collected for the sacrifice and the horse be released."

data.v: सर्वथा प्राप्यसे पुत्रांश्चतुरोऽमितविक्रमान् । यस्य ते धार्मिकी बुद्धिरियं पुत्रार्थमागता ।।
data.es: 'O king, the wish that arose in your mind is just and right. You will definitely obtain sons as desired by you.'

data.v: ततः प्रीतोऽभवद्राजा श्रुत्वा तद्द्विजभाषितम् । अमात्यांश्चाब्रवीद्राजा हर्षेणेदं शुभाक्षरम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of the brahmins, the king was pleased and said to his ministers with eyes excited with delight.

data.v: गुरूणां वचनाच्छीघ्रं संभाराः संभ्रियन्तु मे । समर्थाधिष्ठितश्चाश्वः सोपाध्यायो विमुच्यताम् ।।
data.es: "Let the articles required (for performing the sacrifice) be procured in accordance with the words of my spiritual preceptors and the horse be released under the protection of able men.

data.v: सरय्वाश्चोत्तरे तीरे यज्ञभूमिर्विधीयताम् । शान्तयश्चाभिवर्धन्तां यथाकल्पं यथाविधि ।।
data.es: On the northern bank of Sarayu, a sacrificial pavillion be prepared according to the methods ordained in the 'Kalpa'. Auspicious rites be performed in accordance with the ordinance for its uninterrupted completion.

data.v: शक्यः कर्तुमयं यज्ञः सर्वेणापि महीक्षिता । नापराधो भवेत्कष्टो यद्यस्मिन्क्रतुसत्तमे ।।
data.es: If obstructions and omissions do not occur in the conduct of this best of sacrifices, it will be possible for every king to get the results.

data.v: छिद्रं हि मृगयन्तेऽत्र विद्वांसो ब्रह्मराक्षसाः । विधिहीनस्य यज्ञस्य सद्यः कर्ता विनश्यति ।।
data.es: The learned brahmarakshasas always look out for flaws in the sacrifice so that they can spoil it. If a flaw finds place, the doer of the sacrifice is immediately destroyed.

data.v: तद्यथा विधिपूर्वं मे क्रतुरेष समाप्यते । तथाविधानं क्रियतां समर्थाः करणेष्विह ।।
data.es: Therefore let the arrangements be made in a manner this sacifice is completed in accordance with the scriptures. And in this, you are experts".

data.v: तथेति च ततः सर्वे मन्त्रिणः प्रत्यपूजयन् । पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य तद्वाक्यं यथाज्ञप्तमकुर्वत ।।
data.es: Having heard these words of this Indra on earth (king Dasaratha) all the ministers with due respect replied: "May it be as ordered".

data.v: ततो द्विजास्ते धर्मज्ञमस्तुवन्पार्थिवर्षभम् । अनुज्ञातास्ततः सर्वे पुनर्जग्मुर्यथागतम् ।।
data.es: Bowing to this best of kings (Dasaratha), all the brahmins who were experts in austerities left all the knowledgeable brahmins as they camewith his permission.

data.v: गतानां तु द्विजातीनां मन्त्रिणस्तान्नराधिपः । विसर्जयित्वा स्वं वेश्म प्रविवेश महाद्युतिः ।।
data.es: Having thus ordered his ministers sitting nearby, sent this highly brilliant, this preeminent among kings them away and entered the inner apartment.

data.v: पुनः प्राप्ते वसन्ते तु पूर्णः संवत्सरोऽभवत् । अभिवाद्य वसिष्ठं च न्यायतः प्रतिपूज्य च ।।
data.es: After completion of one year when spring returned, the valiant king (Dasaratha) entered the sacrificial pavilion to worship celestial beings for begetting sons.

data.v: अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं प्रसवार्थं द्विजोत्तमम् । यज्ञो मे क्रियतां विप्र यथोक्तं मुनिपुंगव ।।
यथा न विघ्नः क्रियते यज्ञाङ्गेषु विधीयताम् । भवान्स्निग्धः सुहृन्मह्यं गुरुश्च परमो महान् ।।
वोढव्यो भवता चैव भारो यज्ञस्य चोद्यतः । तथेति च स राजानमब्रवीद्द्विजसत्तमः ।।
करिष्ये सर्वमेवैतद्भवता यत्समर्थितम् । ततोऽब्रवीद्द्विजान्वृद्धान्यज्ञकर्मसु निष्ठितान् ।।
स्थापत्ये निष्ठितांश्चैव वृद्धान्परमधार्मिकान् । कर्मान्तिकाञ्शिल्पकारान्वर्धकीन्खनकानपि ।।
गणकाञ्शिल्पिनश्चैव तथैव नटनर्तकान् । तथा शुचीञ्शास्त्रविदः पुरुषान्सुबहुश्रुतान् ।।
यज्ञकर्म समीहन्तां भवन्तो राजशासनात् । इष्टका बहुसाहस्री शीघ्रमानीयतामिति ।।
औपकार्याः क्रियन्तां च राज्ञां बहुगुणान्विताः । ब्राह्मणावसथाश्चैव कर्तव्याः शतशः शुभाः ।।
भक्ष्यान्नपानैर्बहुभिः समुपेताः सुनिष्ठिताः । तथा पौरजनस्यापि कर्तव्या बहुविस्तराः ।।
आवासा बहुभक्ष्या वै सर्वकामैरुपस्थिताः । तथा जानपदस्यापि जनस्य बहुशोभनम् ।।
दातव्यमन्नं विधिवत्सत्कृत्य न तु लीलया । सर्वे वर्णा यथा पूजां प्राप्नुवन्ति सुसत्कृताः ।।
न चावज्ञा प्रयोक्तव्या कामक्रोधवशादपि । यज्ञकर्मसु येऽव्यग्राः पुरुषाः शिल्पिनस्तथा ।।
तेषामपि विशेषेण पूजा कार्या यथाक्रमम् । यथा सर्वं सुविहितं न किंचित्परिहीयते ।।
तथा भवन्तः कुर्वन्तु प्रीतिस्निग्धेन चेतसा । ततः सर्वे समागम्य वसिष्ठमिदमब्रुवन् ।।
यथोक्तं तत्करिष्यामो न किंचित्परिहास्यते । ततः सुमन्त्रमाहूय वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
निमन्त्रयस्य नृपतीन्पृथिव्यां ये च धार्मिकाः । ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रियान्वैश्याञ्शूद्रांश्चैव सहस्रशः ।।
समानयस्व सत्कृत्य सर्वदेशेषु मानवान् । मिथिलाधिपतिं शूरं जनकं सत्यविक्रमम् ।।
निष्ठितं सर्वशास्त्रेषु तथा वेदेषु निष्ठितम् । तमानय महाभागं स्वयमेव सुसत्कृतम् । पूर्वसंबन्धिनं ज्ञात्वा ततः पूर्वं ब्रवीमि ते ।।
data.es: You may personally go and bring with due honour king Janaka who is the distinguished king of Mithila, a warrior whose truth is his strength proficient in all scriptures and the Vedas. Since he is an old ally, I am telling you in advance.

data.v: तथा काशिपतिं स्निग्धं सततं प्रियवादिनम् । सद्वृत्तं देवसंकाशं स्वयमेवानयस्व ह ।।
data.es: Similarly, you may personally escort king of Kasi who is always affectionate and sweettongued. He is a friend to our king who is a lion among rulers.

data.v: तथा केकयराजानं वृद्धं परमधार्मिकम् । श्वशुरं राजसिंहस्य सपुत्रं तमिहानय ।।
data.es: Similarly, you may personally escort king of Kasi who is always affectionate and sweettongued. He is a friend to our king who is a lion among rulers.

data.v: अङ्गेश्वरं महाभागं लोमपादं सुसत्कृतम् । वयस्यं राजसिंहस्य तमानय यशस्विनम् ।।
data.es: Bring with honour king of Anga, Romapada, famous and prosperous. He is an intimate friend of the king (Dasaratha).

data.v: प्राचीनान्सिन्धुसौवीरान्सौराष्ठ्रेयांश्च पार्थिवान् । दाक्षिणात्यान्नरेन्द्रांश्च समस्तानानयस्व ह ।।
data.es: Bring kings from the countries of the eastern and southern regions, from Sindhu, Sauvera and Saurashtra৷৷

data.v: सन्ति स्निग्धाश्च ये चान्ये राजानः पृथिवीतले । तानानय यथाक्षिप्रं सानुगान्सहबान्धवान् ।।
data.es: Bring all other kings of this earth, who are friendly with us. Along with their retinues, families and relatives".

data.v: वसिष्ठवाक्यं तच्छ्रुत्वा सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितस्तदा । व्यादिशत्पुरुषांस्तत्र राज्ञामानयने शुभान् ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Vasishta, Sumantra speedily despatched virtuous and auspicious emissaries to bring the kings.

data.v: स्वयमेव हि धर्मात्मा प्रययौ मुनिशासनात् । सुमन्त्रस्त्वरितो भूत्वा समानेतुं महीक्षितः ।।
data.es: In accordance with the ascetic's order, righteous Sumantra himself quickly set out to escort Janaka and other kings.

data.v: ते च कर्मान्तिकाः सर्वे वसिष्ठाय च धीमते । सर्वं निवेदयन्ति स्म यज्ञे यदुपकल्पितम् ।।
data.es: All the workers reported to the wise sage, Vasishta about the tasks completed for the sacrifice.

data.v: ततः प्रीतो द्विजश्रेष्ठस्तान्सर्वान्पुनरब्रवीत् । अवज्ञया न दातव्यं कस्यचिल्लीलयापि वा । अवज्ञया कृतं हन्याद्दातारं नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: Then, well pleased, the best among brahmins (Vasishta) said to them all "Nobody should be offered any thing with disregard. Anything given with contempt undoubtedly results in the destruction of the donor."

data.v: ततः कैश्चिदहोरात्रैरुपयाता महीक्षितः । बहूनि रत्नान्यादाय राज्ञो दशरथस्य ह ।।
data.es: Meanwhile kings from several countries to travelling nights and days arrived bringing with them various kinds of (precious) gifts.

data.v: ततो वसिष्ठः सुप्रीतो राजानमिदमब्रवीत् । उपयाता नरव्याघ्र राजानस्तव शासनात् ।।
data.es: Thereupon, wellpleased, Vasishta addressing Dasaratha said "O best among men, beacuse of your command, kings from various countries have arrived. I have extended due hospitality to those noble kings according to their station."

data.v: मयापि सत्कृताः सर्वे यथार्हं राजसत्तमाः । यज्ञियं च कृतं राजन्पुरुषैः सुसमाहितैः ।।
निर्यातु च भवान्यष्टुं यज्ञायतनमन्तिकात् । सर्वकामैरुपहृतैरुपेतं वै समन्ततः ।।
तथा वसिष्ठवचनादृश्यशृङ्गस्य चोभयोः । शुभे दिवस नक्षत्रे निर्यातो जगतीपतिः ।।
data.es: In response to the words of Vasishta and Rsyasringa, the Lord of the earth (Dasaratha) entered the sacrificial pavilion on a favourable day presided over by an auspicious star.

data.v: ततो वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सर्व एव द्विजोत्तमाः । ऋश्यशृङ्गं पुरस्कृत्य यज्ञकर्मारभंस्तदा ।।
data.es: At that moment the best of brahmins led by Vasishta and headed by Rsyasringa, entered the sacrificial enclosure and began the sacrifice in accordance with traditions and scriptural stipulations. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अथ संवत्सरे पूर्णे तस्मिन्प्राप्ते तुरङ्गमे । सरय्वाश्चोत्तरे तीरे राज्ञो यज्ञोऽभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: After completion of one year when the sacrificial horse had returned, the sacrifice by the king (Dasaratha) commenced on the northern bank of river Sarayu.

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गं पुरस्कृत्य कर्म चक्रुर्द्विजर्षभाः । अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे राज्ञोऽस्य सुमहात्मनः ।।
data.es: The best of brahmins led by Rsyasringa performed the rituals of aswamedha organised by the exceedingly magnanimous king.

data.v: कर्म कुर्वन्ति विधिवद्याजका वेदपारगाः । यथाविधि यथान्यायं परिक्रामन्ति शास्त्रतः ।।
data.es: The chief priests, masters of the Vedas, conducted the rituals in consonance with traditions and scriptures. They officiated in conformity with duties laid down in the Vedas and according to law.

data.v: प्रवर्ग्यं शास्त्रतः कृत्वा तथैवोपसदं द्विजाः । चक्रुश्च विधिवत्सर्वमधिकं कर्म शास्त्रतः ।।
data.es: Brahmins performed pravargya and upasada and other ceremonies as per the scriptures and traditions.

data.v: अभिपूज्य ततो हृष्टाः सर्वे चक्रुर्यथाविधि । प्रातःसवनपूर्वाणि कर्माणि मुनिपुंगवाः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the eminent ascetics, rejoicing in their hearts performed the worship (of celestial beings) and conducted the prescribed rituals starting with morning ablutions etc.

data.v: न चाहुतमभूत्तत्र स्खलितं वापि किंचन । दृश्यते ब्रह्मवत्सर्वं क्षेमयुक्तं हि चक्रिरे ।।
data.es: There were no omissions in the offerings nor any lappes in the performance. Everything was done through recitation of mantras and in a wholesome way.

data.v: न तेष्वहःसु श्रान्तो वा क्षुधितो वापि दृश्यते । नाविद्वान्ब्राह्मणस्तत्र नाशतानुचरस्तथा ।।
data.es: During the days (of sacrifice) none felt tired or hungry. There was no brahmin who was not learned or had less than a hundred followers (or disciples).

data.v: ब्राह्मणा भुञ्जते नित्यं नाथवन्तश्च भुञ्जते । तापसा भुञ्जते चापि श्रमणा भुञ्जते तथा ।।
data.es: During that period brahmanas as well as those who have masters, (the sudras), ascetics and monks had enough to eat.

data.v: वृद्धाश्च व्याधिताश्चैव स्त्रियो बालास्तथैव च । अनिशं भुञ्जमानानां न तृप्तिरुपलभ्यते ।।
data.es: The aged, the sick, women and also children ate there and knew no limit to their enjoyment.

data.v: दीयतां दीयतामन्नं वासांसि विविधानि च । इति संचोदितास्तत्र तथा चक्रुरनेकशः ।।
data.es: "Give food, give, various kinds of clothes" echoed the organisers. And they (in charge of distribution) did.

data.v: अन्नकूटाश्च बहवो दृश्यन्ते पर्वतोपमाः । दिवसे दिवसे तत्र सिद्धस्य विधिवत्तदा ।।
data.es: There, could be seen day after day heaps of nicely cooked food, looking like mountains.

data.v: अन्नं हि विधिवत्स्वादु प्रशंसन्ति द्विजर्षभाः । अहो तृप्ताः स्म भद्रं ते इति शुश्राव राघवः ।।
data.es: Brahmins having tasted the delicious food cooked in prescribed manner, praised saying "Ah We are fully satisfied. Prosperity to you". Such were the words heard by king Dasaratha.

data.v: स्वलंकृताश्च पुरुषा ब्राह्मणान्पर्यवेषयन् । उपासते च तानन्ये सुमृष्टमणिकुण्डलाः ।।
data.es: While brahmins were being served with food by welldressed men, some others wearing pendents studded with shining jewels assisted them.

data.v: कर्मान्तरे तदा विप्रा हेतुवादान्बहूनपि । प्राहुः सुवाग्मिनो धीराः परस्परजिगीषया ।।
data.es: In the interval between ceremonies, eloquent and sagacious brahmins were engaged in various disputations, desirous of victory.

data.v: दिवसे दिवसे तत्र संस्तरे कुशला द्विजाः । सर्वकर्माणि चक्रुस्ते यथाशास्त्रं प्रचोदिताः ।।
data.es: Every day in that sacrifice brahmins, skilful in rituals, persuaded (by sage Vasishta), performed all their duties as per tradition.

data.v: नाषडङ्गविदत्रासीन्नाव्रतो नाबहुश्रुतः । सदस्यस्तस्य वै राज्ञो नावादकुशलो द्विजः ।।
data.es: Here (in this sacrificial pavillion), there was none who was not versed in six Vedangas, not true to vows, not learned in many sastras nor adept in discussions (on sastras).

data.v: प्राप्ते यूपोच्छ्रये तस्मिन्षड्बैल्वाः खादिरास्तथा । तावन्तो बिल्वसहिताः पर्णिनश्च तथापरे ।।
data.es: When the time came to erect sacrificial posts, six posts each made of bilva and khadira wood and many made of parni wood along, one of sleshmataka and two of devadaru wood, with a distance of two outstretched hands between them were erected.

data.v: श्लेष्मातकमयो दिष्टो देवदारुमयस्तथा । द्वावेव तत्र विहितौ बाहुव्यस्तपरिग्रहौ ।।
कारिताः सर्व एवैते शास्त्रज्ञैर्यज्ञकोविदैः । शोभार्थं तस्य यज्ञस्य काञ्चनालंकृता भवन् ।।
data.es: All these posts were prepared by knowers of sastras and by those wellversed in the performance of sacrifices. They were decorated with gold to add elegance to the sacrifice.

data.v: विन्यस्ता विधिवत्सर्वे शिल्पिभिः सुकृता दृढाः । अष्टाश्रयः सर्व एव श्लक्ष्णरूपसमन्विताः ।।
data.es: All those posts, strong with eight sides and finely finished surfaces, wellcarved by sculptors were duly erected.

data.v: आच्छादितास्ते वासोभिः पुष्पैर्गन्धैश्च भूषिताः । सप्तर्षयो दीप्तिमन्तो विराजन्ते यथा दिवि ।।
data.es: Decorated with flowers and sandal paste and covered with cloths, stood the bright sacrificial posts shining like seven sages in the sky.

data.v: इष्टकाश्च यथान्यायं कारिताश्च प्रमाणतः । चितोऽग्निर्ब्राह्मणैस्तत्र कुशलैः शुल्बकर्मणि ।।
data.es: The sacrificial fireplace was constructed with bricks with standard measurement by brahmins who were experts in the art of measuring land with a string or single strand.

data.v: स चित्यो राजसिंहस्य संचितः कुशलैर्द्विजैः । गरुडो रुक्मपक्षो वै त्रिगुणोऽष्टादशात्मकः ।।
data.es: That sacrificial altar of the lion among kings, (Dasaratha), erected by welltrained brahmins was in the shape of the golden winged 'Garuda' it had three ranges and thrice as many fireplaces i.e eighteen in number.

data.v: नियुक्तास्तत्र पशवस्तत्तदुद्दिश्य दैवतम् । उरगाः पक्षिणश्चैव यथाशास्त्रं प्रचोदिताः । शामित्रे तु हयस्तत्र तथा जल चराश्च ये ।।
data.es: Animals, serpents and birds were kept ready after the sastras intended (for sacrifice) for those respective deities.

data.v: ऋत्विग्भिः सर्वमेवैतन्नियुक्तं शास्त्रतस्तदा । पशूनां त्रिशतं तत्र यूपेषु नियतं तदा । अश्वरत्नोत्तमं तस्य राज्ञो दशरथस्य ह ।।
data.es: Three hundred animals and the jewel of the horses (from the stables) belonging to king Dasaratha were bound to the sacrificial posts.

data.v: कौसल्या तं हयं तत्र परिचर्य समन्ततः । कृपाणैर्विशशासैनं त्रिभिः परमया मुदा ।।
data.es: Kausalya, with immense glee having gone round and worshipped that horse, severed it with three strokes of scimitar.

data.v: पतत्रिणा तदा सार्धं सुस्थितेन च चेतसा । अवसद्रजनीमेकां कौसल्या धर्मकाम्यया ।।
data.es: Kausalya, in her devotion to duty and with a happy state of mind, passed one night near that horse.

data.v: होताध्वर्युस्तथोद्गाता हयेन समयोजयन् । महिष्या परिवृक्त्याथ वावातामपरां तथा ।।
data.es: Hota, Adhvaryu and Udgata arranged Mahishi, Parivritti, Vavaata and another woman known as Palakali to touch (keep the company of) the sacrificial horse.

data.v: पतत्रिणस्तस्य वपामुद्धृत्य नियतेन्द्रियः । ऋत्विक्परम संपन्नः श्रपयामास शास्त्रतः ।।
data.es: The official priest, highly knowledgeable in scriptures and having restrained senses, removed the marrow from the horse and cooked it according to tradition.

data.v: धूमगन्धं वपायास्तु जिघ्रति स्म नराधिपः । यथाकालं यथान्यायं निर्णुदन्पापमात्मनः ।।
data.es: The king at appropriate time and in agreement with the scriptures inhaled the odour of the smoke (from the burnt marrow) and absolved himself of his sins.

data.v: हयस्य यानि चाङ्गानि तानि सर्वाणि ब्राह्मणाः । अग्नौ प्रास्यन्ति विधिवत्समस्ताः षोडशर्त्विजः ।।
data.es: The sixteen officiating priests (brahmins) offered all the horse's limbs with prayers as per the customs.

data.v: प्लक्षशाखासु यज्ञानामन्येषां क्रियते हविः । अश्वमेधस्य चैकस्य वैतसो भाग इष्यते ।।
data.es: In other sacrifices oblations are offered with branches of a plaksha tree but in Aswamedha a branch of cane creeper is chosen instead.

data.v: त्र्यहोऽश्वमेधः संख्यातः कल्पसूत्रेण ब्राह्मणैः । चतुष्टोममहस्तस्य प्रथमं परिकल्पितम् ।।
data.es: According to Kalpa sutra, aswamedha in conducted for three days. In the first day, chatushtoma is arranged.

data.v: उक्थ्यं द्वितीयं संख्यातमतिरात्रं तथोत्तरम् । कारितास्तत्र बहवो विहिताः शास्त्रदर्शनात् ।।
data.es: On the second day Ukthya and on the third day Atiraatra were performed. Many sacrifices fixed according to the scriptures were also performed.

data.v: ज्योतिष्टोमायुषी चैव अतिरात्रौ च निर्मितौ । अभिजिद्विश्वजिच्चैव अप्तोर्यामो महाक्रतुः ।।
data.es: Jyotishtoma and Ayuryaga in Atiratra, Abhijit, Viswajit and Aptoryama ceremonies constituting the great sacrifice were performed in the prescribed manner.

data.v: प्राचीं होत्रे ददौ राजा दिशं स्वकुलवर्धनः । अध्वर्यवे प्रतीचीं तु ब्रह्मणे दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: In order to promote his dynasty, king Dasaratha gave away eastern region to Hotar, western region to Adhvaryu, southern region to Brahma and northern region to Udgata. These offerings were made in accordance with theprescriptions by Brahma long all.

data.v: उद्गात्रे तु तथोदीचीं दक्षिणैषा विनिर्मिता । अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे स्वयम्भुविहिते पुरा ।।
data.es: In order to promote his dynasty, king Dasaratha gave away eastern region to Hotar, western region to Adhvaryu, southern region to Brahma and northern region to Udgata. These offerings were made in accordance with theprescriptions by Brahma long all.

data.v: क्रतुं समाप्य तु तदा न्यायतः पुरुषर्षभः । ऋत्विग्भ्यो हि ददौ राजा धरां तां क्रतुवर्धनः ।।
data.es: The king best among men and upholder of his dynasty, having concluded the sacrifice according to law, offered this entire earth as gift to priests.

data.v: ऋत्विजस्त्वब्रुवन्सर्वे राजानं गतकल्मषम् । भवानेव महीं कृत्स्नामेको रक्षितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: But all the priests said to the king purged of his sins, "O Lord of men you alone are capable of protecting this earth".

data.v: न भूम्या कार्यमस्माकं न हि शक्ताः स्म पालने । रताः स्वाध्यायकरणे वयं नित्यं हि भूमिप । निष्क्रयं किंचिदेवेह प्रयच्छतु भवानिति ।।
data.es: "O ruler of the earth We are constantly engaged in the study of the Vedas. We are not capable of ruling the earth and we cannot do anything with its possession. Give some other charity in lieu of that.

data.v: गवां शतसहस्राणि दश तेभ्यो ददौ नृपः । दशकोटिं सुवर्णस्य रजतस्य चतुर्गुणम् ।।
data.es: Lord of men, the king having been thus addressed by brahmins who were wellversed in the Vedas, bestowed on them ten hundred thousand cows, a hundred crore of gold coins and four times as much in silver coins.

data.v: ऋत्विजस्तु ततः सर्वे प्रददुः सहिता वसु । ऋश्यशृङ्गाय मुनये वसिष्ठाय च धीमते ।।
data.es: All the priests collectively offered that wealth to sage Rsyasringa and Vasishta endowed with prudence.

data.v: ततस्ते न्यायतः कृत्वा प्रविभागं द्विजोत्तमाः । सुप्रीतमनसः सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्मुदिता भृशम् ।।
data.es: Then those highly pleased brahmins, having distributed that wealth with equity, again said to the king.

data.v: ततः प्रीतमना राजा प्राप्य यज्ञमनुत्तमम् । पापापहं स्वर्नयनं दुस्तरं पार्थिवर्षभैः ।।
data.es: Sacrifice destroys sins. It leads to heaven. It is incapable of being done by other monarchs. King Dasaratha was very much pleased after performing this great sacrifice.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीदृश्यशृङ्गं राजा दशरथस्तदा । कुलस्य वर्धनं तत्तु कर्तुमर्हसि सुव्रत ।।
data.es: King Dasaratha then addressing Rsyasringa said "O Adherent of vows you can help the continuity of my race".

data.v: तथेति च स राजानमुवाच द्विजसत्तमः । भविष्यन्ति सुता राजंश्चत्वारस्ते कुलोद्वहाः ।।
data.es: The great among brahmins answered him saying "I shall do everything as proposed by you".

data.v: मेधावी तु ततो ध्यात्वा स किंचिदिदमुत्तमम् । लब्धसंज्ञस्ततस्तं तु वेदज्ञो नृपमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rsyasringa, a highly intellectual and knowledgeable one in the Vedas, pondered for a while, revived his memory and said to the king.

data.v: इष्टिं तेऽहं करिष्यामि पुत्रीयां पुत्रकारणात् । अथर्वशिरसि प्रोक्तैर्मन्त्रैः सिद्धां विधानतः ।।
data.es: "I shall perform putriyeshti to help you beget sons. This is to be done in accordance with tradition for fulfilment of desires through mantras as declared in a portion of the Vedas, 'atharva siras'" .

data.v: ततः प्राक्रमदिष्टिं तां पुत्रीयां पुत्र कारणात् । जुहाव चाग्नौ तेजस्वी मन्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा ।।
data.es: To help Dasaratha beget sons, brilliant Rsyasringa commenced putriyeshti, a sacrifice for begetting children, by pouring oblations into sacrificial fire and chanting mantras in accordance with traditions.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । भागप्रतिग्रहार्थं वै समवेता यथाविधि ।।
data.es: All the celestial deities etc., along with gandharvas according to tradition, gathered at the sacrifice to receive their share of offerings.

data.v: ताः समेत्य यथान्यायं तस्मिन्सदसि देवताः । अब्रुवँल्लोककर्तारं ब्रह्माणं वचनं महत् ।।
data.es: All devatas assembled there as per tradition and thus addressed Lord Brahma the creator of the worlds:

data.v: भगवंस्त्वत्प्रसादेन रावणो नाम राक्षसः । सर्वान्नो बाधते वीर्याच्छासितुं तं न शक्नुमः ।।
data.es: "O lord a rakshasa by name Ravana who had obtained prowess through your grace is oppressing us. We are unable to punish him.

data.v: त्वया तस्मै वरो दत्तः प्रीतेन भगवन्पुरा । मानयन्तश्च तं नित्यं सर्वं तस्य क्षमामहे ।।
data.es: Pleased with his penance, Lord, you had granted him a boon. By honour that boon and daily endure all his cruelty.

data.v: उद्वेजयति लोकांस्त्रीनुच्छ्रितान्द्वेष्टि दुर्मतिः । शक्रं त्रिदशराजानं प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: The evilminded Ravana is inflicting pains on the three worlds. He hates the guardians of the earth and intends to assault Indra, lord of the celestials.

data.v: ऋषीन्यक्षान्सगन्धर्वानसुरान्ब्राह्मणांस्तथा । अतिक्रामति दुर्धर्षो वरदानेन मोहितः ।।
data.es: Because of your boon he has become unassailable and puffed with pride deties sages, yakshas, gandharvas, demons and brahmins.

data.v: नैनं सूर्यः प्रतपति पार्श्वे वाति न मारुतः । चलोर्मिमाली तं दृष्ट्वा समुद्रोऽपि न कम्पते ।।
data.es: The Sun does not scorch him and the wind does not blow by him. Even the ocean with its incessantly moving waves becomes still in his presence.

data.v: तन्महन्नो भयं तस्माद्राक्षसाद्घोरदर्शनात् । वधार्थं तस्य भगवन्नुपायं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: His dreamful appearance of that rakshasa strikes terror into us. O Lord do find some means to kill him".

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरैः सर्वैश्चिन्तयित्वा ततोऽब्रवीत् । हन्तायं विहितस्तस्य वधोपायो दुरात्मनः ।।
data.es: After listening to the words of the devatas and reflecting over the matter, Brahma said, "Oh, the means of destruction of that wicked (rakshasa) has struck my mind".

data.v: तेन गन्धर्वयक्षाणां देवदानवरक्षसाम् । अवध्योऽस्मीति वागुक्ता तथेत्युक्तं च तन्मया ।।
data.es: When he asked gandharvas, yakshas, gods, demons or rakshasas should never be able to kill him, I said, "So be it".

data.v: नाकीर्तयदवज्ञानात्तद्रक्षो मानुषांस्तदा । तस्मात्स मानुषाद्वध्यो मृत्युर्नान्योऽस्य विद्यते ।।
data.es: "The rakshasa did not include man monkey and bear because of his disdain for men. As such he is fit to be destroyed by a man and not by any other means".

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा प्रियं वाक्यं ब्रह्मणा समुदाहृतम् । देवा महर्षयः सर्वे प्रहृष्टास्तेऽभवंस्तदा ।।
data.es: Having heard these pleasing words uttered by Brahma, all the devatas and maharshis were overwhelmed with joy.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे विष्णुरुपयातो महाद्युतिः । ब्रह्मणा च समागम्य तत्र तस्थौ समाहितः ।।
data.es: At this juncture Visnu the lord of the world, highly effulgent and bearing conch, discus and mace in his hands and in yellow apparel arrived.

data.v: तमब्रुवन्सुराः सर्वे समभिष्टूय संनताः । त्वां नियोक्ष्यामहे विष्णो लोकानां हितकाम्यया ।।
राज्ञो दशरथस्य त्वमयोध्याधिपतेर्विभो । धर्मज्ञस्य वदान्यस्य महर्षिसमतेजसः । तस्य भार्यासु तिसृषु ह्रीश्रीकीर्त्युपमासु च । विष्णो पुत्रत्वमागच्छ कृत्वात्मानं चतुर्विधम् ।।
data.es: "O Visnu we pray for the welfare of all the worlds. The sovereign of Ayodhya, king Dasaratha is a righteous, virtuous and generous king equal with rishis in lusture. Pray form into four and incarnate in the of four sons of his three wives, resembling hri (modesty), shree (auspiciousness), kirti (fame).

data.v: तत्र त्वं मानुषो भूत्वा प्रवृद्धं लोककण्टकम् । अवध्यं दैवतैर्विष्णो समरे जहि रावणम् ।।
data.es: "O Visnu assuring human form, kill Ravana in the battle. He has become a source of torment to the worlds and is invincible by gods.

data.v: स हि देवान्सगन्धर्वान्सिद्धांश्च ऋषिसत्तमान् । राक्षसो रावणो मूर्खो वीर्योत्सेकेन बाधते ।।
data.es: "That stupid rakshasa, Ravana, with his haughty prowess, is terrorising the gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great rishis.

data.v: तदुद्धतं रावणमृद्धतेजसं; प्रवृद्धदर्पं त्रिदशेश्वरद्विषम् । विरावणं साधु तपस्विकण्टकं; तपस्विनामुद्धर तं भयावहम् ।।
data.es: "Therefore, uproot that mighty Ravana possessing frightful prowess, inflamed pride, limitless insolence causing agony to the three worlds, a source of vexation to ascetics and a dreadful enemy of Indra.

data.v: ततो नारायणो विष्णुर्नियुक्तः सुरसत्तमैः । जानन्नपि सुरानेवं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Although Omniscient lord Narayana knew the means to be employed, when he was requested by the best of devatas he spoke to them softly:

data.v: उपायः को वधे तस्य राक्षसाधिपतेः सुराः । यमहं तं समास्थाय निहन्यामृषिकण्टकम् ।।
data.es: "What strategies should be adopted in the matter of destruction of that evilminded Ravana who is a thorn to the sages?".

data.v: एवमुक्ताः सुराः सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्विष्णुमव्ययम् । मानुषीं तनुमास्थाय रावणं जहि संयुगे ।।
data.es: When the devatas were thus addressed by the imperishable Visnu, they replied him saying, "You may assume the form of a human being and slay Ravana in the battle".

data.v: स हि तेपे तपस्तीव्रं दीर्घकालमरिंदम । येन तुष्टोऽभवद्ब्रह्मा लोककृल्लोकपूजितः ।।
data.es: "O destroyer of foes Lord Brahma was very pleased with Ravana's intense penance over a long time৷৷

data.v: संतुष्टः प्रददौ तस्मै राक्षसाय वरं प्रभुः । नानाविधेभ्यो भूतेभ्यो भयं नान्यत्र मानुषात् ।।
data.es: Pleased, with the rakshasa Brahma granted a boon to the effect that except from men, there was, for him, no fear of death from any other living beings. Ravana ignored men while seeking the boon.

data.v: अवज्ञाताः पुरा तेन वरदानेन मानवाः । तस्मात्तस्य वधो दृष्टो मानुषेभ्यः परंतप ।।
इत्येतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुराणां विष्णुरात्मवान् । पितरं रोचयामास तदा दशरथं नृपम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the Lord with eyes like the lotus petal was pleased to transform himself into four forms and to choose king Dasaratha as his father.

data.v: स चाप्यपुत्रो नृपतिस्तस्मिन्काले महाद्युतिः । अयजत्पुत्रियामिष्टिं पुत्रेप्सुररिसूदनः ।।
data.es: At that time, the brilliant king (Dasaratha), destroyer of enemies, who had no sons was performing a sacrifice for sons.

data.v: ततो वै यजमानस्य पावकादतुलप्रभम् । प्रादुर्भूतं महद्भूतं महावीर्यं महाबलम् ।।
कृष्णं रक्ताम्बरधरं रक्तास्यं दुन्दुभिस्वनम् । स्निग्धहर्यक्षतनुजश्मश्रुप्रवरमूर्धजम् ।।
शुभलक्षणसंपन्नं दिव्याभरणभूषितम् । शैलशृङ्गसमुत्सेधं दृप्तशार्दूलविक्रमम् ।।
दिवाकरसमाकारं दीप्तानलशिखोपमम् । तप्तजाम्बूनदमयीं राजतान्तपरिच्छदाम् ।।
दिव्यपायससंपूर्णां पात्रीं पत्नीमिव प्रियाम् । प्रगृह्य विपुलां दोर्भ्यां स्वयं मायामयीमिव ।।
समवेक्ष्याब्रवीद्वाक्यमिदं दशरथं नृपम् । प्राजापत्यं नरं विद्धि मामिहाभ्यागतं नृप ।।
data.es: Having seen king Dasaratha, he said, "O King you know I have been sent by Prjapati (Brahma), and I am here".

data.v: ततः परं तदा राजा प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलिः । भगवन्स्वागतं तेऽस्तु किमहं करवाणि ते ।।
data.es: With folded palms the king replied, "O revered lord. Welcome to you. What can I do for you?".

data.v: अथो पुनरिदं वाक्यं प्राजापत्यो नरोऽब्रवीत् । राजन्नर्चयता देवानद्य प्राप्तमिदं त्वया ।।
data.es: Thereafter the one who came from Prajapati answered, "O King you have obtained this payasam today in return for the worship offered to the devatas".

data.v: इदं तु नरशार्दूल पायसं देवनिर्मितम् । प्रजाकरं गृहाण त्वं धन्यमारोग्यवर्धनम् ।।
data.es: "O Lion among kings, receive this payasam prepared by gods, conferring progeny, bestowing affluence and improving health.

data.v: भार्याणामनुरूपाणामश्नीतेति प्रयच्छ वै । तासु त्वं लप्स्यसे पुत्रान्यदर्थं यजसे नृप ।।
data.es: O King you are performing this sacrifice for the sake of sons. Give this to your worthy consorts to consume it. They will bear you sons".

data.v: तथेति नृपतिः प्रीतः शिरसा प्रतिगृह्य ताम् । पात्रीं देवान्नसंपूर्णां देवदत्तां हिरण्मयीम् ।।
data.es: Dasaratha was pleased to receive respectfully the golden vessel filled with the payasam prepared and bestowed by devatas.

data.v: अभिवाद्य च तद्भूतमद्भुतं प्रियदर्शनम् । मुदा परमया युक्तश्चकाराभिप्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: Overwhelmed with great joy, he, walked around that wonderful being of pleasant countenance again and again and saluated him respectfully.

data.v: ततो दशरथः प्राप्य पायसं देवनिर्मितम् । बभूव परमप्रीतः प्राप्य वित्तमिवाधनः ।।
data.es: Dasaratha who received the payasam prepared by devatas was highly pleased like a poor man who received wealth.

data.v: ततस्तदद्भुतप्रख्यं भूतं परमभास्वरम् । संवर्तयित्वा तत्कर्म तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ।।
data.es: Then that effulgent figure of wonderful form having given the bowl of payasam vanished from there.

data.v: हर्षरश्मिभिरुद्योतं तस्यान्तःपुरमाबभौ । शारदस्याभिरामस्य चन्द्रस्येव नभोंऽशुभिः ।।
data.es: The inner apartment, brightened with rays of happiness, shone like the autumnal sky in the glow of the moon.

data.v: सोऽन्तःपुरं प्रविश्यैव कौसल्यामिदमब्रवीत् । पायसं प्रतिगृह्णीष्व पुत्रीयं त्विदमात्मनः ।।
data.es: He entered the inner apartment and addressing queen Kausalya said, "Receive this payasam which has the power to give you sons".

data.v: कौसल्यायै नरपतिः पायसार्धं ददौ तदा । अर्धादर्धं ददौ चापि सुमित्रायै नराधिपः । कैकेय्यै चावशिष्टार्धं ददौ पुत्रार्थकारणात् ।।
data.es: Then Dasaratha gave half the portion of payasam to Kausalya, half of the remaining half to Sumitra, half of the remaining portion (oneeighth of original) to Kaikeyi for the sake of a son. On further thinking, he gave the remaining oneeighth portion to Sumitra. In this manner the king divided and distributed the payasam among his wives separately.

data.v: प्रददौ चावशिष्टार्धं पायसस्यामृतोपमम् । अनुचिन्त्य सुमित्रायै पुनरेव महीपतिः ।।
एवं तासां ददौ राजा भार्याणां पायसं पृथक् ।।
तास्त्वेतत्पायसं प्राप्य नरेन्द्रस्योत्तमाः स्त्रियः । संमानं मेनिरे सर्वाः प्रहर्षोदितचेतसः ।।
data.es: The virtuous wives of the king were exceedingly delighted and felt honoured after receiving the payasam .

data.v: पुत्रत्वं तु गते विष्णौ राज्ञस्तस्य महात्मनः । उवाच देवताः सर्वाः स्वयम्भूर्भगवानिदम् ।।
data.es: When Visnu had decided to be born as the son of that great king (Dasaratha), the selfborn Lord (Brahma), addressed all devatas :

data.v: सत्यसंधस्य वीरस्य सर्वेषां नो हितैषिणः । विष्णोः सहायान्बलिनः सृजध्वं कामरूपिणः ।।
data.es: Create strong and powerful beings capable of assuming forms at free will to extend support to Visnu who is true to his word, heroic and benevolent.

data.v: मायाविदश्च शूरांश्च वायुवेगसमाञ्जवे । नयज्ञान्बुद्धिसंपन्नान्विष्णुतुल्यपराक्रमान् ।।
असंहार्यानुपायज्ञान्दिव्यसंहननान्वितान् । सर्वास्त्रगुणसंपन्नानमृतप्राशनानिव ।।
अप्सरःसु च मुख्यासु गन्धर्वीणां तनूषु च । यक्षपन्नगकन्यासु ऋष्कविद्याधरीषु च ।।
किंनरीणां च गात्रेषु वानरीणां तनूषु च । सृजध्वं हरिरूपेण पुत्रांस्तुल्यपराक्रमान् ।।
ते तथोक्ता भगवता तत्प्रतिश्रुत्य शासनम् । जनयामासुरेवं ते पुत्रान्वानररूपिणः ।।
data.es: Instructed by Brahma in that manner, all of them gave birth to sons in the form of monkeys.

data.v: ऋषयश्च महात्मानः सिद्धविद्याधरोरगाः । चारणाश्च सुतान्वीरान्ससृजुर्वनचारिणः ।।
data.es: Distinguished rishis, siddhas, vidhyadharas, uragas, charanas procreated (in the form of monkeys) heroic sons who became forestdwellers.

data.v: ते सृष्टा बहुसाहस्रा दशग्रीववधोद्यताः । अप्रमेयबला वीरा विक्रान्ताः कामरूपिणः ।।
data.es: Thousands of warriors possessing immeasurable strength and courage and capable of assuming any form at will were created to kill Ravana.

data.v: ते गजाचलसंकाशा वपुष्मन्तो महाबलाः । ऋक्षवानरगोपुच्छाः क्षिप्रमेवाभिजज्ञिरे ।।
data.es: Endowed with bodies similar to the Meru and Mandara mountains and having great strength, bears, monkeys, monkeys with cowtails quickly came into being.

data.v: यस्य देवस्य यद्रूपं वेषो यश्च पराक्रमः । अजायत समस्तेन तस्य तस्य सुतः पृथक् ।।
data.es: The sons of devatas retained characteristics like beauty, form and prowess of their procreator (gods).

data.v: गोलाङ्गूलीषु चोत्पन्नाः केचित्संमतविक्रमाः । ऋक्षीषु च तथा जाता वानराः किंनरीषु च ।।
data.es: Some monkeys with acknowledged, valour were born to female monkeys with tails Similarly some other monkeys were born to female bears and female kinnaras.

data.v: शिलाप्रहरणाः सर्वे सर्वे पादपयोधिनः । नखदंष्ट्रायुधाः सर्वे सर्वे सर्वास्त्रकोविदाः ।।
data.es: They all could strike with rocks, use nails and teeth and trees as weapons. They were skilled in the use of all kinds of weapons.

data.v: विचालयेयुः शैलेन्द्रान्भेदयेयुः स्थिरान्द्रुमान् । क्षोभयेयुश्च वेगेन समुद्रं सरितां पतिम् ।।
data.es: They could shake mountains and uproot deeprooted trees. With their speed they could cause disturbance to Samudra, the lord of the rivers.

data.v: दारयेयुः क्षितिं पद्भ्यामाप्लवेयुर्महार्णवम् । नभस्तलं विशेयुश्च गृह्णीयुरपि तोयदान् ।।
data.es: They could cause cleavage to this earth with their feet, cross the mighty ocean with one leap and enter the sky and even seize the clouds.

data.v: गृह्णीयुरपि मातङ्गान्मत्तान्प्रव्रजतो वने । नर्दमानांश्च नादेन पातयेयुर्विहंगमान् ।।
data.es: They could capture wild elephants sojourning in the forest and make the flying birds drop down screaming.

data.v: ईदृशानां प्रसूतानि हरीणां कामरूपिणाम् । शतं शतसहस्राणि यूथपानां महात्मनाम् । बभूवुर्यूथपश्रेष्ठा वीरांश्चाजनयन्हरीन् ।।
data.es: A crore of monkeys capable of assuming any form at will, great monkeys and commanders of monkey forces were created.

data.v: अन्ये ऋक्षवतः प्रस्थानुपतस्थुः सहस्रशः । अन्ये नानाविधाञ्शैलान्काननानि च भेजिरे ।।
data.es: Thousands of monkeys dwelt on the plateaus on the top of mountains abounding in bears. Some others inhabited various hills and forests.

data.v: सूर्यपुत्रं च सुग्रीवं शक्रपुत्रं च वालिनम् । भ्रातरावुपतस्थुस्ते सर्व एव हरीश्वराः ।।
data.es: All those leaders, Nala, Neela, Hanuman and others dwelt near those two brothers Sugriva, the offspring of Surya and Vali, the son of Indra.

data.v: तैर्मेघवृन्दाचलकूटकल्पै;र्महाबलैर्वानरयूथपालैः । बभूव भूर्भीमशरीररूपैः; समावृता रामसहायहेतोः ।।
data.es: In order to assist Rama, this earth was filled with commanders of those who led the monkey forces resembling masses of clouds and mountains. They loan endowed with immense strength and fearful forms and countenances.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: निर्वृत्ते तु क्रतौ तस्मिन्हयमेधे महात्मनः । प्रतिगृह्य सुरा भागान्प्रतिजग्मुर्यथागतम् ।।
data.es: Completed by the magnanimous king (Dasaratha). The aswamedha and putreshti sacrifices, the devatas received their share of havis and returned to their respective abodes.

data.v: समाप्तदीक्षानियमः पत्नीगणसमन्वितः । प्रविवेश पुरीं राजा सभृत्यबलवाहनः ।।
data.es: Having completed the prescribed vows (in respect of aswamedha), king Dasaratha together with his queens returned to the city of Ayodhya accompanied by his attendants, army and chariots.

data.v: यथार्हं पूजितास्तेन राज्ञा वै पृथिवीश्वराः । मुदिताः प्रययुर्देशान्प्रणम्य मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: Having been honoured by the king (Dasaratha) in a be fitting manner, the highly pleased lords of the earth (kings) made obeisance to the best of sages (Vasishta) and returned to their own countries.

data.v: गतेषु पृथिवीशेषु राजा दशरथः पुनः । प्रविवेश पुरीं श्रीमान्पुरस्कृत्य द्विजोत्तमान् ।।
data.es: After the departure of the rulers, the exalted king Dasaratha preceded by the foremost of brahmins entered the city (of Ayodhya).

data.v: शान्तया प्रययौ सार्धमृश्यशृङ्गः सुपूजितः । अन्वीयमानो राज्ञाथ सानुयात्रेण धीमता ।।
data.es: Having been duly honoured by king Dasaratha, sage Rsyasringa with his wife Santa accompanied by the wise king Romapada and his followers set out for his country.

data.v: कौसल्याजनयद्रामं दिव्यलक्षणसंयुतम् । विष्णोरर्धं महाभागं पुत्रमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम् ।।
कौसल्या शुशुभे तेन पुत्रेणामिततेजसा । यथा वरेण देवानामदितिर्वज्रपाणिना ।।
data.es: Kausalya glowed with the undiminished lustre of her son, just as Aditi with her son Indra, the foremost among the gods and the wielder of thunder.

data.v: भरतो नाम कैकेय्यां जज्ञे सत्यपराक्रमः । साक्षाद्विष्णोश्चतुर्भागः सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः ।।
data.es: As an incarnation of the fourth part of Visnu, imbued with all virtues, and armed with truth Bharata was born to Kaikeyi.

data.v: अथ लक्ष्मणशत्रुघ्नौ सुमित्राजनयत्सुतौ । वीरौ सर्वास्त्रकुशलौ विष्णोरर्धसमन्वितौ ।।
data.es: Sumitra gave birth to Lakshmana and Satrughna who were heroic, skilled in the use of all weapons and endowed with the facets of Visnu.

data.v: राज्ञः पुत्रा महात्मानश्चत्वारो जज्ञिरे पृथक् । गुणवन्तोऽनुरूपाश्च रुच्या प्रोष्ठपदोपमाः ।।
data.es: Four worthy sons were successively born to the noble king (Dasaratha), endowed with all virtuous, resembling purvabhadra and uttarabhadra stars in brightness.

data.v: अतीत्यैकादशाहं तु नाम कर्म तथाकरोत् । ज्येष्ठं रामं महात्मानं भरतं कैकयीसुतम् ।।
data.es: After a lapse of eleven days, the naming ceremony was performed. Highly delighted preceptor Vasishta named Kausalya's son Rama, Kaikeyi's son Bharata, one son of Sumitra, Lakshmana and the other Satrughna.

data.v: सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणमिति शत्रुघ्नमपरं तथा । वसिष्ठः परमप्रीतो नामानि कृतवांस्तदा । तेषां जन्मक्रियादीनि सर्वकर्माण्यकारयत् ।।
data.es: After a lapse of eleven days, the naming ceremony was performed. Highly delighted preceptor Vasishta named Kausalya's son Rama, Kaikeyi's son Bharata, one son of Sumitra, Lakshmana and the other Satrughna.

data.v: तेषां केतुरिव ज्येष्ठो रामो रतिकरः पितुः । बभूव भूयो भूतानां स्वयम्भूरिव संमतः ।।
data.es: Among them, Rama like the exalted flag, became dear to his father like Brahma he was highly respected by all living beings.

data.v: सर्वे वेदविदः शूराः सर्वे लोकहिते रताः । सर्वे ज्ञानोपसंपन्नाः सर्वे समुदिता गुणैः ।।
data.es: All the sons (of Dasaratha) became wellversed in the Vedas. They were heroic, endowed with knowledge and virtues and were devoted to the welfare of the people.

data.v: तेषामपि महातेजा रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । बाल्यात्प्रभृति सुस्निग्धो लक्ष्मणो लक्ष्मिवर्धनः ।।
data.es: Right from his very childhood Lakshmana, an enhancer of fortune, always remained very attached to his eldest brother Rama, the delight of the world.

data.v: रामस्य लोकरामस्य भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य नित्यशः । सर्वप्रियकरस्तस्य रामस्यापि शरीरतः ।।
लक्ष्मणो लक्ष्मिसंपन्नो बहिःप्राण इवापरः । न च तेन विना निद्रां लभते पुरुषोत्तमः । मृष्टमन्नमुपानीतमश्नाति न हि तं विना ।।
data.es: Rama, the greatest among men would not sleep without Lakshmana's company. He would not partake even the choicest food minus to him.

data.v: यदा हि हयमारूढो मृगयां याति राघवः । तदैनं पृष्ठतोऽभ्येति सधनुः परिपालयन् ।।
data.es: Whenever Raghava (Rama) went hunting into the forest, riding the horse, Lakshmana used to follow him holding bow and arrows (in his hand).

data.v: भरतस्यापि शत्रुघ्नो लक्ष्मणावरजो हि सः । प्राणैः प्रियतरो नित्यं तस्य चासीत्तथा प्रियः ।।
data.es: In a similar manner Satrughna, younger brother of Lakshmana, became dearer than his own life to Bharata. Similarly, Bharata also was dear to Satrughna.

data.v: स चतुर्भिर्महाभागैः पुत्रैर्दशरथः प्रियैः । बभूव परमप्रीतो देवैरिव पितामहः ।।
data.es: With his very fortunate sons, Dasaratha was highly pleased like Brahma was with the gods.

data.v: ते यदा ज्ञानसंपन्नाः सर्वे समुदिता गुणैः । ह्रीमन्तः कीर्तिमन्तश्च सर्वज्ञा दीर्घदर्शिनः ।।
data.es: All his sons were enriched with knowledge and endowed with all virtues. They were modest, renowned, omniscient and farsighted. Dasaratha rejoiced at the sight of those glorious sons with such faculties and looked like Brahma, Lord of the worlds.

data.v: अथ राजा दशरथस्तेषां दारक्रियां प्रति । चिन्तयामास धर्मात्मा सोपाध्यायः सबान्धवः ।।
data.es: Then the virtuous king Dasaratha deliberated with his priests and kinsmen about the marriage of his sons.

data.v: तस्य चिन्तयमानस्य मन्त्रिमध्ये महात्मनः । अभ्यागच्छन्महातेजो विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: While the nobleminded king was thus deliberating in the midst of his counsellors, there arrived the effulgent ascetic Viswamitra.

data.v: स राज्ञो दर्शनाकाङ्क्षी द्वाराध्यक्षानुवाच ह । शीघ्रमाख्यात मां प्राप्तं कौशिकं गाधिनः सुतम् ।।
data.es: Desirous of seeing the king (Dasaratha) he accosted the doorkeepers, saying "Inform the king quickly about the arrival of Viswamitra, the son of Gadhi born in the line of Kusika".

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य राजवेश्म प्रदुद्रुवुः । संभ्रान्तमनसः सर्वे तेन वाक्येन चोदिताः ।।
data.es: On hearing those words (of Viswamitra) all of them prompted by fear because of left for the royal apartment with excited minds and hurried steps.

data.v: ते गत्वा राजभवनं विश्वामित्रमृषिं तदा । प्राप्तमावेदयामासुर्नृपायेक्ष्वाकवे तदा ।।
data.es: Having reached the royal hall, they reported to the king (Dasaratha), descendant of the Ikshvakus about the arrival of sage Viswamitra.

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सपुरोधाः समाहितः । प्रत्युज्जगाम संहृष्टो ब्रह्माणमिव वासवः ।।
data.es: Having heard their words, Dasaratha in great joy went forth together with his preceptors to receive him like Indra receiving Brahma.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा ज्वलितं दीप्त्या तापसं संशितव्रतम् । प्रहृष्टवदनो राजा ततोऽर्घ्यमुपहारयत् ।।
data.es: Seeing Viswamitra, shining with the power of his penance fulfilled the king with a cheerful countenance made offerings with due respect.

data.v: स राज्ञः प्रतिगृह्यार्घ्यं शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा । कुशलं चाव्ययं चैव पर्यपृच्छन्नराधिपम् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra received the offerings as ordained in the scriptures and enquired from the king about the welfare and prosperity of his kingdom.

data.v: वसिष्ठं च समागम्य कुशलं मुनिपुंगवः । ऋषींश्च तान्यथा न्यायं महाभागानुवाच ह ।।
data.es: The foremost of ascetis, Viswamitra approached Vasishta and all other distinguised sages following the protocal and enquired about their welfare.

data.v: ते सर्वे हृष्टमनसस्तस्य राज्ञो निवेशनम् । विविशुः पूजितास्तत्र निषेदुश्च यथार्थतः ।।
data.es: All of them with gladdened hearts entered the royal palace and sat down, in accordance with their position after having been duly honoured by the king.

data.v: अथ हृष्टमना राजा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । उवाच परमोदारो हृष्टस्तमभिपूजयन् ।।
data.es: Then the munificent king, very much (at Viswamitra's arrival) pleased offered him a happy hospitality and spoke:

data.v: यथामृतस्य संप्राप्तिर्यथा वर्षमनूदके । यथा सदृशदारेषु पुत्रजन्माप्रजस्य च । प्रनष्टस्य यथा लाभो यथा हर्षो महोदये । तथैवागमनं मन्ये स्वागतं ते महामुने ।।
data.es: "O great sage, welcome to you Your arrival, to me, is like nectar (to a human being), rains to the parched land, birth of a son to the childless through his worthy wife, recovery of lost properity and festive joy in a great achievemnt.

data.v: कं च ते परमं कामं करोमि किमु हर्षितः । पात्रभूतोऽसि मे विप्र दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि धार्मिक । अद्य मे सफलं जन्म जीवितं च सुजीवितम् ।।
पूर्वं राजर्षिशब्देन तपसा द्योतितप्रभः । ब्रह्मर्षित्वमनुप्राप्तः पूज्योऽसि बहुधा मया ।।
data.es: Earlier you were rajarshi, a warrior sage. By your austerities you have obtained the brilliance that lends radiance even to the Sun and the Moon you have gained the status of a brahmrshi. In several ways you are worthy of my worship.

data.v: तदद्भुतमिदं विप्र पवित्रं परमं मम । शुभक्षेत्रगतश्चाहं तव संदर्शनात्प्रभो ।।
data.es: O Brahman your arrival has caused surprise to me. It has conferred great purity on me. O Lord by your very presence here, I feel I haved acquired the merits of a pilgrimage.

data.v: ब्रूहि यत्प्रार्थितं तुभ्यं कार्यमागमनं प्रति । इच्छाम्यनुगृहीतोऽहं त्वदर्थपरिवृद्धये ।।
data.es: Be pleased to tell me the purpose of your visit. I desire to be given the privilege of doing service to achieve your object.

data.v: कार्यस्य न विमर्शं च गन्तुमर्हसि कौशिक । कर्ता चाहमशेषेण दैवतं हि भवान्मम ।।
data.es: O Viswamitra you need not hesitatate to tell me what ought to be performed. I shall accomplish that act in every possible special way. You are a god to me.

data.v: इति हृदयसुखं निशम्य वाक्यं; श्रुतिसुखमात्मवता विनीतमुक्तम् । प्रथितगुणयशा गुणैर्विशिष्टः; परम ऋषिः परमं जगाम हर्षम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words spoken in such an humble manner by the prudent king words pleasing to the mind and to the ears, the great rishi of celebrated virtues and fame, of sterling qualities experienced deep delight.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा राजसिंहस्य वाक्यमद्भुतविस्तरम् । हृष्टरोमा महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Having heard these wonderful words of Dasaratha, the lion among kings, the brilliant Viswamitra with hair on end replied:

data.v: सदृशं राजशार्दूल तवैतद्भुवि नान्यतः । महावंशप्रसूतस्य वसिष्ठव्यपदेशिनः ।।
data.es: "O Tiger among kings having been born on earth in an illustrious lineage and initiated by Vasishta, this way (of speaking) befits you. It cannot be any other way.

data.v: यत्तु मे हृद्गतं वाक्यं तस्य कार्यस्य निश्चयम् । कुरुष्व राजशार्दूल भव सत्यप्रतिश्रवः ।।
data.es: O Tiger among kings I shall unfold the purpose conceived in my mind. Take a decision and be truthful to your promise.

data.v: अहं नियममातिष्ठे सिद्ध्यर्थं पुरुषर्षभ । तस्य विघ्नकरौ द्वौ तु राक्षसौ कामरूपिणौ ।।
data.es: O best among men for the successful completion of a sacrifice I took up a selfimposed religious observance. Two rakshasas, capable of assuming forms at will, are creating impediments to that sacrifice.

data.v: व्रते मे बहुशश्चीर्णे समाप्त्यां राक्षसाविमौ । मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च वीर्यवन्तौ सुशिक्षितौ । तौ मांसरुधिरौघेण वेदिं तामभ्यवर्षताम् ।।
data.es: When my sacrifice generally speaking, is nearing completion the powerful and welltrained Maricha and Subahu who are raining streams of blood and flesh upon the altar.

data.v: अवधूते तथा भूते तस्मिन्नियमनिश्चये । कृतश्रमो निरुत्साहस्तस्माद्देशादपाक्रमे ।।
data.es: The (solemn) vow for observance of religious rites being thus interrupted, I left that country as an exerted and discouraged man.

data.v: न च मे क्रोधमुत्स्रष्टुं बुद्धिर्भवति पार्थिव । तथाभूता हि सा चर्या न शापस्तत्र मुच्यते ।।
data.es: O King my mind does not permit me to vent my wrath. The nature of sacrifice is such that I refrain from cursing them.

data.v: स्वपुत्रं राजशार्दूल रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् । काकपक्षधरं शूरं ज्येष्ठं मे दातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O tiger among kings it is befitting of you to entrust your eldest son Rama to me who is valiant, young (having sidelocks of hair) and true to his prowess.

data.v: शक्तो ह्येष मया गुप्तो दिव्येन स्वेन तेजसा । राक्षसा ये विकर्तारस्तेषामपि विनाशने ।।
data.es: Protected by me and by his own divine power, Rama is capable of destroying even those demons causing impediments to the sacrifice.

data.v: श्रेयश्चास्मै प्रदास्यामि बहुरूपं न संशयः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां येन ख्यातिं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: I will confer upon him, without doubt, a lot of blessings for his wellbeing by which he will attain fame in all the three worlds.

data.v: न च तौ राममासाद्य शक्तौ स्थातुं कथंचन । न च तौ राघवादन्यो हन्तुमुत्सहते पुमान् ।।
data.es: Both of them (Maricha and Subahu) will not be able to withstand Rama in any way. Rama, and Rama alone, is capable of destroying them.

data.v: वीर्योत्सिक्तौ हि तौ पापौ कालपाशवशं गतौ । रामस्य राजशार्दूल न पर्याप्तौ महात्मनः ।।
data.es: Proud of their strength, the two wicked demons have been noosed by Yama, the god of death. O tiger among kings they are no match for the magnanimous Rama.

data.v: न च पुत्रकृतं स्नेहं कर्तुमर्हसि पार्थिव । अहं ते प्रतिजानामि हतौ तौ विद्धि राक्षसौ ।।
data.es: "O king it is not proper for you to hesitate because of your paternal affection. You need to know that both the rakshasas will perish. This, I assure you.

data.v: अहं वेद्मि महात्मानं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् । वसिष्ठोऽपि महातेजा ये चेमे तपसि स्थिताः ।।
data.es: I know Rama who is a great soul, true to his prowess and also Vasishta of great lustre and these other sages who have been steadfast in asceticism also know.

data.v: यदि ते धर्मलाभं च यशश्च परमं भुवि । स्थिरमिच्छसि राजेन्द्र रामं मे दातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O king of kings, if you are seeking the benefits of righteousness, great everlasting fame in this world, it is fit and proper to give Rama to me.

data.v: यद्यभ्यनुज्ञां काकुत्स्थ ददते तव मन्त्रिणः । वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सर्वे ततो रामं विसर्जय ।।
data.es: O Kakustha if your counsellors and all other sages headed by Vasishta give their consent, then only you may relieve Rama.

data.v: अभिप्रेतमसंसक्तमात्मजं दातुमर्हसि । दशरात्रं हि यज्ञस्य रामं राजीवलोचनम् ।।
data.es: You should spare your dear son, the lotuseyed Rama, impartial and detached, for ten nights.

data.v: नात्येति कालो यज्ञस्य यथायं मम राघव । तथा कुरुष्व भद्रं ते मा च शोके मनः कृथाः ।।
data.es: O (Dasaratha), descendant of Raghu act in such a manner that the time for my sacrifice is not delayed. Do not indulge in grief. Prosperity to you"

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा धर्मात्मा धर्मार्थसहितं वचः । विरराम महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: After speaking these words charged with dharma and artha the great sage resplendent Viswamitra fell silent.

data.v: इति हृदयमनोविदारणं; मुनिवचनं तदतीव शुश्रुवान् । नरपतिरगमद्भयं मह;द्व्यथितमनाः प्रचचाल चासनात् ।।
data.es: The great king felt shaken off his throne after listening to the words of the sage (Viswamitra) which broke his heart and terribly upset his mind.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा राजशार्दूल विश्वामित्रस्य भाषितम् । मुहूर्तमिव निःसंज्ञः संज्ञावानिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Viswamitra, words the tiger among kings (Dasaratha) lost his senses for a moment and on regaining his consciousness spoke this way.

data.v: ऊनषोडशवर्षो मे रामो राजीवलोचनः । न युद्धयोग्यतामस्य पश्यामि सह राक्षसैः ।।
data.es: "My lotuseyed son Rama is less than sixteen. I do not think he has ability to fight with the rakshasas in a battle.

data.v: इयमक्षौहिणी पूर्णा यस्याहं पतिरीश्वरः । अनया संवृतो गत्वा योधाहं तैर्निशाचरैः ।।
data.es: Here is the whole akshauhini (army) of which I am the lord and sustainer. Accompanied by the akshauhini I shall engage those rakshsasas in the battle.

data.v: इमे शूराश्च विक्रान्ता भृत्या मेऽस्त्रविशारदाः । योग्या रक्षोगणैर्योद्धुं न रामं नेतुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: These servants of mine are warriors, valiant, powerful and courageous, skilled in the use of weapons and fit to engage multitude of rakshasas in battle. It is not proper to take Rama with you.

data.v: अहमेव धनुष्पाणिर्गोप्ता समरमूर्धनि । यावत्प्राणान्धरिष्यामि तावद्योत्स्ये निशाचरैः ।।
data.es: Wielding bow in hand I will protect the sacrifice. As long as my life sustains, I will engage the rakshasas in the battle.

data.v: निर्विघ्ना व्रतचर्या सा भविष्यति सुरक्षिता । अहं तत्र गमिष्यामि न राम नेतुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: .I shall go there, protect the sacrifice and see that it is conducted without obstacles. It is not proper to take Rama with you.

data.v: बालो ह्यकृतविद्यश्च न च वेत्ति बलाबलम् । न चास्त्रबलसंयुक्तो न च युद्धविशारदः । न चासौ रक्षसां योग्यः कूटयुद्धा हि ते ध्रुवम् ।।
data.es: Rama is still a child, he is not learned in the science of warfare,he does not know the strength and weakness of enemies. He has not acquired as yet the strength of using weapons and is not proficient in warfare. You know certainly those rakshasas are deceitful in battle. And hence he is not qualified to oppose them in the battle succesfully.

data.v: विप्रयुक्तो हि रामेण मुहूर्तमपि नोत्सहे । जीवितुं मुनिशार्दूल न रामं नेतुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Separated from Rama, I do not like to live even for a moment. O tiger among ascetics, it is not proper to take Rama with you.

data.v: यदि वा राघवं ब्रह्मन्नेतुमिच्छसि सुव्रत । चतुरङ्गसमायुक्तं मया सह च तं नय ।।
data.es: O sage of great vows, O brahman if at all you intend to take Rama with you, take me also along with my army.

data.v: षष्टिर्वर्षसहस्राणि जातस्य मम कौशिक । दुःखेनोत्पादितश्चायं न रामं नेतुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O scion of of Kusika family, sixty thousand years have passed since I was born. Rama was born to me after a great deal of suffering. It is not proper to take him with you.

data.v: चतुर्णामात्मजानां हि प्रीतिः परमिका मम । ज्येष्ठं धर्मप्रधानं च न रामं नेतुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: My love for Rama among all my four sons is supreme.It is not proper for you to take Rama, the eldest son whose prime qualification is his virtue.

data.v: किं वीर्या राक्षसास्ते च कस्य पुत्राश्च के च ते । कथं प्रमाणाः के चैतान्रक्षन्ति मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: O best of sages, how powerful are those rakshsas? Whose sons are they? Who are they and how huge is their body? Who are protecting them?

data.v: कथं च प्रतिकर्तव्यं तेषां रामेण रक्षसाम् । मामकैर्वा बलैर्ब्रह्मन्मया वा कूटयोधिनाम् ।।
data.es: O brahman, how to rebuff those deceitful warriors either through Rama or through my army or through me?

data.v: सर्वं मे शंस भगवन्कथं तेषां मया रणे । स्थातव्यं दुष्टभावानां वीर्योत्सिक्ता हि राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: O venerable one, how to fight those wickednatured ones in the battle and stay aginst them? For rakshasas are proud of their prowess". Having heard the words of Dasaratha, Viswamitra said:

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत । पौलस्त्यवंशप्रभवो रावणो नाम राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Having heard Sunassepha, mighty ascetic Viswamitra consoled him in many ways and said to his sons:

data.v: स ब्रह्मणा दत्तवरस्त्रैलोक्यं बाधते भृशम् । महाबलो महावीर्यो राक्षसैर्बहुभिर्वृतः ।।
श्रूयते हि महावीर्यो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः । साक्षाद्वैश्रवणभ्राता पुत्रो विश्रवसो मुनेः ।।
data.es: Ravana, king of rakshasas, is the brother of Kubera and son of ascetic Visravana. He is said to possess great prowess.

data.v: यदा स्वयं न यज्ञस्य विघ्नकर्ता महाबलः । तेन संचोदितौ तौ तु राक्षसौ सुमहाबलौ । मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च यज्ञविघ्नं करिष्यतः ।।
data.es: Although endowed with great strength, Ravana, by himself, never created impediments to the sacrifice. But two rakshasas by name Maricha and Subahu are incited by him to cause obstacles".

data.v: इत्युक्तो मुनिना तेन राजोवाच मुनिं तदा । न हि शक्तोऽस्मि संग्रामे स्थातुं तस्य दुरात्मनः ।।
data.es: Informed in this manner by sage Viswamitra, king Dasaratha addressed the sage, saying, "I am not competent enough to stand before those evilminded rakshasas in the batlle".

data.v: स त्वं प्रसादं धर्मज्ञ कुरुष्व मम पुत्रके । देवदानवगन्धर्वा यक्षाः पतगपन्नगाः ।।
data.es: "You are the knower of righteousness. Extend your favour to my little son and also to me for I am so who is unfortunate. You are verily my spiritual preceptor and god.

data.v: न शक्ता रावणं सोढुं किं पुनर्मानवा युधि । स हि वीर्यवतां वीर्यमादत्ते युधि राक्षसः ।।
तेन चाहं न शक्तोऽस्मि संयोद्धुं तस्य वा बलैः । सबलो वा मुनिश्रेष्ठ सहितो वा ममात्मजैः ।।
data.es: That rakshasa pulls out warriors' prowess in the battle. O foremost of ascetics Either with forces or with my sons it is not possible for me to engage him or his forces in battle.

data.v: कथमप्यमरप्रख्यं संग्रामाणामकोविदम् । बालं मे तनयं ब्रह्मन्नैव दास्यामि पुत्रकम् ।।
data.es: O brahman although my son resembles the celestials he is not experienced in warfare. On no account shall I spare him.

data.v: अथ कालोपमौ युद्धे सुतौ सुन्दोपसुन्दयोः । यज्ञविघ्नकरौ तौ ते नैव दास्यामि पुत्रकम् ।।
data.es: Further the sons of Sunda and Upasunda by name Maricha and Subahu are causing obstacles to your sacrifice. They resemble the god of death, Yama. I shall never part with my son.

data.v: मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च वीर्यवन्तौ सुशिक्षितौ । तयोरन्यतरेणाहं योद्धा स्यां ससुहृद्गणः ।।
data.es: Maricha and Subahu not only possess prowess but also are experienced in warfare. Together with my group of friends I can combat with one of the two".

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य स्नेहपर्याकुलाक्षरम् । समन्युः कौशिको वाक्यं प्रत्युवच महीपतिम् ।।
data.es: Out of affection towards his son, his (king Dasaratha's) plea to Viswamitra was full of contradiction. And on hearing the king, enraged Viswamitra replied:

data.v: पूर्ह्वमर्थं प्रतिश्रुत्य प्रतिज्ञां हातुमिच्छसि । रागवाणामयुक्तोऽयं कुलस्यास्य विपर्ययः ।।
यदिदं ते क्षमं राजन्गमिष्यामि यथागतम् । मिथ्याप्रतिज्ञः काकुत्स्थ सुखी भव सबान्धवः ।।
data.es: O king, if this act of yours is appropriate to you, I will go back (to the places) where from I came. O scion of the race of kakutstha, you have proved false to your promise. Live happily with your relatives".

data.v: तस्य रोषपरीतस्य विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । चचाल वसुधा कृत्स्ना विवेश च भयं सुरान् ।।
data.es: At the sight of the wise sage Viswamitra seized of wrath, the entire earth shook and devatas were gripped in fear.

data.v: त्रस्तरूपं तु विज्ञाय जगत्सर्वं महानृषिः । नृपतिं सुव्रतो धीरो वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Great Vasishta, an adherent of ascetic practices and steadfast (to duty), seeing that the entire world frightened addressed the king, saying:

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातः साक्षाद्धर्म इवापरः । धृतिमान्सुव्रतः श्रीमान्न धर्मं हातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "Born in the line of Ikshvaku, you are a veritable the second god of righteousness, firm adherent of vows auspicious and virtuous. It is not right on your part to abandon your promise.

data.v: त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्यातो धर्मात्मा इति राघवः । स्वधर्मं प्रतिपद्यस्व नाधर्मं वोढुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O Dasaratha you are reputed in the three worlds as righteousminded. Do your own duty. Do not follow an unjust act which is unworthy of respect.

data.v: संश्रुत्यैवं करिष्यामीत्यकुर्वाणस्य राघव । इष्टापूर्तवधो भूयात्तस्माद्रामं विसर्जय ।।
data.es: O Dasaratha, a promise made and not kept amounts to destruction of merits earned through previous pieties. Therefore send Rama (with him).

data.v: कृतास्त्रमकृतास्त्रं वा नैनं शक्ष्यन्ति राक्षसाः । गुप्तं कुशिकपुत्रेण ज्वलनेनामृतं यथा ।।
data.es: Trained or not in the use of arms, as long as Rama is protected by Viswamitra, just as nectar is protected by the flaming firegod rakshasas will not be able to compete with him.

data.v: एष विग्रहवान्धर्म एष वीर्यवतां वरः । एष बुद्ध्याधिको लोके तपसश्च परायणम् ।।
data.es: This (Viswamitra) is an embodiment of righteousness and unsurpassed among the powerful. None can excel him in intellect in this world. He is the supreme refuge in austerity.

data.v: एषोऽस्त्रान्विविधान्वेत्ति त्रैलोक्ये सचराचरे । नैनमन्यः पुमान्वेत्ति न च वेत्स्यन्ति केचन ।।
data.es: This Viswamitra knows the use of various kinds of weapons which no one knows among the animate and the inanimate in the three worlds. Nor will any one even know in future.

data.v: न देवा नर्षयः केचिन्नासुरा न च राक्षसाः । गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवराः सकिंनरमहोरगाः ।।
data.es: No gods nor sages nor asuras in rakshasas nor kinnaras nor mighty serpents nor gandharvas nor the best of yakshas (will be able to know)

data.v: सर्वास्त्राणि कृशाश्वस्य पुत्राः परमधार्मिकाः । कौशिकाय पुरा दत्ता यदा राज्यं प्रशासति ।।
data.es: All these weapons were given to Viswamitra by Bhrisasva's highly virtuous sons while he was ruling the kingdom.

data.v: तेऽपि पुत्राः कृशाश्वस्य प्रजापतिसुतासुताः । नैकरूपा महावीर्या दीप्तिमन्तो जयावहाः ।।
data.es: Grandsons (daughter's sons) of Prajapati, they (these weapons) are in diverse forms, highly energetic and full of glory they bring victory.

data.v: जया च सुप्रभा चैव दक्षकन्ये सुमध्यमे । ते सुवातेऽस्त्रशस्त्राणि शतं परमभास्वरम् ।।
data.es: Jaya and Suprabha of slender waists are the two daughters of Daksha. They gave birth to one hundred effulgent sons known as astras and shastras.

data.v: पञ्चाशतं सुताँल्लेभे जया नाम वरान्पुरा । वधायासुरसैन्यानाममेयान्कामरूपिणः ।।
data.es: Formerly Jaya, for the destruction of the army of asuras gave birth to fifty sons by virtue of a boon. They possess immeasurable power of changing forms at will.

data.v: सुप्रभाजनयच्चापि पुत्रान्पञ्चाशतं पुनः । संहारान्नाम दुर्धर्षान्दुराक्रामान्बलीयसः ।।
data.es: Suprabha gave birth to another fifty sons named Samharas who are unassailable, invincible and more powerful.

data.v: तानि चास्त्राणि वेत्त्येष यथावत्कुशिकात्मजः । अपूर्वाणां च जनने शक्तो भूयश्च धर्मवित् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra is well conversant with these weapons. Being virtuous, he is capable of creating new weapons also.

data.v: एवं वीर्यो महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । न रामगमने राजन्संशयं गन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Such is the prowess of Viswamitra who is a highly effulgent and highly renowned sage. O King in sending Rama, you need not entertain any doubt.

data.v: तथा वसिष्ठे ब्रुवति राजा दशरथः सुतम् । प्रहृष्टवदनो राममाजुहाव सलक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: Vasishta having said thus, king Dasaratha, with cheerful countenance summoned Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: कृतस्वस्त्ययनं मात्रा पित्रा दशरथेन च । पुरोधसा वसिष्ठेन मङ्गलैरभिमन्त्रितम् ।।
data.es: Rama was given farewell by his parents with recitation of mantras (for securing prosperity and averting evils). Priest Vasishta sanctified him with mantras Dasaratha kissed his son on the forehead and delivered him to the care of Viswamitra, with a heart full of cheer.

data.v: स पुत्रं मूर्ध्न्युपाघ्राय राजा दशरथः प्रियम् । ददौ कुशिकपुत्राय सुप्रीतेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: Rama was given farewell by his parents with recitation of mantras (for securing prosperity and averting evils). Priest Vasishta sanctified him with mantras Dasaratha kissed his son on the forehead and delivered him to the care of Viswamitra, with a heart full of cheer.

data.v: ततो वायुः सुखस्पर्शो विरजस्को ववौ तदा । विश्वामित्रगतं रामं दृष्ट्वा राजीवलोचनम् ।।
data.es: At the sight of the lotuseyed Rama accompanying Viswamitra, the wind blew pollenfree with a gentle touch.

data.v: पुष्पवृष्टिर्महत्यासीद्देवदुन्दुभिनिस्वनः । शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिर्घोषः प्रयाते तु महात्मनि ।।
data.es: The departure of glorious Viswamitra was greeted with incessant showers of flowers, the beating of celestial drums and the blowing of conches.

data.v: विश्वामित्रो ययावग्रे ततो रामो महायशाः । काकपक्षधरो धन्वी तं च सौमित्रिरन्वगात् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra walked in the forefront. Behind him was Rama, bow in hand, while in the archer, Sumitra's son (Lakshmana) with side locks of hair followed.

data.v: कलापिनौ धनुष्पाणी शोभयानौ दिशो दश । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं त्रिशीर्षाविव पन्नगौ । अनुजग्मतुरक्षुद्रौ पितामहमिवाश्विनौ ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana equipped with bows and quivers resembled three hooded serpents. Warriors of no less prowess, they illuminated the ten quarters and followed the high souled Viswamitra like twin Aswanikumaras following the grandsire, Brahma.

data.v: बद्धगोधाङ्गुलित्राणौ खड्गवन्तौ महाद्युती । स्थाणुं देवमिवाचिन्त्यं कुमाराविव पावकी ।।
data.es: Then bows in hand, wellattired, their fingers encased in mongrel skin, for protection (against the bowstring) armed with scimitars, resplendent, young, handsome the two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana shone unblemished. As they followed sage Viswamitra spreading radiance, they looked like sons of the god of fire, (Skanda and Visakhu) following the incomprehensible Siva.

data.v: अध्यर्धयोजनं गत्वा सरय्वा दक्षिणे तटे । रामेति मधुरा वाणीं विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: After crossing a distance of over half a yojana on the southern bank of Sarayu, Viswamitra addressed Rama sweet in a gentle voice.

data.v: गृहाण वत्स सलिलं मा भूत्कालस्य पर्ययः । मन्त्रग्रामं गृहाण त्वं बलामतिबलां तथा ।।
data.es: "O child, take this water (in your hands), let there be no delay. You will receive from me a collection of mantras and also bala and atibala.

data.v: न श्रमो न ज्वरो वा ते न रूपस्य विपर्ययः । न च सुप्तं प्रमत्तं वा धर्षयिष्यन्ति नैरृताः ।।
data.es: "(If you receive these mantras), you will experience neither fatigue, nor fever nor will there be a change in your appearance. Whether you are asleep or agitated, rakshasas cannot harm you.

data.v: न बाह्वोः सदृशो वीर्ये पृथिव्यामस्ति कश्चन । त्रिषु लोकेषु वा राम न भवेत्सदृशस्तव ।।
data.es: O Rama, there is none in this world equal to the might of your hands nor does such a person exist in the three worlds.

data.v: न सौभाग्ये न दाक्षिण्ये न ज्ञाने बुद्धिनिश्चये । नोत्तरे प्रतिपत्तव्यो समो लोके तवानघ ।।
data.es: O sinless one, there is none in this world equal to you in good fortune, kindness, wisdom, in taking a decsion or giving a reply.

data.v: एतद्विद्याद्वये लब्धे भविता नास्ति ते समः । बला चातिबला चैव सर्वज्ञानस्य मातरौ ।।
data.es: With these two kinds of knowledge secured, there will be none equal to you, at present or in fututre. Bala and atibala are mother to all kinds of knowledge .

data.v: क्षुत्पिपासे न ते राम भविष्येते नरोत्तम । बलामतिबलां चैव पठतः पथि राघव । विद्याद्वयमधीयाने यशश्चाप्यतुलं भुवि ।।
data.es: O Rama, best among men, scion in the line of Raghu, on your way you will not feel hunger or thirst if you recite bala and atibala.

data.v: पितामहसुते ह्येते विद्ये तेजःसमन्विते । प्रदातुं तव काकुत्स्थ सदृशस्त्वं हि धार्मिक ।।
data.es: O Rama, born in the line Kakutstha and one who is righteous, these two radiant sciences are daughters of the grandsire Brahma. If you pursue these two sciences, you will get unequalled fame. You are a fit person to confer these two sciences.

data.v: कामं बहुगुणाः सर्वे त्वय्येते नात्र संशयः । तपसा संभृते चैते बहुरूपे भविष्यतः ।।
data.es: You possess all these qualities in great measure. There is no doubt that If these two sciences (mantras) are nourished with austerities they will assume multiple forms (and benefit you)".

data.v: ततो रामो जलं स्पृष्ट्वा प्रहृष्टवदनः शुचिः । प्रतिजग्राह ते विद्ये महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । विद्यासमुदितो रामः शुशुभे भूरिविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Rama, touched the water and was sanctified. With a cheerful face he received those two sciences from the maharshi who had perceived the supreme soul.

data.v: गुरुकार्याणि सर्वाणि नियुज्य कुशिकात्मजे । ऊषुस्तां रजनीं तत्र सरय्वां सुसुखं त्रयः ।।
data.es: .Rama, the highly heroic after acquiring knowledge (of the two sciences) and having rendered all services to preceptor Viswamitra, appeared resplendent like the Sungod in autumn. There the three of them spent the night comfortably on the bank of Sarayu.

data.v: प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । अभ्यभाषत काकुत्स्थं शयानं पर्णसंस्तरे ।।
data.es: When the night turned into daybreak, the eminent ascetic Viswamitra, addressing the descendants of Kakutstha (Rama and Lakshmana) who were lying on a bed of leaves said:

data.v: कौसल्या सुप्रजा राम पूर्वा संध्या प्रवर्तते । उत्तिष्ठ नरशार्दूल कर्तव्यं दैवमाह्निकम् ।।
data.es: "O beloved son of Kausalya, O Rama the day dawns. O best among men, awake, oblations to gods and other sacred rites are required to be performed".

data.v: तस्यर्षेः परमोदारं वचः श्रुत्वा नृपात्मजौ । स्नात्वा कृतोदकौ वीरौ जेपतुः परमं जपम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the very affectionate call of Viswamitra both the brave princes had their bath and offered oblations to Sungod (standing in the water) and recited the holy name of the Lord.

data.v: कृताह्निकौ महावीर्यौ विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् । अभिवाद्याभिसंहृष्टौ गमनायोपतस्थतुः ।।
data.es: On performing the morning rites, the two highly powerful and and energetic princes stood before Viswamitra who was richly endowed with asceticism. They prostrated before him. And stood ready for their onward journey.

data.v: तौ प्रयाते महावीर्यौ दिव्यं त्रिपथगां नदीम् । ददृशाते ततस्तत्र सरय्वाः संगमे शुभे ।।
data.es: Thereafter, having gone a little further both the heroic brothers looked at the confluence of holy Sarayu with divine Ganga divided into three branches.

data.v: तत्राश्रमपदं पुण्यमृषीणामुग्रतेजसाम् । बहुवर्षसहस्राणि तप्यतां परमं तपः ।।
data.es: There they saw a sacred hermitage of anchorites of great vitality performing severe austerities for thousands of years.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा परमप्रीतौ राघवौ पुण्यमाश्रमम् । ऊचतुस्तं महात्मानं विश्वामित्रमिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Exceedingly delighted to see the sacred hermitage, the two princes enquired from the illustrious sage Viswamitra:

data.v: कस्यायमाश्रमः पुण्यः को न्वस्मिन्वसते पुमान् । भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छावः परं कौतूहलं हि नौ ।।
data.es: "O worshipful one, whose sacred hermitage is this? Who lives here? Indeed, we are curious to know".

data.v: तयोस्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रहस्य मुनिपुंगवः । अब्रवीच्छ्रूयतां राम यस्यायं पूर्व आश्रमः ।।
data.es: On having heard their words, the foremost of sages gently smiled and said, "O Rama listen, who this hermitage belonged to in the past".

data.v: कन्दर्पो मूर्तिमानासीत्काम इत्युच्यते बुधैः ।।
तपस्यन्तमिह स्थाणुं नियमेन समाहितम् । कृतोद्वाहं तु देवेशं गच्छन्तं समरुद्गणम् । धर्षयामास दुर्मेधा हुंकृतश्च महात्मना ।।
data.es: "Kandarpa (the god of love) once lived here in human form. He is called Kama by the learned. The wicked Kama on his way with the maruts (god of wind) insulted Siva, the god of gods, while he was absorbed in austere meditation along with his newly wedded consort. On seeing Kama Lord Siva roared at him (menacingly).

data.v: दग्धस्य तस्य रौद्रेण चक्षुषा रघुनन्दन । व्यशीर्यन्त शरीरात्स्वात्सर्वगात्राणि दुर्मतेः ।।
data.es: "O descendant of Raghu, burnt down by his fierce (third) eye, all the limbs of the body of that evilminded Kama were consumed.

data.v: तस्य गात्रं हतं तत्र निर्दग्धस्य महात्मना । अशरीरः कृतः कामः क्रोधाद्देवेश्वरेण ह ।।
data.es: Having been completely burnt down by Lord Siva, Kama's body was destroyed. Mighty angry, Siva, reduced Kama to a 'disembodied being.

data.v: अनङ्ग इति विख्यातस्तदा प्रभृति राघव । स चाङ्गविषयः श्रीमान्यत्राङ्गं स मुमोच ह ।।
data.es: O descendant of the Raghus, from that time onwards, he was known as 'Ananga' (one without form). The beautiful place where he gave up his body is known as Angadesa.

data.v: तस्यायमाश्रमः पुण्यस्तस्येमे मुनयः पुरा । शिष्या धर्मपरा वीर तेषां पापं न विद्यते ।।
data.es: This holy hermitage belongs to Kama. These ascetics are his disciples. They are always righteous and are free from sin.

data.v: इहाद्य रजनीं राम वसेम शुभदर्शन । पुण्ययोः सरितोर्मध्ये श्वस्तरिष्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: O auspiciouslooking Rama, we will stay here tonight at the confluence of both these sacred rivers (Sarayu and Ganga) and cross over Ganga tomorrow.

data.v: तेषां संवदतां तत्र तपो दीर्घेण चक्षुषा । विज्ञाय परमप्रीता मुनयो हर्षमागमन् ।।
data.es: As they were conversing thus, the ascetics, with their far reaching spiritual vision (beyond the veil of time) recognised them and were immensely pleased.

data.v: अर्घ्यं पाद्यं तथातिथ्यं निवेद्यकुशिकात्मजे । रामलक्ष्मणयोः पश्चादकुर्वन्नतिथिक्रियाम् ।।
data.es: After extending hospitality to the son of Kusika (Viswamitra) with respectful offerings, and water for washing feet they played the host to Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: सत्कारं समनुप्राप्य कथाभिरभिरञ्जयन् । न्यवसन्सुसुखं तत्र कामाश्रमपदे तदा ।।
data.es: Having received due hospitality, they delighted them (ascetics) with their talk. The rishis with composed minds recited their evening prayer as usual.

data.v: ततः प्रभाते विमले कृताह्निकमरिंदमौ । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य नद्यास्तीरमुपागतौ ।।
data.es: Thereafter the destroyers of foes, Rama and Lakshmana offering their morning oblations on that bright dawn arrived at the bank of the river (Ganga) with Viswamitra ahead of them.

data.v: ते च सर्वे महात्मानो मुनयः संशितव्रताः । उपस्थाप्य शुभां नावं विश्वामित्रमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: All the highminded ascetics and strict followers of vows secured an auspicious boat for them and addressed Viswamitra, saying:

data.v: आरोहतु भवान्नावं राजपुत्रपुरस्कृतः । अरिष्टं गच्छ पन्थानं मा भूत्कालस्य पर्ययः ।।
data.es: With the princes ahead of you, board the boat. Tread the safe path. Let there be no loss of time.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तथेत्युक्त्वा तानृषीनभिपूज्य च । ततार सहितस्ताभ्यां सरितं सागरं गमाम् ।।
data.es: "Be it so", said Viswamitra and paid respect to all those sages. And accompanied by them (Rama and Lakshmana), crossed the river flowing towards the sea.

data.v: अथ रामः सरिन्मध्ये पप्रच्छ मुनिपुङ्गवम् । वारिणो भिद्यमानस्य किमयं तुमुलो ध्वनिः ।।
data.es: Rama enquired of Viswamitra, the best of sages, "What is this tumultuous sound bursting out of the waters?"

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा कौतूहल समन्वितम् । कथयामास धर्मात्मा तस्य शब्दस्य निश्चयम् ।।
data.es: At the words of Rama filled with curiosity, the righteous (Viswamitra) narrated the true nature of that sound.

data.v: कैलासपर्वते राम मनसा निर्मितं सरः । ब्रह्मणा नरशार्दूल तेनेदं मानसं सरः ।।
data.es: "O tiger among men, Rama. Brahma created out of his mind a lake on mount Kailas and so that lake is called Manasa (Sarovara).

data.v: तस्मात्सुस्राव सरसः सायोध्यामुपगूहते । सरःप्रवृत्ता सरयूः पुण्या ब्रह्मसरश्च्युता ।।
data.es: This river which flows from Manasa Sarovara is, therefore, known as 'Sarayu'. It surrounds Ayodhya. This sacred river flows from that lake of Brahma.

data.v: तस्यायमतुलः शब्दो जाह्नवीमभिवर्तते । वारिसंक्षोभजो राम प्रणामं नियतः कुरु ।।
data.es: When Ganga approaches this river (Sarayu), there is a clash of waters and this great noise is produced. Rama, offer respectful salutations here, with a calm mind".

data.v: ताभ्यां तु तावुभौ कृत्वा प्रणाममतिधार्मिकौ । तीरं दक्षिणमासाद्य जग्मतुर्लघुविक्रमौ ।।
data.es: Deeply religious (in nature) they both made obeisance to the two rivers and reached the southern bank and advanced with quick steps.

data.v: स वनं घोरसंकाशं दृष्ट्वा नृपवरात्मजः । अविप्रहतमैक्ष्वाकः पप्रच्छ मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: He who was a descendent of Ikshvaku and son of the best of kings, (Dasaratha) having seen that untrodden and dreadful forest asked the foremost of the ascetics:

data.v: अहो वनमिदं दुर्गं झिल्लिकागणनादितम् । भैरवैः श्वापदैः कीर्णं शकुन्तैर्दारुणारुतैः ।।
data.es: "What a wonder This inaccessible forest echoes with the (shrill) chirpings of crickets It is filled with ferocious beasts and birds producing fearful sounds.

data.v: नानाप्रकारैः शकुनैर्वाश्यद्भिर्भैरवस्वनैः । सिंहव्याघ्रवराहैश्च वारणैश्चापि शोभितम् ।।
data.es: "It resounds with the frightful shricks of various kinds of birds. Lions, tigers, boars and elephants prowl about.

data.v: धवाश्वकर्णककुभैर्बिल्वतिन्दुकपाटलैः । संकीर्णं बदरीभिश्च किं न्विदं दारुणं वनम् ।।
data.es: This forest jampacked with dhava, ashvakarna, kakubha, bilva, tinduka, patala and badari trees, how frightening this forest could be"

data.v: तमुवाच महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । श्रूयतां वत्स काकुत्स्थ यस्यैतद्दारुणं वनम् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra, the great sage radiating energy addressing Rama said, "O child of kakusthsa dynasty I shall tell you whose dreadful forest this is. Listen"

data.v: एतौ जनपदौ स्फीतौ पूर्वमास्तां नरोत्तम । मलदाश्च करूषाश्च देवनिर्माणनिर्मितौ ।।
data.es: O best among men, formerly these two large and prosperous cities called Malada and Karusha built by celestial architects existed.

data.v: पुरा वृत्रवधे राम मलेन समभिप्लुतम् । क्षुधा चैव सहस्राक्षं ब्रह्महत्या यदाविशत् ।।
data.es: O Rama, in ancient times after killing Vritrasura, Indra was overpowered by the sin of slaying a brahmin and was affected by impurity and hunger.

data.v: तमिन्द्रं स्नापयन्देवा ऋषयश्च तपोधनाः । कलशैः स्नापयामासुर्मलं चास्य प्रमोचयन् ।।
data.es: Devas and rishis endowed with the wealth of asceticism bathed Indra with the (consecrated) waters (brought from all rivers) from the pitchers and got him cleansed of impurities.

data.v: इह भूम्यां मलं दत्त्वा दत्त्वा कारूषमेव च । शरीरजं महेन्द्रस्य ततो हर्षं प्रपेदिरे ।।
