data.es: With the hunger and the taint and impurity from the body of Mahendra removed at this place, the devas rejoiced.

data.v: निर्मलो निष्करूषश्च शुचिरिन्द्रो यदाभवत् । ददौ देशस्य सुप्रीतो वरं प्रभुरनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Cleansed of his impurities and his hunger gone, Indra once again became pure. Allpowerful Indra highly pleased gave an excellent boon to that region.

data.v: इमौ जनपदौ स्थीतौ ख्यातिं लोके गमिष्यतः । मलदाश्च करूषाश्च ममाङ्गमलधारिणौ ।।
data.es: O best among men, formerly these two large and prosperous cities called Malada and Karusha built by celestial architects existed.

data.v: साधु साध्विति तं देवाः पाकशासनमब्रुवन् । देशस्य पूजां तां दृष्ट्वा कृतां शक्रेण धीमता ।।
data.es: Having seen the honour bestowed on that land by the wise Indra, the gods said to him, 'Well done, Well done'.

data.v: एतौ जनपदौ स्थीतौ दीर्घकालमरिंदम । मलदाश्च करूषाश्च मुदितौ धनधान्यतः ।।
data.es: O best among men, formerly these two large and prosperous cities called Malada and Karusha built by celestial architects existed.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य यक्षी वै कामरूपिणी । बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयन्ती तदा ह्यभूत् ।।
data.es: Then, after a lapse of several years, O gentle one a terrible yakshini by name Tataka, wife of intelligent Sunda, capable of assuming different forms at will, possessed of the strength of a thousand elephants and mother of a rakshasa known as Maricha armed with the power of Indra took possession of this place.

data.v: ताटका नाम भद्रं ते भार्या सुन्दस्य धीमतः । मारीचो राक्षसः पुत्रो यस्याः शक्रपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Then, after a lapse of several years, O gentle one a terrible yakshini by name Tataka, wife of intelligent Sunda, capable of assuming different forms at will, possessed of the strength of a thousand elephants and mother of a rakshasa known as Maricha armed with the power of Indra took possession of this place.

data.v: इमौ जनपदौ नित्यं विनाशयति राघव । मलदांश्च करूषांश्च ताटका दुष्टचारिणी ।।
data.es: Indra blessed the place saying, 'Having absorbed impurities of my body, let these places be extremely fertile and prosperous and let this be renowned throughout this world as Malada and Karusha'.

data.v: सेयं पन्थानमावार्य वसत्यत्यर्धयोजने । अत एव च गन्तव्यं ताटकाया वनं यतः ।।
data.es: Tataka lives at a distance of one and a half yojanas from here obstructing the path. Since Tataka dwells in this forest, no one comes here (because of fears).

data.v: स्वबाहुबलमाश्रित्य जहीमां दुष्टचारिणीम् । मन्नियोगादिमं देशं कुरु निष्कण्टकं पुनः ।।
data.es: "By the strength of your arms slay this one of wicked deeds. Comply with my orders and make this country safe (and habitable).

data.v: न हि कश्चिदिमं देशं शक्रोत्यागन्तुमीदृशम् । यक्षिण्या घोरया राम उत्सादितमसह्यया ।।
data.es: O Rama none dare approach this country ravaged by such dreadful, intolerable yakshini.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथैतद्दरुणं वनम् । यक्ष्या चोत्सादितं सर्वमद्यापि न निवर्तते ।।
data.es: You have been told the manner in which this fierce forest is entirely ruined by that cruel yakshini. Tell now she has not left this place".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुर्विंशतिस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अथ तस्याप्रमेयस्य मुनेर्वचनमुत्तमम् । श्रुत्वा पुरुषशार्दूलः प्रत्युवाच शुभां गिरम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the excellent words of Viswamitra, a sage with unimaginable faculty. Rama, the tiger among men (Rama) replied in a, gentle voice:

data.v: अल्पवीर्या यदा यक्षाः श्रूयन्ते मुनिपुंगव । कथं नागसहस्रस्य धारयत्यबला बलम् ।।
data.es: "O best of ascetics, I have heard the yakshas possess little prowess. How can a woman who is by gender weak possess the strength of a thousand elephants?

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीद्वाक्यं शृणु येन बलोत्तरा । वरदानकृतं वीर्यं धारयत्यबला बलम् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra said, "Listen, how she acquired the prowess and strength by virtue of a boon she received.

data.v: पूर्वमासीन्महायक्षः सुकेतुर्नाम वीर्यवान् । अनपत्यः शुभाचारः स च तेपे महत्तपः ।।
data.es: "In the past there was a powerful and great yaksha by name Suketu. He had no children. So he performed an intense penance following virtuous practices.

data.v: पितामहस्तु सुप्रीतस्तस्य यक्षपतेस्तदा । कन्यारत्नं ददौ राम ताटकां नाम नामतः ।।
data.es: Rama the grandsire Brahma was highly gratified and granted to the king of yakshas, the gem of a daughter by name known asTataka.

data.v: ददौ नागसहस्रस्य बलं चास्याः पितामहः । न त्वेव पुत्रं यक्षाय ददौ ब्रह्मा महायशाः ।।
data.es: The illustrious grandsire Brahma granted her the strength of a thousand elephants, but did not bestow a son on the yaksha.

data.v: तां तु जातां विवर्धन्तीं रूपयौवनशालिनीम् । जम्भपुत्राय सुन्दाय ददौ भार्यां यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: As she grew up, glowing with youth and beauty she was given in marriage to Sunda, son of Jharjha.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालल्स्य यक्षी पुत्रं व्यजायत । मारीचं नाम दुर्धर्षं यः शापाद्राक्षसोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: After some time that yakshini gave birth to an unassailable son by name Maricha. Because of a curse, he became a rakshasa (though born of yaksha parentage).

data.v: सुन्दे तु निहते राम अगस्त्यमृषिसत्तमम् । ताटका सह पुत्रेण प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: O Rama when Sunda died Tataka along with her son wanted to attack Agastya, the best of sages.

data.v: राक्षसत्वं भजस्वेति मारीचं व्याजहार सः । अगस्त्यः परमक्रुद्धस्ताटकामपि शप्तवान् ।।
पुरुषादी महायक्षी विरूपा विकृतानना । इदं रूपमपहाय दारुणं रूपमस्तु ते ।।
data.es: Mighty angry, Agastya cursed Tataka saying, 'Abandon this form of a great yakshini and assume the terrible figure of a rakshasi, a cannibal with distorted appearance and a hideous countenance'.

data.v: सैषा शापकृतामर्षा ताटका क्रोधमूर्छिता । देशमुत्सादयत्येनमगस्त्यचरितं शुभम् ।।
data.es: Enraged at the curse, senseless, Tataka with anger, has been ravaging this sacred land when Agastya walked.

data.v: एनां राघव दुर्वृत्तां यक्षीं परमदारुणाम् । गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय जहि दुष्टपराक्रमाम् ।।
data.es: O Rama for the welfare of cows and brahmins, slay this yakshini who is wicked, extremely cruel and possessing vile prowess.

data.v: न ह्येनां शापसंसृष्टां कश्चिदुत्सहते पुमान् । निहन्तुं त्रिषु लोकेषु त्वामृते रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty she is maligned by the curse, and so not a single man in the three worlds except you, is competent to slay this yakshini.

data.v: न हि ते स्त्रीवधकृते घृणा कार्या नरोत्तम । चातुर्वर्ण्यहितार्थाय कर्तव्यं राजसूनुना ।।
data.es: O best among men you need not hate killing a woman. You are a prince. You should serve the interest of the four orders of the society.

data.v: राज्यभारनियुक्तानामेष धर्मः सनातनः । अधर्म्यां जहि काकुत्स्थ धर्मो ह्यस्या न विद्यते ।।
data.es: This is the eternal law binding those who are appointed to bear the burden of a kingdom. O Kakutstha kill her. She knows no dharma.

data.v: श्रूयते हि पुरा शक्रो विरोचनसुतां नृप । पृथिवीं हन्तुमिच्छन्तीं मन्थरामभ्यसूदयत् ।।
data.es: O Prince It is heard that in the past Indra slew Manthara, Virochana's daughter who intended to destroy the earth.

data.v: विष्णुना च पुरा राम भृगुपत्नी दृढव्रता । अनिन्द्रं लोकमिच्छन्ती काव्यमाता निषूदिता ।।
data.es: O Rama in olden times, the mother of Kavya and the wife of sage Bhrigu, determined to make this world devoid of Indra was destroyed by Visnu.

data.v: एतैश्चान्यैश्च बहुभी राजपुत्रमहात्मभिः । अधर्मनिरता नार्यो हताः पुरुषसत्तमैः ।।
data.es: O Prince by these magnanimous persons and by great men several unrighteous women were killed for the common good".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: मुनेर्वचनमक्लीबं श्रुत्वा नरवरात्मजः । राघवः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा प्रत्युवाच दृढव्रतः ।।
data.es: After listening to the manly command of ascetic Viswamitra, Rama, of the lineage of Raghu, the son of the foremost of men and firm in determination, replied with folded palms:

data.v: पितुर्वचननिर्देशात्पितुर्वचनगौरवात् । वचनं कौशिकस्येति कर्तव्यमविशङ्कया ।।
अनुशिष्टोऽस्म्ययोध्यायां गुरुमध्ये महात्मना । पित्रा दशरथेनाहं नावज्ञेयं च तद्वचः ।।
data.es: In Ayodhya in the presence of elders and spiritual masters (of Dasaratha's court), I have been ordered by my magnanimous father to act according to your instructions and his words cannot be disobeyed.

data.v: सोऽहं पितुर्वचः श्रुत्वा शासनाद्ब्रह्म वादिनः । करिष्यामि न संदेहस्ताटकावधमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: As per the words of my father and the command of Viswamitra, who has the knowledge of the Brahman, I shall execute the welcome act of killing Tataka.

data.v: गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय देशस्यास्य सुखाय च । तव चैवाप्रमेयस्य वचनं कर्तुमुद्यतः ।।
data.es: For the welfare of cows and brahmins and also for the good of this country, I am ready to perform such acts as commanded by you of boundless energy".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा धनुर्मध्ये बद्ध्वा मुष्टिमरिंदमः । ज्याशब्दमकरोत्तीव्रं दिशः शब्देन पूरयन् ।।
data.es: Rama, the destroyer of enemies having said so clinched the middle of the bow with his fist and filled the ten quarters with the resounding twanging of the bowstring.

data.v: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्तास्ताटका वनवासिनः । ताटका च सुसंक्रुद्धा तेन शब्देन मोहिता ।।
data.es: The dwellers of the Tataka forest were terrified by the sound (of the bow). Tataka, was might angry and amazed.

data.v: तं शब्दमभिनिध्याय राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता । श्रुत्वा चाभ्यद्रवद्वेगाद्यतः शब्दो विनिःसृतः ।।
data.es: Hearing that sound, the demoness thought for a while and senseless with anger rushed in the direction where the sound had come from.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा राघवः क्रुद्धां विकृतां विकृताननाम् । प्रमाणेनातिवृद्धां च लक्ष्मणं सोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Filled with wrath Rama saw Tataka, disfigured with a distorted face and gigantic in size. Turning to Lakshmana he said :

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण यक्षिण्या भैरवं दारुणं वपुः । भिद्येरन्दर्शनादस्या भीरूणां हृदयानि च ।।
data.es: "O Lakshmana, behold, the sight of the dreadful hideous body of this yakshini will break timid hearts.

data.v: एनां पश्य दुराधर्षां माया बलसमन्विताम् । विनिवृत्तां करोम्यद्य हृतकर्णाग्रनासिकाम् ।।
data.es: See, she is unassailable because of the strength gained through black magic. I shall cut off her ears and the tip of her nose and make her turn away.

data.v: न ह्येनामुत्सहे हन्तुं स्त्रीस्वभावेन रक्षिताम् । वीर्यं चास्या गतिं चापि हनिष्यामीति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: By virtue of being a woman, she is protected. I am not inclined to slay her but take away her prowess and power of motion".

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणे रामे तु ताटका क्रोधमूर्छिता । उद्यम्य बाहू गर्जन्ती राममेवाभ्यधावत ।।
data.es: While Rama was still speaking, Tataka, incensed with fury rushed with her uplifted arms towards him roaring.

data.v: तामापतन्तीं वेगेन विक्रान्तामशनीमिव । शरेणोरसि विव्याध सा पपात ममार च ।।
data.es: Her chest pierced with an arrow, she rushing menacingly towards them like a thunderbolt fell down dead.

data.v: तां हतां भीमसंकाशां दृष्ट्वा सुरपतिस्तदा । साधु साध्विति काकुत्स्थं सुराश्च समपूजयन् ।।
data.es: Having seen the slain yakshini of terrible appearance, Indra and other celestials worshipped Rama, exclaiming "well done, well done ".

data.v: उवाच परमप्रीतः सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः । सुराश्च सर्वे संहृष्टा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Then exceedingly pleased the thousandeyed Indra and all other delighted celestials said to Viswamitra:

data.v: मुने कौशिके भद्रं ते सेन्द्राः सर्वे मरुद्गणाः । तोषिताः कर्मणानेन स्नेहं दर्शय राघवे ।।
data.es: "O ascetic Kausika, may prosperity be to you All devatas have been gratified by this act (of Rama) and have expressed their love for Rama.

data.v: प्रजापतेर्कृशाश्वस्य पुत्रान्सत्यपराक्रमान् । तपोबलभृतान्ब्रह्मन्राघवाय निवेदय ।।
data.es: "O Brahmarshi, you may offer to Rama, the sons of Prajapati Brishasva who are the weapons bestowed with the power that comes from truth and ascetic energy".

data.v: पात्रभूतश्च ते ब्रह्मंस्तवानुगमने धृतः । कर्तव्यं च महत्कर्म सुराणां राजसूनुना ।।
data.es: "O Brahmarshi following you with firmness of mind, Rama is worthy to receive the weapons. He who is a prince has to accomplish many such great tasks for the benefit of the celestials".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा सुराः सर्वे हृष्टा जग्मुर्यथागतम् । विश्वामित्रं पूजयित्वा ततः संध्या प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: Having said these words, the celestials were pleased. They honoured Viswamitra and returned to their abodes from where they had come. And then dusk set in.

data.v: ततो मुनिवरः प्रीतिस्ताटका वधतोषितः । मूर्ध्नि राममुपाघ्राय इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then, the best of ascetics Viswamitra rejoiced over the death of Tataka, kissed the forehead of Rama (fondly) and spoke these words:

data.v: इहाद्य रजनीं राम वसेम शुभदर्शन । श्वः प्रभाते गमिष्यामस्तदाश्रमपदं मम ।।
data.es: O auspiciouslooking Rama, we will stay here tonight at the confluence of both these sacred rivers (Sarayu and Ganga) and cross over Ganga tomorrow.

data.v: अथ तां रजनीमुष्य विश्वामिरो महायशाः । प्रहस्य राघवं वाक्यमुवाच मधुराक्षरम् ।।
data.es: The night over, illustrious Viswamitra called Rama with a sweet smile.

data.v: पतितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः । प्रीत्या परमया युक्तो ददाम्यस्त्राणि सर्वशः ।।
data.es: "O prince of great renown, I am extremely pleased. May you prosper Out of great love and affection for you I shall make over all the weapons.

data.v: देवासुरगणान्वापि सगन्धर्वोरगानपि । यैरमित्रान्प्रसह्याजौ वशीकृत्य जयिष्यसि ।।
data.es: With the help of these celestial weapons, you will vanquish even gods and demons, serpents together with gandharvas if they challenge you to a battle as enemies and take them as captives. I shall confer on you all such weapons. May you prosper

data.v: तानि दिव्यानि भद्रं ते ददाम्यस्त्राणि सर्वशः । दण्डचक्रं महद्दिव्यं तव दास्यामि राघव ।।
धर्मचक्रं ततो वीर कालचक्रं तथैव च । विष्णुचक्रं तथात्युग्रमैन्द्रं चक्रं तथैव च ।।
वज्रमस्त्रं नरश्रेष्ठ शैवं शूलवरं तथा । अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरश्चैव ऐषीकमपि राघव । ददामि ते महाबाहो ब्राह्ममस्त्रमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Mighty armed, heroic Rama I shall grant you the great celestial dandachakra. O best among men I shall grant you dharmachakra, kalachakra, visnuchakra, indraastra, vajraastra and the great, trident of Siva, brahmashirastra, ishika astra and highly superior brahmaastra.

data.v: गदे द्वे चैव काकुत्स्थ मोदकी शिखरी उभे । प्रदीप्ते नरशार्दूल प्रयच्छामि नृपात्मज ।।
data.es: Born in the race of kakutstha and a tiger among men, O Rama I shall also grant two shining maces known as modaki and shikhari.

data.v: धर्मपाशमहं राम कालपाशं तथैव च । वारुणं पाशमस्त्रं च ददान्यहमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Rama, I shall grant dharmapasa, kalapasa, varuna pasa, too unique weapons.

data.v: अशनी द्वे प्रयच्छामि शुष्कार्द्रे रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O descendant of Raghu I shall grant you two thunderbolts named shuska and ardra (dry and wet), painaka astra and narayanaastra.

data.v: ददामि चास्त्रं पैनाकमस्त्रं नारायणं तथा । आग्नेयमस्त्र दयितं शिखरं नाम नामतः ।।
वायव्यं प्रथमं नाम ददामि तव राघव । अस्त्रं हयशिरो नाम क्रौञ्चमस्त्रं तथैव च ।।
शक्ति द्वयं च काकुत्स्थ ददामि तव चानघ । कङ्कालं मुसलं घोरं कापालमथ कङ्कणम् ।।
धारयन्त्यसुरा यानि ददाम्येतानि सर्वशः । वैद्याधरं महास्त्रं च नन्दनं नाम नामतः ।।
असिरत्नं महाबाहो ददामि नृवरात्मज । गान्धर्वमस्त्रं दयितं मानवं नाम नामतः ।।
प्रस्वापनप्रशमने दद्मि सौरं च राघव । दर्पणं शोषणं चैव संतापनविलापने ।।
मदनं चैव दुर्धर्षं कन्दर्पदयितं तथा । पैशाचमस्त्रं दयितं मोहनं नाम नामतः । प्रतीच्छ नरशार्दूल राजपुत्र महायशः ।।
data.es: O renowned prince, best among men, receive these astras known as darpana, soshana, santhapana, vilapana, madana astra, the unassailable one favoured by kamadeva and the paisacha astra known as mohana favoured by demons.

data.v: तामसं नरशार्दूल सौमनं च महाबलम् । संवर्तं चैव दुर्धर्षं मौसलं च नृपात्मज ।।
सत्यमस्त्रं महाबाहो तथा मायाधरं परम् । घोरं तेजःप्रभं नाम परतेजोऽपकर्षणम् ।।
सोमास्त्रं शिशिरं नाम त्वाष्ट्रमस्त्रं सुदामनम् । दारुणं च भगस्यापि शीतेषुमथ मानवम् ।।
एतान्नाम महाबाहो कामरूपान्महाबलान् । गृहाण परमोदारान्क्षिप्रमेव नृपात्मज ।।
data.es: O Rama mightyarmed prince, receive these mighty and highly exalted astras capable of assuming at once any form at will".

data.v: स्थितस्तु प्राङ्मुखो भूत्वा शुचिर्निवरतस्तदा । ददौ रामाय सुप्रीतो मन्त्रग्राममनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra, the greatest ascetic after the purification ritual stood with his face turned east and happily, conferred on Rama collection of the unique mantras.

data.v: जपतस्तु मुनेस्तस्य विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः । उपतस्थुर्महार्हाणि सर्वाण्यस्त्राणि राघवम् ।।
data.es: While the sagacious ascetic Viswamitra was muttering the mystic terms of these venerable astras (addressing their respective deities), all these weapons (with their mystic power) attended on Rama.

data.v: ऊचुश्च मुदिता रामं सर्वे प्राञ्जलयस्तदा । इमे स्म परमोदार किंकरास्तव राघव ।।
data.es: The munificient presiding deities of the weapons with folded palms addressed these words to Rama saying, "Here we are, at you disposal ".

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च काकुत्स्थः समालभ्य च पाणिना । मनसा मे भविष्यध्वमिति तान्यभ्यचोदयत् ।।
data.es: Rama received the astras he felt with his hands and commanded them saying, "Live in my mind" (serve me whenever I remember you).

data.v: ततः प्रीतमना रामो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । अभिवाद्य महातेजा गमनायोपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य ततोऽस्त्राणि प्रहृष्टवदनः शुचिः । गच्छन्नेव च काकुत्स्थो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: After performing the purificatory rites, Rama received the weapons with a cheerful face. In the way Rama said to Viswamitra.

data.v: गृहीतास्त्रोऽस्मि भगवन्दुराधर्षः सुरैरपि । अस्त्राणां त्वहमिच्छामि संहारं मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: "O venerable one, having received these weaponsI have become unassailable even by the celestials. O best of ascetics, May I know the way to withdraw these weapons".

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । संहारं व्याजहाराथ धृतिमान्सुव्रतः शुचिः ।।
data.es: To these words spoken by Rama, maharshi Viswamitra who was patient practitioner of vows and pure taught the withdrawl mantra.

data.v: सत्यवन्तं सत्यकीर्तिं धृष्टं रभसमेव च । प्रतिहारतरं नाम पराङ्मुखमवाङ्मुखम् ।।
लक्षाक्षविषमौ चैव दृढनाभसुनाभकौ । दशाक्षशतवक्त्रौ च दशशीर्षशतोदरौ ।।
पद्मनाभमहानाभौ दुन्दुनाभसुनाभकौ । ज्योतिषं कृशनं चैव नैराश्य विमलावुभौ ।।
यौगन्धरहरिद्रौ च दैत्यप्रमथनौ तथा । पित्र्यं सौमनसं चैव विधूतमकरावुभौ ।।
करवीरकरं चैव धनधान्यौ च राघव । कामरूपं कामरुचिं मोहमावरणं तथा ।।
जृम्भकं सर्वनाभं च सन्तानवरणौ तथा । कृशाश्वतनयान्राम भास्वरान्कामरूपिणः ।।
प्रतीच्छ मम भद्रं ते पात्रभूतोऽसि राघव । दिव्यभास्वरदेहाश्च मूर्तिमन्तः सुखप्रदाः ।।
रामं प्राञ्जलयो भूत्वाब्रुवन्मधुरभाषिणः । इमे स्म नरशार्दूल शाधि किं करवाम ते ।।
गम्यतामिति तानाह यथेष्टं रघुनन्दनः । मानसाः कार्यकालेषु साहाय्यं मे करिष्यथ ।।
अथ ते राममामन्त्र्य कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् । एवमस्त्विति काकुत्स्थमुक्त्वा जग्मुर्यथागतम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter those devatas having said, "Be it so", circumambulated Rama, took leave of him and returned to their respective abodes from where they had come.

data.v: स च तान्राघवो ज्ञात्वा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । गच्छन्नेवाथ मधुरं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: After having acquired the knowledge of the weapons Rama addressed maharshi Viswamitra in gentle and soft words while walking along with him.

data.v: किं न्वेतन्मेघसंकाशं पर्वतस्याविदूरतः । वृक्षषण्डमितो भाति परं कौतूहलं हि मे ।।
data.es: "From this side of the mountain, not faroff from here stand shining and goodlooking trees resembling clouds. It is replete scattered with animals, pleasing to the mind and extremely beautiful. It is adorned with various kinds of birds singing sweetly. What could be this? I am very curious to know.

data.v: दर्शनीयं मृगाकीर्णं मनोहरमतीव च । नानाप्रकारैः शकुनैर्वल्गुभाषैरलंकृतम् ।।
data.es: "From this side of the mountain, not faroff from here stand shining and goodlooking trees resembling clouds. It is replete scattered with animals, pleasing to the mind and extremely beautiful. It is adorned with various kinds of birds singing sweetly. What could be this? I am very curious to know.

data.v: निःसृताः स्म मुनिश्रेष्ठ कान्ताराद्रोमहर्षणात् । अनया त्ववगच्छामि देशस्य सुखवत्तया ।।
data.es: O best of acetics, I think we have come out of that awesome (horripilating) forest because of the pleasant feeling experienced in this region. Whose hermitage is this? O Revered one tell me".

data.v: सर्वं मे शंस भगवन्कस्याश्रमपदं त्विदम् । संप्राप्ता यत्र ते पापा ब्रह्मघ्ना दुष्टचारिणः ।।
अथ तस्याप्रमेयस्य तद्वनं परिपृच्छतः । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा व्याख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: The highly lustrous Viswamitra heard the words of Rama of immeasurable prowess. On his (Rama's) query about the forest, Viswamitra explains.

data.v: एष पूर्वाश्रमो राम वामनस्य महात्मनः । सिद्धाश्रम इति ख्यातः सिद्धो ह्यत्र महातपाः ।।
data.es: "O Rama this was the hermitage of glorious Vamana. The great sage her performed his ascetic pratices here, hence it is known as siddhashrama.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु राजा वैरोचनिर्बलिः । निर्जित्य दैवतगणान्सेन्द्रांश्च समरुद्गणान् । कारयामास तद्राज्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ।।
data.es: "During the period Visnu (in the incarnation of Vamana) was observing austerities at this hermitage, king Bali, son of Virochana, having vanquished Indra and maruts and devatas ruled this kingdom and became famous in all the three worlds (for his prowess and generosity.)

data.v: बलेस्तु यजमानस्य देवाः साग्निपुरोगमाः । समागम्य स्वयं चैव विष्णुमूचुरिहाश्रमे ।।
data.es: "While Bali was performing the sacrifice (to confirm his position as lord of the three worlds), the devas got together with Agni in the forefront and approached Lord Visnu at this hermitage, saying:

data.v: बलिर्वैरोचनिर्विष्णो यजते यज्ञमुत्तमम् । असमाप्ते क्रतौ तस्मिन्स्वकार्यमभिपद्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O Visnu son of Virochana is performing a great sacrifice. Before its completion, our purpose ought to be achieved'.

data.v: ये चैनमभिवर्तन्ते याचितार इतस्ततः । यच्च यत्र यथावच्च सर्वं तेभ्यः प्रयच्छति ।।
data.es: 'He is granting the seekers whatever, wherever and in whichever maner they, coming from here and there approach him for favour'.

data.v: स त्वं सुरहितार्थाय मायायोगमुपाश्रितः । वामनत्वं गतो विष्णो कुरु कल्याणमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: "O Visnu perform this supreme, auspicious act assuming the form of a dwarf through, the power of illusion for the welfare of the devatas'.

data.v: अयं सिद्धाश्रमो नाम प्रसादात्ते भविष्यति । सिद्धे कर्मणि देवेश उत्तिष्ठ भगवन्नितः ।।
data.es: O Lord of the celestials, with my penance accomplished (here) this place will be known as siddhaashrama by your grace. O Lord arise from here".

data.v: अथ विष्णुर्महातेजा अदित्यां समजायत । वामनं रूपमास्थाय वैरोचनिमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Then the resplendent Visnu, born from the womb of Aditi and assuming the form of Vamana, approached, the son of Virochana (Bali).

data.v: त्रीन्क्रमानथ भिक्षित्वा प्रतिगृह्य च मानतः । आक्रम्य लोकाँल्लोकात्मा सर्वभूतहिते रतः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Visnu, soul of the universe who restores respect (for the righeous), and renders the welfare of all living beings, having begged from Bali, and been granted three places to put his footsteps on occupied the (three) worlds and by restraining Bali with his energy, gave (it) back to Mahendra. In this manner the highly lustrous Visnu, gave possession of the three worlds to Mahendra.

data.v: महेन्द्राय पुनः प्रादान्नियम्य बलिमोजसा । त्रैलोक्यं स महातेजाश्चक्रे शक्रवशं पुनः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Visnu, soul of the universe who restores respect (for the righeous), and renders the welfare of all living beings, having begged from Bali, and been granted three places to put his footsteps on occupied the (three) worlds and by restraining Bali with his energy, gave (it) back to Mahendra. In this manner the highly lustrous Visnu, gave possession of the three worlds to Mahendra.

data.v: तेनैष पूर्वमाक्रान्त आश्रमः श्रमनाशनः । मयापि भक्त्या तस्यैष वामनस्योपभुज्यते ।।
data.es: "This asrama, which relieves fatigue, previously under the possession of Vamana, has come under my occoupation for my devotion to him.

data.v: एतमाश्रममायान्ति राक्षसा विघ्नकारिणः । अत्र ते पुरुषव्याघ्र हन्तव्या दुष्टचारिणः ।।
data.es: "O tiger among men, wicked rakshasas who prowl about the asram and cause obstacles ought to be killed here only.

data.v: अद्य गच्छामहे राम सिद्धाश्रममनुत्तमम् । तदाश्रमपदं तात तवाप्येतद्यथा मम ।।
data.es: "O Rama, now let's go to the unparalleled Siddhashrama. O child this asrama is the same to you as it is to me (treat this as your own)".

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा मुनयः सर्वे सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिनः । उत्पत्योत्पत्य सहसा विश्वामित्रमपूजयन् ।।
data.es: At the sight of Viswamitra all the ascetics, inmates of Siddhashrama, jumped out instantly and offered him their worship.

data.v: यथार्हं चक्रिरे पूजां विश्वामित्राय धीमते । तथैव राजपुत्राभ्यामकुर्वन्नतिथिक्रियाम् ।।
data.es: They extended hospitality to both the princes in the same way they offered their worship to the sagacious Viswamitra.

data.v: मुहूर्तमथ विश्रान्तौ राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । प्राञ्जली मुनिशार्दूलमूचतू रघुनन्दनौ ।।
data.es: The two princes of the lineage of Raghu, destroyers of foes rested a while and then said to Viswamitra, a tiger amon sages:

data.v: अद्यैव दीक्षां प्रविश भद्रं ते मुनिपुंगव । सिद्धाश्रमोऽयं सिद्धः स्यात्सत्यमस्तु वचस्तव ।।
data.es: O foremost of ascetics Get initialed today. You will prosper and this asram will attain its fulfilment. Your words shall come true.

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । प्रविवेश तदा दीक्षां नियतो नियतेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Saying this, Viswamitra, the great saint effulgent and self trained engaged himself in the initiation ceremony.

data.v: कुमारावपि तां रात्रिमुषित्वा सुसमाहितौ । प्रभातकाले चोत्थाय विश्वामित्रमवन्दताम् ।।
data.es: The two princes spent the right comfortably and woke up at daybreak. They performed morning in accordance with the prescribed rule, ablutions, said their prayers and paid their respects to Viswamitra seated at the kindled firesacrifice.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अथ तौ देशकालज्ञौ राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । देशे काले च वाक्यज्ञावब्रूतां कौशिकं वचः ।।
data.es: Thus spoke the two princes to Viswamitra. They were conscious of place and time to speak and capable of conquering enemies.

data.v: भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छावो यस्मिन्काले निशाचरौ । संरक्षणीयौ तौ ब्रह्मन्नातिवर्तेत तत्क्षणम् ।।
data.es: "O adorable Brahmarshi, we want to know around what time the rakshasas will make their appearance so that the sacrifice can be protected. Let not that moment pass".

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणौ काकुत्स्थौ त्वरमाणौ युयुत्सया । सर्वे ते मुनयः प्रीताः प्रशशंसुर्नृपात्मजौ ।।
data.es: The sages (of the asrama) were very pleased. They extolled the princes of Kakustha dynasty, who were eager to fight the rakshasas.

data.v: अद्य प्रभृति षड्रात्रं रक्षतं राघवौ युवाम् । दीक्षां गतो ह्येष मुनिर्मौनित्वं च गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "O sons of Raghu's lineage protect the sacrifice for six nights from today. With the ceremoney initiated, the sage would observe silence said the inmates".

data.v: तौ तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजपुत्रौ यशस्विनौ । अनिद्रौ षडहोरात्रं तपोवनमरक्षताम् ।।
data.es: At these words of the sages the illustrious princes got ready to protect the tapovana for six days and six nights without sleep.

data.v: उपासां चक्रतुर्वीरौ यत्तौ परमधन्विनौ । ररक्षतुर्मुनिवरं विश्वामित्रमरिंदमौ ।।
data.es: The two mighty, heroic archers (Rama and Lakshmana), destroyers of enemies attended upon the sacrifice in order to protect sage Viswamitra.

data.v: अथ काले गते तस्मिन्षष्ठेऽहनि समागते । सौमित्रमब्रवीद्रामो यत्तो भव समाहितः ।।
data.es: Time passed. When the sixth day arrived Rama cautioned Lakshmana to be vigilant.

data.v: रामस्यैवं ब्रुवाणस्य त्वरितस्य युयुत्सया । प्रजज्वाल ततो वेदिः सोपाध्यायपुरोहिता ।।
data.es: While he was fracing up for a fight, the fire on the sacrificial altar with the officiating priests and spiritual guides suddenly brightened.

data.v: मन्त्रवच्च यथान्यायं यज्ञोऽसौ संप्रवर्तते । आकाशे च महाञ्शब्दः प्रादुरासीद्भयानकः ।।
data.es: While the sacrifice was being performed in accordance with mantras, a great sound causing fear emerged from the sky.

data.v: आवार्य गगनं मेघो यथा प्रावृषि निर्गतः । तथा मायां विकुर्वाणौ राक्षसावभ्यधावताम् ।।
data.es: Like the clouds in the rainy season, the two rakshasas (Maricha and Subahu), covering the sky through their power of illusion, came running (to the sacrificial place).

data.v: मारीचश्च सुबाहुश्च तयोरनुचरास्तथा । आगम्य भीमसंकाशा रुधिरौघानवासृजन् ।।
data.es: Maricha and Subahu of fearful appearance arrived with their followers and rained streams of blood (on the sacrificial altar).

data.v: तावापतन्तौ सहसा दृष्ट्वा राजीवलोचनः । लक्ष्मणं त्वभिसंप्रेक्ष्य रामो वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having seen them (Maricha and Subahu) suddenly advancing the lotuseyed Rama gazed at Lakshmana and said:

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण दुर्वृत्तान्राक्षसान्पिशिताशनान् । मानवास्त्रसमाधूताननिलेन यथाघनान् ।।
data.es: "O Lakshmana, behold, by manavaastra I shall chase, like clouds scattered by winds those wicked rakshasas who eat human flesh".

data.v: मानवं परमोदारमस्त्रं परमभास्वरम् । चिक्षेप परमक्रुद्धो मारीचोरसि राघवः ।।
data.es: The inflamed Rama hurled the highly powerful and effulgent Manavaastra on the chest of Maricha.

data.v: स तेन परमास्त्रेण मानवेन समाहितः । संपूर्णं योजनशतं क्षिप्तः सागरसंप्लवे ।।
data.es: Smitten by that powerful Manavaastra, Maricha was thrown to a full distance of hundred yojanas into the surging high seas.

data.v: विचेतनं विघूर्णन्तं शीतेषुबलपीडितम् । निरस्तं दृश्य मारीचं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having seen Maricha beaten by the power of that coolarrowed astra, thrown to a distance, reeling and lying unconscious, Rama spoke to Lakshmana:

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण शीतेषुं मानवं धर्मसंहितम् । मोहयित्वा नयत्येनं न च प्राणैर्वियुज्यते ।।
data.es: "O Lakshmana behold this Manavaastra associated with righteousness employing a cool arrow, which carries him away by making him unconscious and yet not taking his life.

data.v: इमानपि वधिष्यामि निर्घृणान्दुष्टचारिणः । राक्षसान्पापकर्मस्थान्यज्ञघ्नान्रुधिराशनान् ।।
data.es: "I shall slay these merciless, wicked doors of sinful acts destroyers of sacrifices and blood rakshasas".

data.v: विगृह्य सुमहच्चास्त्रमाग्नेयं रघुनन्दनः । सुबाहुरसि चिक्षेप स विद्धः प्रापतद्भुवि ।।
data.es: Then Rama took hold of the celestial, marvellous Agneya weapon and hurled it into the chest of Subahu. Struck, Subahuhe fell down on the ground.

data.v: शेषान्वायव्यमादाय निजघान महायशाः । राघवः परमोदारो मुनीनां मुदमावहन् ।।
data.es: Illustrious and highly generous Rama killed the remaining rakshasas with the Vayavya weapon to the delight of the ascetics.

data.v: स हत्वा राक्षसान्सर्वान्यज्ञघ्नान्रघुनन्दनः । ऋषिभिः पूजितस्तत्र यथेन्द्रो विजये पुरा ।।
data.es: Having killed the rakshasas, obstructors of sacrifices, Rama was worshipped by the hermits like Indra was honoured in the past when he was victorious.

data.v: अथ यज्ञे समाप्ते तु विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । निरीतिका दिशो दृष्ट्वा काकुत्स्थमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, when the sacrifice was completed, maharshi Viswamitra beholding all the directions bereft of evils, said to Rama:

data.v: कृतार्थोऽस्मि महाबाहो कृतं गुरुवचस्त्वया । सिद्धाश्रममिदं सत्यं कृतं राम महायशः ।।
अथ तां रजनीं तत्र कृतार्थौ रामलक्षणौ । ऊषतुर्मुदितौ वीरौ प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: There, with their purpose fulfilled the heroes, Rama and Lakshmana, full of joy in their hearts spent the night.

data.v: प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां कृतपौर्वाह्णिकक्रियौ । विश्वामित्रमृषींश्चान्यान्सहितावभिजग्मतुः ।।
data.es: As the night dawned, both the brothers performed the morning rites and approached Viswamitra and other rishis.

data.v: अभिवाद्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम् । ऊचतुर्मधुरोदारं वाक्यं मधुरभाषिणौ ।।
data.es: Sweettongued, they visited with folded hands the best of ascetics Viswamitra who was shining like a flaming fire and addressed him thus in sweet and generous words:

data.v: इमौ स्वो मुनिशार्दूल किंकरौ समुपस्थितौ । आज्ञापय यथेष्टं वै शासनं करवाव किम् ।।
data.es: "O tiger among ascetics, we two are at your service. Command whatever you want and we shall execute" it.

data.v: एवमुक्ते ततस्ताभ्यां सर्व एव महर्षयः । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य रामं वचनमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Having said these words, the celestials were pleased. They honoured Viswamitra and returned to their abodes from where they had come. And then dusk set in.

data.v: मैथिलस्य नरश्रेष्ठ जनकस्य भविष्यति । यज्ञः परमधर्मिष्ठस्तत्र यास्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: "O foremost of men, Janaka, king of Mithila, is performing a great religious sacrifice. We shall go there.

data.v: त्वं चैव नरशार्दूल सहास्माभिर्गमिष्यसि । अद्भुतं च धनूरत्नं तत्र त्वं द्रष्टुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O tiger among men, come along with us. You ought to see there the wonderful jewel of a bow.

data.v: तद्धि पूर्वं नरश्रेष्ठ दत्तं सदसि दैवतैः । अप्रमेयबलं घोरं मखे परमभास्वरम् ।।
data.es: O best among men, this bow of immeasurable energy. dreadful and highly lustrous was bestowed on king Janaka by devatas in a sacrificial assembly in the past.

data.v: नास्य देवा न गन्धर्वा नासुरा न च राक्षसाः । कर्तुमारोपणं शक्ता न कथंचन मानुषाः ।।
data.es: Neither devas, nor gandharvas, nor asuras nor human, are capable of stringing the bow by any means.

data.v: धनुषस्तस्य वीर्यं हि जिज्ञासन्तो महीक्षितः । न शेकुरारोपयितुं राजपुत्रा महाबलाः ।।
data.es: Mighty princes and kings have failed to string it, in their attempt to know its strength.

data.v: तद्धनुर्नरशार्दूल मैथिलस्य महात्मनः । तत्र द्रक्ष्यसि काकुत्स्थ यज्ञं चाद्भुतदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: O best of men, O descendent of Kakustha, there you will see the bow that belongs to the magnanimous king of Mithila and the wonderful sacrifice at that place.

data.v: तद्धि यज्ञफलं तेन मैथिलेनोत्तमं धनुः । याचितं नरशार्दूल सुनाभं सर्वदैवतैः ।।
data.es: O best among men, that excellent bow strong in the middle was offered by king of Mithila, Devarata as well as by all devatas as fruit of the sacrifice.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिवरः प्रस्थानमकरोत्तदा । सर्षिसंघः सकाकुत्स्थ आमन्त्र्य वनदेवताः ।।
data.es: Having spoken thus, Viswamitra, the best of ascetics commenced the onward journey along with the Kakutshas and rishis, taking leave of the deities of the forest.

data.v: स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि सिद्धः सिद्धाश्रमादहम् । उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे हिमवन्तं शिलोच्चयम् ।।
data.es: "(O ascetics of the forest) May you be safe. My purpose has been achieved in this Siddhaashrama. From here I shall go to the Himavanta mountain situated on the northern bank of Jahnavi" (said Viswamitra).

data.v: प्रदक्षिणं ततः कृत्वा सिद्धाश्रममनुत्तमम् । उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य प्रस्थातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Thereafter, circumambulating the supreme Siddhasrama with reverence, they (Viswamitra and the princes) commenced their journey in the northern direction.

data.v: तं व्रजन्तं मुनिवरमन्वगादनुसारिणाम् । शकटी शतमात्रं तु प्रयाणे ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ।।
data.es: As Viswamitra, the best of ascetics set out on his journey, expounders of the Vedas followed him, nearly in one hundred carriages.

data.v: मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिनः । अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् ।।
data.es: Birds and beasts living in Siddhaashrama also followed the illustrious maharshi Viswamitra over a long distance until he sent them back.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे । वासं चक्रुर्मुनिगणाः शोणाकूले समाहिताः ।।
data.es: The sages travelled a long distance and halted on the bank of Sona at sunset.

data.v: तेऽस्तं गते दिनकरे स्नात्वा हुतहुताशनाः । विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य निषेदुरमितौजसः ।।
data.es: The sages who possessed great splendour bathed and offered oblations to fire at sunset and sat in front of Viswamitra.

data.v: रामोऽपि सहसौमित्रिर्मुनींस्तानभिपूज्य च । अग्रतो निषसादाथ विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: Rama together with Lakshmana having offered respectful salutations to the sages, sat in front of the sagacious Viswamitra.

data.v: अथ रामो महातेजा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । पप्रच्छ मुनिशार्दूलं कौतूहलसमन्वितः ।।
data.es: Thereafter highly lustrous Rama, the best among men, filled with curiosity enquired of the great sage Viswamitra:

data.v: भगवन्को न्वयं देशः समृद्धवनशोभितः । श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते वक्तुमर्हसि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: "O worshipful one, what could be the reason for this region shining with luxuriant groves? I wish to hear from you. You can tell me all about this (region). May it be safe for you"

data.v: चोदितो रामवाक्येन कथयामास सुव्रतः । तस्य देशस्य निखिलमृषिमध्ये महातपाः ।।
data.es: A sage of excellent vows and rigid austerities, Viswamitra, urged by the words of Rama, described in the midst of rishis the entire story relating to that region.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ब्रह्मयोनिर्महानासीत्कुशो नाम महातपाः । वैदर्भ्यां जनयामास चतुरः सदृशान्सुतान् । कुशाम्बं कुशनाभं च आधूर्तरजसं वसुम् ।।
data.es: That great soul, Kusa, married the princess of Vidarbha born in a noble family and a match for him. He begot four virtuous sons who resembled him. They were Kusamba, Kusanabha, Adhurtarajas and Vasu.

data.v: दीप्तियुक्तान्महोत्साहान्क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया । तानुवाच कुशः पुत्रान्धर्मिष्ठान्सत्यवादिनः । क्रियतां पालनं पुत्रा धर्मं प्राप्स्यथ पुष्कलम् ।।
data.es: Kusa addressed his four brilliant sons who were highly enthusiastic, pious, truthful and were wedded to duties of the warrior race:

data.v: कुशस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा चत्वारो लोकसंमताः । निवेशं चक्रिरे सर्वे पुराणां नृवरास्तदा ।।
data.es: "O my sons, govern with righteousness so that you will acquire immense merit'. Hearing the words of the rishi, the four sons who were the best among men and revered in the world constructed four cities as their abodes.

data.v: कुशाम्बस्तु महातेजाः कौशाम्बीमकरोत्पुरीम् । कुशनाभस्तु धर्मात्मा परं चक्रे महोदयम् ।।
data.es: The brilliant Kushamba and the righteous Kushanabha constructed the cities of Kaushanbi and Mahodaya (as their capital) respectively.

data.v: आधूर्तरजसो राम धर्मारण्यं महीपतिः । चक्रे पुरवरं राजा वसुश्चक्रे गिरिव्रजम् ।।
data.es: O Rama king Adhurtarajasa constructed Dharmaranya, the best of cities and king Vasu, the city of Girivrajam.

data.v: एषा वसुमती राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मनः । एते शैलवराः पञ्च प्रकाशन्ते समन्ततः ।।
data.es: O Rama this place where we are (called Vasumati) belongs to the magnanimous king Vasu. This is surrounded by five great shining mountains.

data.v: सुमागधी नदी रम्या मागधान्विश्रुताययौ । पञ्चानां शैलमुख्यानां मध्ये मालेव शोभते ।।
data.es: The delightful and renowned river Sumagadhi (known as Sona), flowing in the country of Magadha, looks beautiful like a garland amidst five great mountains.

data.v: सैषा हि मागधी राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मनः । पूर्वाभिचरिता राम सुक्षेत्रा सस्यमालिनी ।।
data.es: Rama, this Magadhi river, of great Vasu flows from the east surrounded by fertile crops fields like a garland.

data.v: कुशनाभस्तु राजर्षिः कन्याशतमनुत्तमम् । जनयामास धर्मात्मा घृताच्यां रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O scion of the Raghu family, the virtuous rajarshi Kusanabha begot one hundred beautiful daughters through a nymph named Ghritachi.

data.v: तास्तु यौवनशालिन्यो रूपवत्यः स्वलंकृताः । उद्यानभूमिमागम्य प्रावृषीव शतह्रदाः ।।
data.es: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.

data.v: गायन्त्यो नृत्यमानाश्च वादयन्त्यश्च राघव । आमोदं परमं जग्मुर्वराभरणभूषिताः ।।
data.es: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.

data.v: अथ ताश्चारुसर्वाङ्ग्यो रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । उद्यानभूमिमागम्य तारा इव घनान्तरे ।।
data.es: With beautiful limbs of unparalleled beauty on earth, they shone in the pleasuregarden like stars in the midst of clouds.

data.v: ताः सर्वगुणसंपन्ना रूपयौवनसंयुताः । दृष्ट्वा सर्वात्मको वायुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: At the sight of the maidens embellished with all virtues and youth and beauty, the allpervading Windgod addressed them these words:

data.v: अहं वः कामये सर्वा भार्या मम भविष्यथ । मानुषस्त्यज्यतां भावो दीर्घमायुरवाप्स्यथ ।।
data.es: I request you all to be my wives. You will leave this feeling of mortality and attain a long life.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायोरक्लिष्टकर्मणः । अपहास्य ततो वाक्यं कन्याशतमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: At the works of the untiringly blowing Windgod the lunged maidens laughed and said:

data.v: अन्तश्चरसि भूतानां सर्वेषां त्वं सुरोत्तम । प्रभावज्ञाश्च ते सर्वाः किमस्मानवमन्यसे ।।
data.es: "O best among devatas you move within all living beings, we feel your impact. Why do you insult us?

data.v: कुशनाभसुताः सर्वाः समर्थास्त्वां सुरोत्तम । स्थानाच्च्यावयितुं देवं रक्षामस्तु तपो वयम् ।।
data.es: "O best among devatas we are daughters of Kusanabha, We are capable of pulling you down from your position. We are safeguarding our ascetic merit as virgins (we could curse you to save our ascetic merit)" of Kusnabha.

data.v: मा भूत्स कालो दुर्मेधः पितरं सत्यवादिनम् । नावमन्यस्व धर्मेण स्वयं वरमुपास्महे ।।
data.es: O wicked one, do not dishonour our father who always speaks the truth. He will choose the bridegrooms righteously. Do not invite death (father may be the cause of your death).

data.v: पिता हि प्रभुरस्माकं दैवतं परमं हि सः । यस्य नो दास्यति पिता स नो भर्ता भविष्यति ।।
data.es: Our father is our lord. Our father is god to us. Whomsoever our father offers us shall become our husband".

data.v: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायुः परमकोपनः । प्रविश्य सर्वगात्राणि बभञ्ज भगवान्प्रभुः ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of those maidens, the most powerful and venerable Windgod became furious. He entered all the limbs of their bodies, twisted and distorted them.

data.v: ताः कन्या वायुना भग्ना विविशुर्नृपतेर्गृहम् । दृष्ट्वा भग्नास्तदा राजा संभ्रान्त इदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Their bodies disfigured and shattered by the Windgod, the maidens with tears flowing from their eyes entered the palace and fell down on the ground, agitated and overtaken by shame.

data.v: किमिदं कथ्यतां पुत्र्यः को धर्ममवमन्यते । कुब्जाः केन कृताः सर्वा वेष्टन्त्यो नाभिभाषथ ।।
data.es: "O daughters What has happened? Who has dishonoured virtue? Say it at once. Who has made you hunchbacked? Standing roud me, why are you dumb?" The king heaved a sigh and entered into a state of samadhi. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कुशनाभस्य धीमतः । शिरोभिश्चरणौ स्पृष्ट्वा कन्याशतमभाषत ।।
data.es: At the works of the untiringly blowing Windgod the lunged maidens laughed and said:

data.v: वायुः सर्वात्मको राजन्प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति । अशुभं मार्गमास्थाय न धर्मं प्रत्यवेक्षते ।।
data.es: "O king, the allpervading Windgod, having taken recourse to foul means intended to outrage our modesty without and moral compunction.

data.v: पितृमत्यः स्म भद्रं ते स्वच्छन्दे न वयं स्थिताः । पितरं नो वृणीष्व त्वं यदि नो दास्यते तव ।।
data.es: We have our father who is dear to us. Hence we do not have freedom to choose. You may ask our father if he is willing to give us (in marriage).

data.v: तेन पापानुबन्धेन वचनं न प्रतीच्छता । एवं ब्रुवन्त्यः सर्वाः स्म वायुना निहता भृषम् ।।
data.es: As all of us were speaking thus, the sinful Windgod, disregarding our words repeatedly assaulted us.

data.v: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा परमधार्मिकः । प्रत्युवाच महातेजाः कन्याशतमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:

data.v: क्षान्तं क्षमावतां पुत्र्यः कर्तव्यं सुमहत्कृतम् । ऐकमत्यमुपागम्य कुलं चावेक्षितं मम ।।
data.es: "O daughters you have done a great act of forgiveness of which only the tolerant are capable. By taking a united stand, you have protected the honour of my dynasty.

data.v: अलंकारो हि नारीणां क्षमा तु पुरुषस्य वा । दुष्करं तच्च वः क्षान्तं त्रिदशेषु विशेषतः ।।
data.es: Whether for women or men forgiveness is an ornament. It is difficult even for gods. For you, daughters, to show it without any difference of opinion is especially hard.

data.v: यादृशीर्वः क्षमा पुत्र्यः सर्वासामविशेषतः । क्षमा दानं क्षमा यज्ञः क्षमा सत्यं च पुत्रिकाः ।।
क्षमा यशः क्षमा धर्मः क्षमायां विष्ठितं जगत् । विसृज्य कन्याः काकुत्स्थ राजा त्रिदशविक्रमः ।।
मन्त्रज्ञो मन्त्रयामास प्रदानं सह मन्त्रिभिः । देशे काले प्रदानस्य सदृशे प्रतिपादनम् ।।
data.es: "O Rama after sending away his daughters, the king endowed with the power of the celestials and wellversed in the art of counselling, consulted his ministers about a suitable person for marriage of his daughters at proper time and place.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु चूली नाम महामुनिः । ऊर्ध्वरेताः शुभाचारो ब्राह्मं तप उपागमत् ।।
data.es: At that time a great and virtuous ascetic named Chuli living in celebacy was performing austerities in pursuit of the knowledge of Brahman.

data.v: तप्यन्तं तमृषिं तत्र गन्धर्वी पर्युपासते । सोमदा नाम भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला तनया तदा ।।
data.es: When he was performing austerities, a nymph named Somada, daughter of Urmila, used to serve him. Prosperity to you

data.v: सा च तं प्रणता भूत्वा शुश्रूषणपरायणा । उवास काले धर्मिष्ठा तस्यास्तुष्टोऽभवद्गुरुः ।।
data.es: Somada rendered her services with devotion and humility. There she lived a religious life. In the might time her spiritual guide was satisfied with her services.

data.v: स च तां कालयोगेन प्रोवाच रघुनन्दन । परितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते किं करोमि तव प्रियम् ।।
data.es: When her services came to a fruition with the passage of time, maharshi Chuli, spoke to her: 'I am pleased with you. What favour shall I do for you? May you be prosperous'

data.v: परितुष्टं मुनिं ज्ञात्वा गन्धर्वी मधुरस्वरम् । उवाच परमप्रीता वाक्यज्ञा वाक्यकोविदम् ।।
data.es: Having perceived that the sage was satisfied, the gandharva who was skilled in speech said exceedingly delighted to the sage in a sweet voice.

data.v: लक्ष्म्या समुदितो ब्राह्म्या ब्रह्मभूतो महातपाः । ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तं पुत्रमिच्छामि धार्मिकम् ।।
data.es: Bestowed with the great asceticism and brilliance of a brahmin, you look like Brahma. O righteous one, I desire a son endowed with the ascetic virtues of a brahmin.

data.v: अपतिश्चास्मि भद्रं ते भार्या चास्मि न कस्यचित् । ब्राह्मेणोपगतायाश्च दातुमर्हसि मे सुतम् ।।
data.es: I am without a husband, my sire. I am not a wife to any one. Since I have taken refuge in you, you are competent to bestow on me a son with the power of your penance".

data.v: तस्याः प्रसन्नो ब्रह्मर्षिर्ददौ पुत्रमनुत्तमम् । ब्रह्मदत्त इति ख्यातं मानसं चूलिनः सुतम् ।।
data.es: Pleased with her, brahmarshi Chuli gave her an excellent son to be wellknown as Brahmadatta born through the will of his mind.

data.v: स राजा ब्रह्मदत्तस्तु पुरीमध्यवसत्तदा । काम्पिल्यां परया लक्ष्म्या देवराजो यथा दिवम् ।।
data.es: Then king Brahmadatta, son of Somada, lived in the city of Kampilya with great prosperity like Indra in heaven.

data.v: स बुद्धिं कृतवान्राजा कुशनाभः सुधार्मिकः । ब्रह्मदत्ताय काकुत्स्थ दातुं कन्याशतं तदा ।।
data.es: O Rama, then the highly righteous king Kusanabha decided to give his hundred daughters to Brahmadatta".

data.v: तमाहूय महातेजा ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिः । ददौ कन्याशतं राजा सुप्रीतेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: The lord of the earth, highly powerful king Kusanabha invited Brahmadatta, and gave his hundred daughters in marriage to him with a heart highly pleased.

data.v: यथाक्रमं ततः पाणिं जग्राह रघुनन्दन । ब्रह्मदत्तो मही पालस्तासां देवपतिर्यथा ।।
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty that king Brahmadatta resembling Indra received the hands of those maidens' in due order.

data.v: स्पृष्टमात्रे ततः पाणौ विकुब्जा विगतज्वराः । युक्ताः परमया लक्ष्म्या बभुः कन्याशतं तदा ।।
data.es: Thereafter, with the mere touch of his hand, the hundred daughters were cured of their hump back and freed from anguish. They assumed great beauty.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा वायुना मुक्ताः कुशनाभो महीपतिः । बभूव परमप्रीतो हर्षं लेभे पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: King Kusanabha, having seen his daughters released from disfigurement caused by the Windgod was immensely pleased. He experienced waves of delight.

data.v: कृतोद्वाहं तु राजानं ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिः । सदारं प्रेषयामास सोपाध्याय गणं तदा ।।
data.es: Then the king along with his queens performed the marriage of his daughters in the assembly of priests and sent them with Brahmadatta (to his kingdom).

data.v: सोमदापि सुसंहृष्टा पुत्रस्य सदृशीं क्रियाम् । यथान्यायं च गन्धर्वी स्नुषास्ताः प्रत्यनन्दत ।।
data.es: Somada the gandharvi was exeedingly delighted with her daughtersinlaw and praised her son for his right action.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: कृतोद्वाहे गते तस्मिन्ब्रह्मदत्ते च राघव । अपुत्रः पुत्रलाभाय पौत्रीमिष्टिमकल्पयत् ।।
data.es: "O son of Raghu's dynasty (Rama) Brahmadatta got married and left for his kingdom. Now a putreshti was performed by king Kusanabha in order to beget a son.

data.v: इष्ट्यां तु वर्तमानायां कुशनाभं महीपतिम् । उवाच परमप्रीतः कुशो ब्रह्मसुतस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then, while putreshti was on Kusa the highly generous son of Brahma, said to king Kusanabha :

data.v: पुत्रस्ते सदृशः पुत्र भविष्यति सुधार्मिकः । गाधिं प्राप्स्यसि तेन त्वं कीर्तिं लोके च शाश्वतीम् ।।
data.es: "O son, a highly virtuous son named Gadhi, similar to you will be born. Because of him you will obtain everlasting fame throughtout this world".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा कुशो राम कुशनाभं महीपतिम् । जगामाकाशमाविश्य ब्रह्मलोकं सनातनम् ।।
data.es: "O Rama so saying to king Kusanabha, Kusa left through space for the eternal Brahmaloka".

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य कुशनाभस्य धीमतः । जज्ञे परमधर्मिष्ठो गाधिरित्येव नामतः ।।
data.es: After some time, a supremely righteous son by name Gadhi was born to the sagacious Kusanabha.

data.v: स पिता मम काकुत्स्थ गाधिः परमधार्मिकः । कुशवंशप्रसूतोऽस्मि कौशिको रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of Raghu's dynasty the highly virtuous Gadhi is my father. I am known as Kausika being born in the family of Kusa.

data.v: पूर्वजा भगिनी चापि मम राघव सुव्रता । नाम्ना सत्यवती नाम ऋचीके प्रतिपादिता ।।
data.es: O Raghava adherent of best religious practices, is my elder sister well known by name Satyavati. She was bestowed in marriage to Richika.

data.v: सशरीरा गता स्वर्गं भर्तारमनुवर्तिनी । कौशिकी परमोदारा सा प्रवृत्ता महानदी ।।
data.es: Following her husband my highly generous sister reached heaven with her human body and down assuming the form of a sacred river, flowed Kausiki.

data.v: दिव्या पुण्योदका रम्या हिमवन्तमुपाश्रिता । लोकस्य हितकामार्थं प्रवृत्ता भगिनी मम ।।
data.es: Conferring the benefit of the other world and worldly pleasures on men my sister Kausiki who is divine and beautiful having sacred waters took resort in Himavat mountain and started flowing from there.

data.v: ततोऽहं हिमवत्पार्श्वे वसामि नियतः सुखम् । भगिन्याः स्नेहसंयुक्तः कौशिक्या रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus', from then onwards with affection towards my sister Kausiki, I am living happily in the vicinity of Himavat mountains.

data.v: सा तु सत्यवती पुण्या सत्ये धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिता । पतिव्रता महाभागा कौशिकी सरितां वरा ।।
data.es: Satyavati is sacred, firmly established in truth and righteousness. She is chaste holy and best among rivers. She is known as river Kausiki.

data.v: अहं हि नियमाद्राम हित्वा तां समुपागतः । सिद्धाश्रममनुप्राप्य सिद्धोऽस्मि तव तेजसा ।।
data.es: Rama, for the sake of observance of austerity I have come to Siddhaashrama leaving her behind. Having reached here, I have fulfilled my desire through your valour.

data.v: एषा राम ममोत्पत्तिः स्वस्य वंशस्य कीर्तिता । देशस्य च महाबाहो यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि ।।
data.es: O mightyarmed Rama since you asked me I narrated this, my origin, the history of my family and the history of this place.

data.v: गतोऽर्धरात्रः काकुत्स्थ कथाः कथयतो मम । निद्रामभ्येहि भद्रं ते मा भूद्विघ्नोऽध्वनीह नः ।।
data.es: O son of the Kakusthas while telling my stories, midnight has passed by. Go to sleep now. Prosperity to you. Let there be no obstacles on our way.

data.v: निष्पन्दास्तरवः सर्वे निलीना मृगपक्षिणः । नैशेन तमसा व्याप्ता दिशश्च रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus' the trees stand motionless, with the beasts and birds calm, all directions are pervaded with darkness.

data.v: शनैर्वियुज्यते संध्या नभो नेत्रैरिवावृतम् । नक्षत्रतारागहनं ज्योतिर्भिरवभासते ।।
data.es: Evening has gradually disappeared. The sky is littered with stars and planets gleaming points of light as though they are the eyes of the skies.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठति च शीतांशुः शशी लोकतमोनुदः । ह्लादयन्प्राणिनां लोके मनांसि प्रभया विभो ।।
data.es: O Lord the Moon with his cool rays, dispelling the darkness of the earth and delighting the minds of all living beings in this world, is rising higher and higher.

data.v: नैशानि सर्वभूतानि प्रचरन्ति ततस्ततः । यक्षराक्षससंघाश्च रौद्राश्च पिशिताशनाः ।।
data.es: All nocturnal creatures groups of yakshas and rakshasas and dreadful eaters of human flesh are moving here and there".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विरराम महामुनिः । साधु साध्विति तं सर्वे मुनयो ह्यभ्यपूजयन् ।।
data.es: Having spoken thus the highly lustrous, great ascetic rested. All sages praised him, saying, "wellsaid wellsaid"

data.v: रामोऽपि सह सौमित्रिः किंचिदागतविस्मयः । प्रशस्य मुनिशार्दूलं निद्रां समुपसेवते ।।
data.es: Rama as well as Lakshmana, with a sense of wonder went to sleep full of admiration for the great ascetic.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: उपास्य रात्रिशेषं तु शोणाकूले महर्षिभिः । निशायां सुप्रभातायां विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Viswamitra lay on the bank of Sona with the ascetics, for the rest of the night. (Getting up) at daybreak he said:

data.v: सुप्रभाता निशा राम पूर्वा संध्या प्रवर्तते । उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भद्रं ते गमनायाभिरोचय ।।
data.es: "O beloved son of Kausalya, O Rama the day dawns. O best among men, awake, oblations to gods and other sacred rites are required to be performed".

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकीं क्रियाम् । गमनं रोचयामास वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Out of affection towards his son, his (king Dasaratha's) plea to Viswamitra was full of contradiction. And on hearing the king, enraged Viswamitra replied:

data.v: अयं शोणः शुभजलो गाधः पुलिनमण्डितः । कतरेण पथा ब्रह्मन्संतरिष्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: "O knower of Brahman Clean waters of this river are adorned with sandbanks. This Sona is deep. Which way shall we cross this river?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् । एष पन्था मयोद्दिष्टो येन यान्ति महर्षयः ।।
data.es: Having been addressed by Rama thus Viswamitra said, "We shall take the way the ascetics have gone before".

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं गतेऽर्धदिवसे तदा । जाह्नवीं सरितां श्रेष्ठां ददृशुर्मुनिसेविताम् ।।
data.es: After travelling a long distance for half a day, they saw Jahnavi, the best among rivers haunted or worshipped by ascetics.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा पुण्यसलिलां हंससारससेविताम् । बभूवुर्मुदिताः सर्वे मुनयः सहराघवाः । तस्यास्तीरे ततश्चक्रुस्ते आवासपरिग्रहम् ।।
data.es: On seeing the river Ganga with swans and cranes floating on the surface of the sacred waters, all the sages including the sons of the Raghus (Rama and Lakshmana) were delighted.

data.v: ततः स्नात्वा यथान्यायं संतर्प्य पितृदेवताः । हुत्वा चैवाग्निहोत्राणि प्राश्य चामृतवद्धविः ।।
data.es: The birds had made the bank of the river their home. They (Rama and Lakshmana) took a dip and offered traditional oblations to ancestors. Thereafter they lighted the sacrificial fire and made customary offerings to the fire and partook of the nectarlike remains. With cheerful hearts they stood round the illustrious Viswamitra and entered the sacred bank of Jahnavi.

data.v: विविशुर्जाह्नवीतीरे शुचौ मुदितमानसाः । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं परिवार्य समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, with Brahma in the forefront, the gods spoke to Viswamitra in pleasing words:

data.v: संप्रहृष्टमना रामो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत् । भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम् । त्रैलोक्यं कथमाक्रम्य गता नदनदीपतिम् ।।
data.es: Then Rama said to Viswamitra "O venerable one I wish to know why Ganga flowing in three directions, occupy (purified) the three worlds before entering the sea, the lord of rivers?"

data.v: चोदितो राम वाक्येन विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । वृद्धिं जन्म च गङ्गाया वक्तुमेवोपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Thereafter, the cheerful Rama, bowed to the mighty ascetic Viswamitra and commenced his journey.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: शैलेन्द्रो हिमवान्नाम धातूनामाकरो महान् । तस्य कन्या द्वयं राम रूपेणाप्रतिमं भुवि ।।
data.es: "O Rama the great mountain named Himavan is a treasuretrove of ores. He is the king of mountains. He had two daughters, unrivalled in beauty in this world.

data.v: या मेरुदुहिता राम तयोर्माता सुमध्यमा । नाम्ना मेना मनोज्ञा वै पत्नी हिमवतः प्रिया ।।
data.es: O Rama Himavan's beloved of beautiful waist, wellknown by the name of Manorama is the daughter of Mount Meru. She is the mother to both the daughters.

data.v: तस्यां गङ्गेयमभवज्ज्येष्ठा हिमवतः सुता । उमा नाम द्वितीयाभूत्कन्या तस्यैव राघव ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus this Ganga was born to Manorama as Himavan's eldest daughter. A second one born to him was wellknown by the name of Uma.

data.v: अथ ज्येष्ठां सुराः सर्वे देवतार्थचिकीर्षया । शैलेन्द्रं वरयामासुर्गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम् ।।
data.es: Thereupon all the devatas desirous of deriving some advantage proposed that the eldest daughter of the king of mountains, Ganga, flowing in three directions be given to them.

data.v: ददौ धर्मेण हिमवांस्तनयां लोकपावनीम् । स्वच्छन्दपथगां गङ्गां त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया ।।
data.es: In order to do good to the three worlds Himavan, rooted in dharma gifted his eldest daughter Ganga who sanctifies the whole world by flowing at her free will৷৷

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य त्रिलोकार्थं त्रिलोकहितकारिणः । गङ्गामादाय तेऽगच्छन्कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: The devatas having received Ganga committed to the welfare of the three worlds went back to their abodes with a sense of fulfilment in their mind.

data.v: या चान्या शैलदुहिता कन्यासीद्रघुनन्दन । उग्रं सा व्रतमास्थाय तपस्तेपे तपोधना ।।
data.es: O Delight of the Raghus The other daughter of the mountain Himavan was a maiden whose wealth was tapas. She pursued a vow and observed severe austerities.

data.v: उग्रेण तपसा युक्तां ददौ शैलवरः सुताम् । रुद्रायाप्रतिरूपाय उमां लोकनमस्कृताम् ।।
data.es: Himavan the best of mountains gave his daughter Uma associated with severe austerities and venerated by the whole world in marriage to the unrivalled Rudra.

data.v: एते ते शैल राजस्य सुते लोकनमस्कृते । गङ्गा च सरितां श्रेष्ठा उमा देवी च राघव ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus Ganga, the holiest of rivers and Uma devi are two daughters of the king of the mountains, (Himavan). They are worshipped by the entire world.

data.v: एतत्ते धर्ममाख्यातं यथा त्रिपथगा नदी । खं गता प्रथमं तात गतिं गतिमतां वर ।।
data.es: O child with a marvellous gait I have related to you about Ganga flowing across the three worlds, Ganga who reached the heaven first and all that.

data.v: उक्त वाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्नुभौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ । प्रतिनन्द्य कथां वीरावूचतुर्मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: While Viswamitra preeminent ascetic among the sages was telling the story (of Ganga) to the heroic Rama and Lakshmana, they extolled it and enquired:

data.v: धर्मयुक्तमिदं ब्रह्मन्कथितं परमं त्वया । दुहितुः शैलराजस्य ज्येष्ठाय वक्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "O Brahman sage, this excellent story set in righteousness has been narrated by you. Since you are conversant with the details, you can befittingly tell the story in detail, pertaining to the eldest daughter of king of the mountains and the events that happened in the celestial and mortal worlds

data.v: विस्तरं विस्तरज्ञोऽसि दिव्यमानुषसंभवम् । त्रीन्पथो हेतुना केन पावयेल्लोकपावनी ।।
कथं गङ्गां त्रिपथगा विश्रुता सरिदुत्तमा । त्रिषु लोकेषु धर्मज्ञ कर्मभिः कैः समन्विता ।।
data.es: Why does Ganga, the purifier of the worlds overflow the three paths (worlds)? O knower of dharma what deed made, Tripathaga (flowing in three directions) Ganga wellknown in the three worlds as the best (holiest) of all rivers"?

data.v: तथा ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रस्तपोधनः । निखिलेन कथां सर्वामृषिमध्ये न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: To these words spoken by Rama, maharshi Viswamitra who was patient practitioner of vows and pure taught the withdrawl mantra.

data.v: पुरा राम कृतोद्वाहः शितिकण्ठो महातपाः । दृष्ट्वा च स्पृहया देवीं मैथुनायोपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: "O Rama, in ancient times, great ascetic the blueneck Lord Siva got married to goddess Uma charmed with her beauty he indulged in sexual enjoyment with intense passion.

data.v: शितिकण्ठस्य देवस्य दिव्यं वर्षशतं गतम् । न चापि तनयो राम तस्यामासीत्परंतप ।।
data.es: O Rama, tormentor of enemies, while Lord Siva was thus absorbed in sexual enjoyment, a hundred (celestial) years passed but no son was born to them.

data.v: ततो देवाः समुद्विग्नाः पितामहपुरोगमाः । यदिहोत्पद्यते भूतं कस्तत्प्रतिसहिष्यते ।।
data.es: "Then the devatas led by Brahma were exceedingly alarmed. 'Who will be able to bear the power of the offspring if it is born here and now', they reflected.

data.v: अभिगम्य सुराः सर्वे प्रणिपत्येदमब्रुवन् । देवदेव महादेव लोकस्यास्य हिते रत । सुराणां प्रणिपातेन प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: All devatas approached Siva and paying their obeisance said, "O God of the gods engaged in the welfare of all O Mahadeva accept our salutations Be king which you can be (if you will)".

data.v: न लोका धारयिष्यन्ति तव तेजः सुरोत्तम । ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तो देव्या सह तपश्चर ।।
data.es: "O best among the gods, the worlds cannot contain your energy (the son born of your energy) You may engage yourself in penance in the company of Uma in conformity with the Vedas. Retain your energy in your body for the welfare of the three worlds."

data.v: त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थं तेजस्तेजसि धारय । रक्ष सर्वानिमाँल्लोकान्नालोकं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकमहेश्वरः । बाढमित्यब्रवीत्सर्वान्पुनश्चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Mahadeva, ruler of the all the worlds, having heard the words of devatas, said "Be it so" Further:

data.v: धारयिष्याम्यहं तेजस्तेजस्येव सहोमया । त्रिदशाः पृथिवी चैव निर्वाणमधिगच्छतु ।।
data.es: ""Together with Uma I will preserve the semen in my body thereby the devatas and also the earth will have peace.

data.v: यदिदं क्षुभितं स्थानान्मम तेजो ह्यनुत्तमम् । धारयिष्यति कस्तन्मे ब्रुवन्तु सुरसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: "Who will contain this exceptional vital fluid of mine if shaken from its own place? O best of devatas tell me".

data.v: एवमुक्तास्ततो देवाः प्रत्यूचुर्वृषभध्वजम् । यत्तेजः क्षुभितं ह्येतत्तद्धरा धारयिष्यति ।।
data.es: Thus questioned, all the devatas replied to the bearer of the flag with bull as its symbol (Siva), saying, "The earth will contain the disturbed vital fluid".

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरपतिः प्रमुमोच महीतले । तेजसा पृथिवी येन व्याप्ता सगिरिकानना ।।
data.es: Thus replied by the devatas, the god of the gods released his vital fluid on earth. It pervaded the entire earth including mountains and forests.

data.v: ततो देवाः पुनरिदमूचुश्चाथ हुताशनम् । प्रविश त्वं महातेजो रौद्रं वायुसमन्वितः ।।
data.es: Then, the devatas said to the firegod, "Enter this energy (creative power) related to Rudra followed by the windgod".

data.v: तदग्निना पुनर्व्याप्तं संजातः श्वेतपर्वतः । दिव्यं शरवणं चैव पावकादित्यसंनिभम् । यत्र जातो महातेजाः कार्तिकेयोऽग्निसंभवः ।।
data.es: That energy pervaded by fire was transformed into the White Mountain. It turned the forest of reeds (Saravana) (blazing) like the fire or the Sun. From that fire was born the glorious Kartikeya.

data.v: अथोमां च शिवं चैव देवाः सर्षि गणास्तदा । पूजयामासुरत्यर्थं सुप्रीतमनसस्ततः ।।
data.es: Thereafter highly pleased with the event the devatas along with the saints worshipped Siva and goddess Uma with deep devotion.

data.v: अथ शैल सुता राम त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत् । समन्युरशपत्सर्वान्क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना ।।
data.es: "Rama thereafter Uma, daughter of the mountain (Himavan) with her eyes red with anger cursed all of them:

data.v: यस्मान्निवारिता चैव संगता पुत्रकाम्यया । अपत्यं स्वेषु दारेषु नोत्पादयितुमर्हथ । अद्य प्रभृति युष्माकमप्रजाः सन्तु पत्नयः ।।
एवमुक्त्वा सुरान्सर्वाञ्शशाप पृथिवीमपि । अवने नैकरूपा त्वं बहुभार्या भविष्यसि ।।
न च पुत्रकृतां प्रीतिं मत्क्रोधकलुषी कृता । प्राप्स्यसि त्वं सुदुर्मेधे मम पुत्रमनिच्छती ।।
data.es: "O Earth you will assume many forms and become wife of many masters. O evilminded one, you did not want me to bear a son. Having been fouled as a result of my anger, you will not have the pleasure of having a son, cursed Uma.

data.v: तान्सर्वान्व्रीडितान्दृष्ट्वा सुरान्सुरपतिस्तदा । गमनायोपचक्राम दिशं वरुणपालिताम् ।।
data.es: "The god of the gods (Mahesvara), seeing all the devatas humiliated began to depart in the westerly direction presided over by Varuna.

data.v: स गत्वा तप आतिष्ठत्पार्श्वे तस्योत्तरे गिरेः । हिमवत्प्रभवे शृङ्गे सह देव्या महेश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Mahesvara along with goddess Uma, went north of the Himavat mountain and performed penance on a peak.

data.v: एष ते विस्तरो राम शैलपुत्र्या निवेदितः । गङ्गायाः प्रभवं चैव शृणु मे सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: "O Rama this story of the daughter of the mountain has been narrated to you. Now listen with Lakshmana the tale of the birth of Ganga":इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तप्यमाने तपो देवे देवाः सर्षिगणाः पुरा । सेनापतिमभीप्सन्तः पितामहमुपागमन् ।।
data.es: In olden days when Iswara was engaged in austerities, the devatas together with the ascetics, approached Lord Brahma for an army general.

data.v: ततोऽब्रुवन्सुराः सर्वे भगवन्तं पितामहम् । प्रणिपत्य शुभं वाक्यं सेन्द्राः साग्निपुरोगमाः ।।
data.es: Then led by Indra and the Firegod all devatas approached Lord Brahma, the grandsire saluted him (with folded hands) and spoke.

data.v: यो नः सेनापतिर्देव दत्तो भगवता पुरा । स तपः परमास्थाय तप्यते स्म सहोमया ।।
data.es: "O Lord in ancient times your lordship gave us an army general (at the time of creation). He is engrossed in great penance along with Uma .

data.v: यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं लोकानां हितकाम्यया । संविधत्स्व विधानज्ञ त्वं हि नः परमा गतिः ।।
data.es: "O Knower of law and order O Grandsire verily you are our supreme refuge committed to the welfare of the worlds. Tell us what we should do in this matter (now that we cannot procreate a general on account of Uma's curse)".

data.v: देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहः । सान्त्वयन्मधुरैर्वाक्यैस्त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of the devatas, Brahma, the Grandsire of all the worlds consoled the devatas with sweet words, saying:

data.v: शैलपुत्र्या यदुक्तं तन्न प्रजास्यथ पत्निषु । तस्या वचनमक्लिष्टं सत्यमेव न संशयः ।।
इयमाकाशगा गङ्गा यस्यां पुत्रं हुताशनः । जनयिष्यति देवानां सेनापतिमरिंदमम् ।।
data.es: "Ganga keeps flowing in the celestial regions. Through Ganga the Firegod will beget a son who will be capable of destroying enemies. He will become the army general of the gods".

data.v: ज्येष्ठा शैलेन्द्रदुहिता मानयिष्यति तं सुतम् । उमायास्तद्बहुमतं भविष्यति न संशयः ।।
data.es: "Ganga, the eldest daughter of the king of the mountains, will tend that son of Agni. This will be totally acceptable to Uma. No doubt".

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृतार्था रघुनन्दन । प्रणिपत्य सुराः सर्वे पितामहमपूजयन् ।।
data.es: "O son of the Raghus having heard Brahma's words all the devatas considered themselves successful in their mission. They saluted him with folded hands and offered their worship.

data.v: ते गत्वा पर्वतं राम कैलासं धातुमण्डितम् । अग्निं नियोजयामासुः पुत्रार्थं सर्वदेवताः ।।
data.es: All the devatas, went to mount Kailasa, adorned with minerals, and urged the Firegod for a son.

data.v: देवकार्यमिदं देव समाधत्स्व हुताशन । शैलपुत्र्यां महातेजो गङ्गायां तेज उत्सृज ।।
data.es: 'O lustrous Firegod, accomplish this divine work. O god, possessed of mighty energy, release the vital fluid of Iswara in Ganga, daughter of the king of mountains.

data.v: देवतानां प्रतिज्ञाय गङ्गामभ्येत्य पावकः । गर्भं धारय वै देवि देवतानामिदं प्रियम् ।।
data.es: "The Firegod gave his consent. The devatas approached Ganga and said, 'O goddess bear the energy of Siva (inyour world) since this cause is dear to the gods'.

data.v: इत्येतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिव्यं रूपमधारयत् । स तस्या महिमां दृष्ट्वा समन्तादवकीर्यत ।।
data.es: "Hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga assumed a divine form. Beholding her glory, the god of fire pervaded her from all sides.

data.v: समन्ततस्तदा देवीमभ्यषिञ्चत पावकः । सर्वस्रोतांसि पूर्णानि गङ्गाया रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O Rama then, the Firegod discharged the vital fluid of Iswara, preserved in his body, which pervaded all sides of Ganga and all her streams were filled with (the fluid).

data.v: तमुवाच ततो गङ्गा सर्वदेवपुरोहितम् । अशक्ता धारणे देव तव तेजः समुद्धतम् । दह्यमानाग्निना तेन संप्रव्यथितचेतना ।।
data.es: Ganga addressing the Firegod standing ahead of all the devatas said 'O god of fire, I am incapable of holding your everincreasing splendour. The fiery fluid is burning me. My consciousness is overwhelmed'.

data.v: अथाब्रवीदिदं गङ्गां सर्वदेवहुताशनः । इह हैमवते पादे गर्भोऽयं संनिवेश्यताम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter the Firegod who is the partaker of oblations offered to all deities said to Ganga 'Place this embryo on this slope of Mountain Himavan'.

data.v: श्रुत्वा त्वग्निवचो गङ्गा तं गर्भमतिभास्वरम् । उत्ससर्ज महातेजाः स्रोतोभ्यो हि तदानघ ।।
data.es: "O glorious, sinless one, (Rama) hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga then expelled that resplendent embryo from her streams.

data.v: यदस्या निर्गतं तस्मात्तप्तजाम्बूनदप्रभम् । काञ्चनं धरणीं प्राप्तं हिरण्यममलं शुभम् ।।
data.es: The embryo that emerged from Ganga reached the earth. It resembled the lustre of molten gold. It furned into gold auspicious, bright and pure.

data.v: ताम्रं कार्ष्णायसं चैव तैक्ष्ण्यादेवाभिजायत । मलं तस्याभवत्तत्र त्रपुसीसकमेव च ।।
data.es: There copper and iron were produced from its acidity, zinc and lead from its residue. Various minerals were formed when that embryo reached the earth.

data.v: तदेतद्धरणीं प्राप्य नानाधातुरवर्धत ।।
निक्षिप्तमात्रे गर्भे तु तेजोभिरभिरञ्जितम् । सर्वं पर्वतसंनद्धं सौवर्णमभवद्वनम् ।।
data.es: When the embryo was placed (in Ganga) it spread on all sides of the forest on the mountain. Irradiated with lustre the forest appeared golden.

data.v: जातरूपमिति ख्यातं तदा प्रभृति राघव । सुवर्णं पुरुषव्याघ्र हुताशनसमप्रभम् ।।
data.es: O tiger among men, O scion of the Raghus Then onwards gold which is effulgent like fire, became wellknown as Jatarupa (pure form). The grass, shrubs, creepers and trees of that forest looked golden.

data.v: तं कुमारं ततो जातं सेन्द्राः सहमरुद्गणाः । क्षीरसंभावनार्थाय कृत्तिकाः समयोजयन् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Kumara was born (out of Ganga's womb). The gods together with Indra arranged six nymphs (stars) to act as nurses to suckle Kumara as their own offspring.

data.v: ताः क्षीरं जातमात्रस्य कृत्वा समयमुत्तमम् । ददुः पुत्रोऽयमस्माकं सर्वासामिति निश्चिताः ।।
data.es: Those krittikas, having decided among themselves and having made an agreement with the gods saying 'This boy shall become a son to all of us' fed the newborn with their milk (breast milk).

data.v: ततस्तु देवताः सर्वाः कार्तिकेय इति ब्रुवन् । पुत्रस्त्रैलोक्य विख्यातो भविष्यति न संशयः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, all the gods said, 'This son shall become renowned in the three worlds as Karttikeya, (son of krittikas). There is no doubt '.

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवे । स्नापयन्परया लक्ष्म्या दीप्यमानमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of the gods, the krittikas bathed the baby that descended from the womb of Ganga resembling flaming fire and shining with great beauty.

data.v: स्कन्द इत्यब्रुवन्देवाः स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवात् । कार्तिकेयं महाभागं काकुत्स्थज्वलनोपमम् ।।
data.es: O scion of the Kakusthas, Karttikeya lustrous like flaming fire, was very fortunate Descended from the womb of the Ganga, he is named Skanda by the gods.

data.v: प्रादुर्भूतं ततः क्षीरं कृत्तिकानामनुत्तमम् । षण्णां षडाननो भूत्वा जग्राह स्तनजं पयः ।।
data.es: Then excellent milk surged in the breasts of krittikas. Assuming six mouths, he sucked the milk.

data.v: गृहीत्वा क्षीरमेकाह्ना सुकुमार वपुस्तदा । अजयत्स्वेन वीर्येण दैत्यसैन्यगणान्विभुः ।।
data.es: Drinking milk just for a day and with a body still tender he could vanquish hosts of demons by his inborn prowess so capable be was

data.v: सुरसेनागणपतिं ततस्तममलद्युतिम् । अभ्यषिञ्चन्सुरगणाः समेत्याग्निपुरोगमाः ।।
data.es: With the Firegod in the forefront, all the gods assembled and installed Karttikeya, shining on unsurpassed brilliant, as commander of the gods forces.

data.v: एष ते राम गङ्गाया विस्तरोऽभिहितो मया । कुमारसंभवश्चैव धन्यः पुण्यस्तथैव च ।।
data.es: "O Rama this story of Ganga and that of the birth of Kumara, who was fortunate and auspicious, has been related to you in detail.

data.v: तां कथां कौशिको रामे निवेद्य मधुराक्षरम् । पुनरेवापरं वाक्यं काकुत्स्थमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra, an offspring of Kusika having related the story (of Karthikeya) to the son of the Kakusthas (Rama) said again.

data.v: अयोध्याधिपतिः शूरः पूर्वमासीन्नराधिपः । सगरो नाम धर्मात्मा प्रजाकामः स चाप्रजः ।।
data.es: "In olden days there lived a brave and righteous king named Sagara who was ruler of Ayodhya. He was childless and desired to have children,

data.v: वैदर्भदुहिता राम केशिनी नाम नामतः । ज्येष्ठा सगरपत्नी सा धर्मिष्ठा सत्यवादिनी ।।
data.es: O Rama the daughter of the king of Vidarbha by name Kesini was Sagara's eldest wife who was righteous and truthful.

data.v: अरिष्टनेमिदुहिता रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । द्वितीया सगरस्यासीत्पत्नी सुमतिसंज्ञिता ।।
data.es: The daughter of Arishtanemi named Sumati was the second wife of Sagara and none surpassed her in charm on earth.

data.v: ताभ्यां सह तदा राजा पत्नीभ्यां तप्तवांस्तपः । हिमवन्तं समासाद्य भृगुप्रस्रवणे गिरौ ।।
data.es: The king (Sagara) accompanied by his wives reached Himavat mountain and engaged himself in severe austerities on a peak called Bhriguprasravana.

data.v: अथ वर्ष शते पूर्णे तपसाराधितो मुनिः । सगराय वरं प्रादाद्भृगुः सत्यवतां वरः ।।
data.es: When Sagara completed a hundred years in austerities, highly pleased by his performance, ascetic Bhrugu, the best among the truthful granted him a boon.

data.v: अपत्यलाभः सुमहान्भविष्यति तवानघ । कीर्तिं चाप्रतिमां लोके प्राप्स्यसे पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.es: O sinless one, you will get a very great progeny, O best among men you will acquire unparalleled fame in this world.

data.v: एका जनयिता तात पुत्रं वंशकरं तव । षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि अपरा जनयिष्यति ।।
data.es: O child, one wife will beget a son who will perpetuate your race and the other, sixty thousand sons, said Bhrugu.

data.v: भाषमाणं नरव्याघ्रं राजपत्न्यौ प्रसाद्य तम् । ऊचतुः परमप्रीते कृताञ्जलिपुटे तदा ।।
data.es: Thereafter, both the daughters of the king were exceedingly delighted. Having propitiated that magnanimous asectic both of them with folded hands in supplication, said:

data.v: एकः कस्याः सुतो ब्रह्मन्का बहूञ्जनयिष्यति । श्रोतुमिच्छावहे ब्रह्मन्सत्यमस्तु वचस्तव ।।
data.es: O knower of Brahman which of us will beget one, and who many sons? O Brahmarshi we wish to hear. Let your words come true".

data.v: तयोस्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भृगुः परम धार्मिकः । उवाच परमां वाणीं स्वच्छन्दोऽत्र विधीयताम् ।।
data.es: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:

data.v: एको वंशकरो वास्तु बहवो वा महाबलाः । कीर्तिमन्तो महोत्साहाः का वा कं वरमिच्छति ।।
data.es: 'What would you wish? One son who perpetuates the race or many possessed of mighty strength endowed with fame and perseverance?' (asked Bhrugu).

data.v: मुनेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा केशिनी रघुनन्दन । पुत्रं वंशकरं राम जग्राह नृपसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: "O Rama, delight of the descendants of Raghus, on hearing the words of the ascetic in the presence of king Sagara, Kesini chose the boon to have a son who perpetuates the race.

data.v: षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि सुपर्णभगिनी तदा । महोत्साहान्कीर्तिमतो जग्राह सुमतिः सुतान् ।।
data.es: Then, Sumati (the other wife) sister of Suparna (Garuda) obtained the boon of sixty thousand sons endowed with fame and great perseverance.

data.v: प्रदक्षिणमृषिं कृत्वा शिरसाभिप्रणम्य च । जगाम स्वपुरं राजा सभार्या रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus the king along with his wives, having circumambulated saint Bhrugu, bowed his head in reverence, saluted him with folded hands and returned to his capital.

data.v: अथ काले गते तस्मिञ्ज्येष्ठा पुत्रं व्यजायत । असमञ्ज इति ख्यातं केशिनी सगरात्मजम् ।।
data.es: After lapse of some time, the eldest wife Kesini gave birth to a son wellknown by name Asamanjasa.

data.v: सुमतिस्तु नरव्याघ्र गर्भतुम्बं व्यजायत । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि तुम्बभेदाद्विनिःसृताः ।।
data.es: O best among men, Sumati gave birth to a gourdlike foetus and when it burst open, sixty thousand sons emerged.

data.v: घृतपूर्णेषु कुम्भेषु धात्र्यस्तान्समवर्धयन् । कालेन महता सर्वे यौवनं प्रतिपेदिरे ।।
data.es: Nurses placed all of them in pots filled with clarified butter and fostered them. They attained adolescence after a long time.

data.v: अथ दीर्घेण कालेन रूपयौवनशालिनः । षष्टिः पुत्रसहस्राणि सगरस्याभवंस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then, after a long time Sagara's sixty thousand sons attained beauty and youth.

data.v: स च ज्येष्ठो नरश्रेष्ठ सगरस्यात्मसंभवः । बालान्गृहीत्वा तु जले सरय्वा रघुनन्दन । प्रक्षिप्य प्रहसन्नित्यं मज्जतस्तान्निरीक्ष्य वै ।।
data.es: O best among men, delight of the Raghus (in the mean time) sagara's eldest son Asamanjasa, used to seize hold of children and throw them into the waters of river Sarayu. And while they were drowning, he was laughing.

data.v: पौराणामहिते युक्तः पित्रा निर्वासितः पुरात् ।।
data.es: Thus this son inclined towards evil and formenting the good citizens was banished (of the king) from the capital for his indulgence in malevolent acts.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रोंऽशुमान्नाम असमञ्जस्य वीर्यवान् । संमतः सर्वलोकस्य सर्वस्यापि प्रियंवदः ।।
data.es: Asamanjasa's son was Anshuman. He was valiant, beloved and courteous to every one in the world.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता मतिः समभिजायत । सगरस्य नरश्रेष्ठ यजेयमिति निश्चिता ।।
data.es: O best among men after a long time, a thought came to the mind of Sagara to definitely perform a sacrifice.

data.v: स कृत्वा निश्चयं राजा सोपाध्यायगणस्तदा । यज्ञकर्मणि वेदज्ञो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: O Rama having determined to perform a sacrifice, he (Sagara) versed in the Vedas, started the initiatory rites for the sacrifice in the company of high priests".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टात्रिंशस्सर्ग: 2Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा कथान्ते रघुनन्दन । उवाच परमप्रीतो मुनिं दीप्तमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: Immensely pleased with the words of Viswamitra, to the ascetic flaming bright like fire, Rama spoke towards the end of the narration:

data.v: श्रोतुमिछामि भद्रं ते विस्तरेण कथामिमाम् । पूर्वको मे कथं ब्रह्मन्यज्ञं वै समुपाहरत् ।।
data.es: "O Brahman I wish to listen in detail as to how my ancestors made preparations for the sacrifice? Prosperity to you".

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु काकुत्स्थमुवाच प्रहसन्निव । श्रूयतां विस्तरो राम सगरस्य महात्मनः ।।
