data.v: आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि बलस्यास्य महाबल । तव चैवाप्रमेयस्य यथार्हं संप्रतीच्छ मे ।।
data.es: O Highy powerful Viswamitra I wish to offer appropriate hospitality to you and to your incomparable army. Be pleased to accept it.

data.v: सत्क्रियां तु भवानेतां प्रतीच्छतु मयोद्यताम् । राजंस्त्वमतिथिश्रेष्ठः पूजनीयः प्रयत्नतः ।।
data.es: Please accept the honour I extend. Being a king, you are a distinguished guest. you deserve to be treated respectfully in all possible ways".

data.v: एवमुक्तो वसिष्ठेन विश्वामित्रो महामतिः । कृतमित्यब्रवीद्राजा पूजावाक्येन मे त्वया ।।
data.es: To these words of Vasishta, the great intellectual Viswamitra said, "you have spoken pleasing words. This in itself is hospitality for me".

data.v: फलमूलेन भगवन्विद्यते यत्तवाश्रमे । पाद्येनाचमनीयेन भगवद्दर्शनेन च ।।
data.es: "O Worshipful one O Profoundly wise one you are worthy of homage. You have excellently honoured me in all possible ways with whatever fruits and roots available in your hermitage, with water for washing feet and for sipping. You have permitted me darshan with your revered self. I shall leave (now). My regards Look upon me with eyes of friendship".

data.v: सर्वथा च महाप्राज्ञ पूजार्हेण सुपूजितः । गमिष्यामि नमस्तेऽस्तु मैत्रेणेक्षस्व चक्षुषा ।।
data.es: "O Worshipful one O Profoundly wise one you are worthy of homage. You have excellently honoured me in all possible ways with whatever fruits and roots available in your hermitage, with water for washing feet and for sipping. You have permitted me darshan with your revered self. I shall leave (now). My regards Look upon me with eyes of friendship".

data.v: एवं ब्रुवन्तं राजानं वसिष्ठः पुनरेव हि । न्यमन्त्रयत धर्मात्मा पुनः पुनरुदारधीः ।।
data.es: As the king was addressing thus the righteous and generous Vasishta, repeatedly requested him to accept his hospitality.

data.v: बाढमित्येव गाधेयो वसिष्ठं प्रत्युवाच ह । यथा प्रियं भगवतस्तथास्तु मुनिसत्तम ।।
data.es: The son of Gadhi said to Vasishta, "O Preeminent among sages, be it so, O venerable one they will be done".

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजा वसिष्ठो जपतां वरः । आजुहाव ततः प्रीतः कल्माषीं धूतकल्मषः ।।
data.es: Vasishta who was highly brilliant the greatest among those who meditate (on Brahman) and free from sins was pleased. Thereafter he called the speckled cow (Kamadhenu):

data.v: एह्येहि शबले क्षिप्रं शृणु चापि वचो मम । सबलस्यास्य राजर्षेः कर्तुं व्यवसितोऽस्म्यहम् । भोजनेन महार्हेण सत्कारं संविधत्स्व मे ।।
data.es: "O Sabala, come on quick Listen to my words. I have decided to honour this royal saint and his army with excellent food. Make necessary arrangemets.

data.v: यस्य यस्य यथाकामं षड्रसेष्वभिपूजितम् । तत्सर्वं कामधुग्दिव्ये अभिवर्षकृते मम ।।
data.es: O Kamadhenu quickly entertain them for my sake with the food of six kinds of tastes (varieties of rich dishes) as desired by each.

data.v: रसेनान्नेन पानेन लेह्यचोष्येण संयुतम् । अन्नानां निचयं सर्वं सृजस्व शबले त्वर ।।
data.es: O Sabala create at once all food items consisting of liquids and solids for drinking, tasting and siping."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवमुक्ता वसिष्ठेन शबला शत्रुसूदन । विदधे कामधुक्कामान्यस्य यस्य यथेप्सितम् ।।
data.es: "O Destroyer of foes (Rama)" addressed thus by Vasishta the wishfulfilling Sabala satisfied each one's desires.

data.v: इक्षून्मधूंस्तथा लाजान्मैरेयांश्च वरासवान् । पानानि च महार्हाणि भक्ष्यांश्चोच्चावचांस्तथा ।।
data.es: Sugarcane, honey and fried grain, invigorating liquors in good containers, excellent drinks and varieties of food (were served).

data.v: उष्णाढ्यस्यौदनस्यापि राशयः पर्वतोपमाः । मृष्टान्नानि च सूपाश्च दधिकुल्यास्तथैव च ।।
data.es: Heaps of hot rice as high as mountains, savoury food, condiments and on abundance of curd, various kinds of soups, containers in their thousands completely filled with edibles with all six tastes and preparations made of jaggery (were distributed).

data.v: नानास्वादुरसानां च षाडवानां तथैव च । भाजनानि सुपूर्णानि गौडानि च सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: Heaps of hot rice as high as mountains, savoury food, condiments and on abundance of curd, various kinds of soups, containers in their thousands completely filled with edibles with all six tastes and preparations made of jaggery (were distributed).

data.v: सर्वमासीत्सुसंतुष्टं हृष्टपुष्टजनाकुलम् । विश्वामित्रबलं राम वसिष्ठेनाभितर्पितम् ।।
data.es: "O Rama, Vasistha entertained everybody in Viswamitra's army to their full satisfaction. They were all wellfed and happy.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि राजर्षिर्हृष्टपुष्टस्तदाभवत् । सान्तः पुरवरो राजा सब्राह्मणपुरोहितः ।।
data.es: King Viswamitra along with ladies, priests and brahmins including the royal sage were fully satisfied and delighted.

data.v: सामात्यो मन्त्रिसहितः सभृत्यः पूजितस्तदा । युक्तः परेण हर्षेण वसिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having received the hospitality along with his counsellors, ministers and attendants, Viswamitra, filled with great delight, said to Vasishta":

data.v: पूजितोऽहं त्वया ब्रह्मन्पूजार्हेण सुसत्कृतः । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि वाक्यं वाक्यविशारद ।।
data.es: "O Brahman you are worthy of worship. I was received with reverence and wellentertained by you. O Sage conversant with speech listen.

data.v: गवां शतसहस्रेण दीयतां शबला मम । रत्नं हि भगवन्नेतद्रत्नहारी च पार्थिवः । तस्मान्मे शबलां देहि ममैषा धर्मतो द्विज ।।
data.es: "I shall give you a hundred thousand cows in exchange for Sabala. O Respectable one this cow is a gem. A king (along) has a right on jewels, O Brahmin, for that reason, Sabala rightfully belongs to me. Therefore, give this cow".

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भगवान्वसिष्ठो मुनिसत्तमः । विश्वामित्रेण धर्मात्मा प्रत्युवाच महीपतिम् ।।
data.es: Addressed the by Viswamitra venerable and righteous Vasishta who was of the earth ascetic replied:

data.v: नाहं शतसहस्रेण नापि कोटिशतैर्गवाम् । राजन्दास्यामि शबलां राशिभी रजतस्य वा ।।
data.es: "O King I shall not exchange Sabala for a hundred thousand for even or a hundred crore cows or heaps of silver.

data.v: न परित्यागमर्हेयं मत्सकाशादरिंदम । शाश्वती शबला मह्यं कीर्तिरात्मवतो यथा ।।
data.es: O Suppressor of enemies Viswamitra it is not proper to separate this cow from me. The relationship between Sabala and me is permanent like the relationship between a righteous man and his fame.

data.v: अस्यां हव्यं च कव्यं च प्राणयात्रा तथैव च । आयत्तमग्निहोत्रं च बलिर्होमस्तथैव च ।।
data.es: For havyam (oblations to gods) and kavyam (oblations to ancestors), for fulfilling the necessities of life, maintenance of the sacred fire and offering oblations to all spirits of created beings, and for offerings made to the Firegod I depend on this cow.

data.v: स्वाहाकारवषट्कारौ विद्याश्च विविधास्तथा । आयत्तमत्र राजर्षे सर्वमेतन्न संशयः ।।
data.es: O Royal saint swaha and vashat and various branches of learning are all dependent on this cow. No doubt about it.

data.v: सर्व स्वमेतत्सत्येन मम तुष्टिकरी सदा । कारणैर्बहुभी राजन्न दास्ये शबलां तव ।।
data.es: This one is truly my whole possession, it always gives me contentment. O King for various reasons, I will not give Sabala to you".

data.v: वसिष्ठेनैवमुक्तस्तु विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीत्ततः । संरब्धतरमत्यर्थं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: To there words of Vasishta, Viswamitra who is skilful in conversation reacted with extreme excitement:

data.v: हैरण्यकक्ष्याग्रैवेयान्सुवर्णाङ्कुशभूषितान् । ददामि कुञ्जराणां ते सहस्राणि चतुर्दश ।।
data.es: "I shall give fourteen thousand elephants with gold trappings around the neck and girth, and with goads made of gold.

data.v: हैरण्यानां रथानां च श्वेताश्वानां चतुर्युजाम् । ददामि ते शतान्यष्टौ किङ्किणीकविभूषितान् ।।
data.es: I shall give you eight hundred chariots made of gold and decorated with small tinkling bells, each chariot yoked with four white horses.

data.v: हयानां देशजातानां कुलजानां महौजसाम् । सहस्रमेकं दश च ददामि तव सुव्रत ।।
data.es: O Maharshi of auspicious vows I shall give you eleven thousand mighty horses of good breed born in good countries.

data.v: नानावर्णविभक्तानां वयःस्थानां तथैव च । ददाम्येकां गवां कोटिं शबला दीयतां मम ।।
data.es: I shall give one crore young cows of various colours. Give me Sabala.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भगवान्विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । न दास्यामीति शबलां प्राह राजन्कथंचन ।।
data.es: With these words of the wise Viswamitra the ascetics moved forward surveying various forests.

data.v: एतदेव हि मे रत्नमेतदेव हि मे धनम् । एतदेव हि सर्वस्वमेतदेव हि जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "This is verily my jewel, my wealth my very life. This is allinall for me.

data.v: दर्शश्च पूर्णमासश्च यज्ञाश्चैवाप्तदक्षिणाः । एतदेव हि मे राजन्विविधाश्च क्रियास्तथा ।।
data.es: O King verily this Sabala is useful for my darsa and purnamasa sacrifices, for appropriate gifts and various rites.

data.v: अदोमूलाः क्रियाः सर्वा मम राजन्न संशयः । बहूनां किं प्रलापेन न दास्ये कामदोहिनीम् ।।
data.es: O King this (cow) is undoubtedly the source of all my actions. Why these useless words? I will never give this wishfulfilling cow".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: कामधेनुं वसिष्ठोऽपि यदा न त्यजते मुनिः । तदास्य शबलां राम विश्वामित्रोऽन्वकर्षत ।।
data.es: "O Rama when sage Vasishta did not consent to part with the wishfulfilling cow, Viswamitra dragged Sabala by force.

data.v: नीयमाना तु शबला राम राज्ञा महात्मना । दुःखिता चिन्तयामास रुदन्ती शोककर्शिता ।।
data.es: O Rama when she was being taken away by the powerful king the distressed Sabala thus reflected choked with sorrow":

data.v: परित्यक्ता वसिष्ठेन किमहं सुमहात्मना । याहं राजभृतैर्दीना ह्रियेयं भृशदुःखिता ।।
data.es: "I am being carried away by attendants of the king in this greatly distressed and pitiable condition. Have I been abandoned by the magnanimous Vasishta?

data.v: किं मयापकृतं तस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । यन्मामनागसं भक्तामिष्टां त्यजति धार्मिकः ।।
data.es: What harm have I done to the pious maharshi, a compassionate soul? Why does he forsake me, his auspicious one, despite my innocence and devotion"?

data.v: इति सा चिन्तयित्वा तु निःश्वस्य च पुनः पुनः । जगाम वेगेन तदा वसिष्ठं परमौजसं ।।
निर्धूय तांस्तदा भृत्याञ्शतशः शत्रुसूदन । जगामानिलवेगेन पादमूलं महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "O Destroyer of enemies thus thinking and repeatedly sighing, that cow shook off those attendants who were in hundreds and ran towards the feet of the illustrious Vasishta with the speed of the wind.

data.v: शबला सा रुदन्ती च क्रोशन्ती चेदमब्रवीत् । वसिष्ठस्याग्रतः स्थित्वा मेघदुन्दुभिराविणी ।।
data.es: Lowing and moaning, standing before Vasishta, roaring like thunder and of kettledrum, Sabala said:

data.v: भगवन्किं परित्यक्ता त्वयाहं ब्रह्मणः सुत । यस्माद्राजभृता मां हि नयन्ते त्वत्सकाशतः ।।
data.es: "O Brahma's son O Venerable one you have abandoned me? For what reason the servants of the king are taking me away from you"?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु ब्रह्मर्षिरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् । शोकसंतप्तहृदयां स्वसारमिव दुःखिताम् ।।
data.es: Addressed thus, Bramharshi said to Sabala, like to a sister whose heart is afflicted with sorrow:

data.v: न त्वां त्यजामि शबले नापि मेऽपकृतं त्वया । एष त्वां नयते राजा बलान्मत्तो महाबलः ।।
data.es: "O Sabala I am not forsaking you. You have done me no harm. This highly powerful king is forcibly carrying you away from me.

data.v: न हि तुल्यं बलं मह्यं राजा त्वद्य विशेषतः । बली राजा क्षत्रियश्च पृथिव्याः पतिरेव च ।।
data.es: I am no match for his strength, especially he is a king. Being king, he is a warrior, powerful and lord of the earth.

data.es: All the devatas, with Agni in the forefront, divine rishis, great uragas and gandharvas were agitated seeing the Brahmastra raised. When Brahmastra was discharged, the three worlds became distressed.

data.v: तदप्यस्त्रं महाघोरं ब्राह्मं ब्राह्मेण तेजसा । वसिष्ठो ग्रसते सर्वं ब्रह्मदण्डेन राघव ।।
data.es: O Descendant of Raghu Vasishta who possessed the energy of Brahma swallowed that very dreadful Brahmastra entirely with the help of Brahmadanda.

data.v: ब्रह्मास्त्रं ग्रसमानस्य वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः । त्रैलोक्यमोहनं रौद्रं रूपमासीत्सुदारुणम् ।।
data.es: While swallowing Brahmastra the great Vasishta looked fierce and terrible causing the three worlds to faint.

data.v: रोमकूपेषु सर्वेषु वसिष्ठस्य महात्मनः । मरीच्य इव निष्पेतुरग्नेर्धूमाकुलार्चिषः ।।
data.es: From every pore of the great Vasishta's body flames resembling rays of light with smoke emerged.

data.v: प्राज्वलद्ब्रह्मदण्डश्च वसिष्ठस्य करोद्यतः । विधूम इव कालाग्निर्यमदण्ड इवापरः ।।
data.es: The staff of Brahma in Vasishta's hand, resembling smokeless fire at the end of the dissolution of the worlds inflamed like another rod of death.

data.v: ततोऽस्तुवन्मुनिगणा वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम् । अमोघं ते बलं ब्रह्मंस्तेजो धारय तेजसा ।।
data.es: Then hosts of saints praised Vasishta, the best among sages, saying "O Brahmin, your energy is infallible, hold your energy by your enegy".

data.v: निगृहीतस्त्वया ब्रह्मन्विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । प्रसीद जपतां श्रेष्ठ लोकाः सन्तु गतव्यथाः ।।
data.es: 'O Brahman great ascetic Viswamitra was controlled by you. O Best of ascetics be pleased and let the worlds be delivered from distress'.

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजाः शमं चक्रे महातपाः । विश्वामित्रोऽपि निकृतो विनिःश्वस्येदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The infuriated Vasishta who was highly brilliant, foremost among those who meditate said to Viswamitra:

data.v: धिग्बलं क्षत्रियबलं ब्रह्मतेजोबलं बलम् । एकेन ब्रह्मदण्डेन सर्वास्त्राणि हतानि मे ।।
data.es: Shame Where is the might of a kshatriya? The energy of a brahmin is the real energy. The staff of Brahma has singly destroyed all my weapons".

data.v: तदेतत्समवेक्ष्याहं प्रसन्नेन्द्रियमानसः । तपो महत्समास्थास्ये यद्वै ब्रह्मत्वकारकम् ।।
data.es: "Now I have realised the reason. With clear mind and senses, I shall undertake intense penance which will earn me brahminhood".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततः संतप्तहृदयः स्मरन्निग्रहमात्मनः । विनिःश्वस्य विनिःश्वस्य कृतवैरो महात्मना ।।
स दक्षिणां दिशं गत्वा महिष्या सह राघव । तताप परमं घोरं विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । फलमूलाशनो दान्तश्चचार परमं तपः ।।
अथास्य जज्ञिरे पुत्राः सत्यधर्मपरायणाः । हविष्पन्दो मधुष्पन्दो दृढनेत्रो महारथः ।।
data.es: After some time, four sons, Havishyanda, Madhushyanda, Drudhanetra and Maharatha, who (later) wer wedded to truth and duty, were born."

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु ब्रह्मा लोकपितामहः । अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ।।
data.es: A thousand years passed. The Grandsire of the worlds, Brahma, appeared. He spoke to Viswamitra, the great ascetic, these pleasant words:

data.v: जिता राजर्षिलोकास्ते तपसा कुशिकात्मज । अनेन तपसा त्वां हि राजर्षिरिति विद्महे ।।
data.es: "O Son of Kushika with your austerities you have won the worlds of the rajarshis. On account of your austerities, you are acknowledged a rajarshi".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा जगाम सह दैवतैः । त्रिविष्टपं ब्रह्मलोकं लोकानां परमेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Having said this the glorious (Brahma), supreme lord of the worlds, left for his abode in Brahmaloka, in heaven accompanied by the gods.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि तच्छ्रुत्वा ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखः । दुःखेन महताविष्टः समन्युरिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing this Viswamitra hanging down his face a little with shame and anger and grief said:

data.v: तपश्च सुमहत्तप्तं राजर्षिरिति मां विदुः । देवाः सर्षिगणाः सर्वे नास्ति मन्ये तपःफलम् ।।
data.es: "I have performed intense austerities. Yet rishis and devatas have recognised me only as a rajarshi. I think my penance has yielded fruit.

data.v: एवं निश्चित्य मनसा भूय एव महातपाः । तपश्चचार काकुत्स्थ परमं परमात्मवान् ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) this celebrated intellectual having decided in his mind once again performed greater austerities.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु सत्यवादी जितेन्द्रियः । त्रिशङ्कुरिति विख्यात इक्ष्वाकु कुलनन्दनः ।।
data.es: At this time there lived a celebrated king, renowned in the Ikshvakus race, named Trisanku, who was truthful and self restrained.

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिः समुत्पन्ना यजेयमिति राघव । गच्छेयं स्वशरीरेण देवानां परमां गतिम् ।।
data.es: "O Son of the Raghus (Rama) a thought arose in his mind to enter heaven with his physical body by performing a sacrifice.

data.v: स वसिष्ठं समाहूय कथयामास चिन्तितम् । अशक्यमिति चाप्युक्तो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना ।।
data.es: Summoning Vasishta he (Trisahnku) communicated his intention, but the great Vasishta said it was not possible.

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातो वसिष्ठेन स ययौ दक्षिणां दिशम् । वसिष्ठा दीर्घ तपसस्तपो यत्र हि तेपिरे ।।
data.es: Refused by Vasishta, the king went south in order to fulfil his purpose and approached Vasishta's sons.

data.v: त्रिशङ्कुः सुमहातेजाः शतं परमभास्वरम् । वसिष्ठपुत्रान्ददृशे तप्यमानान्यशस्विनः ।।
data.es: Most brilliant Trisanku approached the sons of Vasishta in the place where they had been performing austerities for a long time. There he saw the famous, exceedingly effulgent sons of Vasishta one hundred in number practising penance.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानः सर्वानेव गुरोः सुतान् । अभिवाद्यानुपूर्व्येण ह्रिया किंचिदवाङ्मुखः । अब्रवीत्सुमहातेजाः सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: The king, having approached all the illustrious sons of his spiritual guide, paid obeisance to them in order of seniority. Bowing down his face in humility and with folded palms, he addressed all those distinguished sons of Vasishta saying:

data.v: शरणं वः प्रपद्येऽहं शरण्याञ्शरणागतः । प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि भद्रं वो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना ।।
data.es: O protectors of those who seek refuge in you, protect me. Wish you well. I have been refused by the great Vasishta.

data.v: यष्टुकामो महायज्ञं तदनुज्ञातुमर्थथ । गुरुपुत्रानहं सर्वान्नमस्कृत्य प्रसादये ।।
data.es: 'I wish to perform a great sacrifice. You are worthy enough to tender your consent. I pay homage to all the sons of my spiritual guide oblige.

data.v: शिरसा प्रणतो याचे ब्राह्मणांस्तपसि स्थितान् । ते मां भवन्तः सिद्ध्यर्थं याजयन्तु समाहिताः । सशरीरो यथाहं हि देवलोकमवाप्नुयाम् ।।
data.es: You, brahmins are established in austerity. I bow to you. I beg all of you to direct me with composed minds to direct me in order to attain heaven in physical form'.

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातो वसिष्ठेन गतिमन्यां तपोधनाः । गुरुपुत्रानृते सर्वान्नाहं पश्यामि कांचन ।।
data.es: O Ascetocs after having been rejected by Vasishta. I do not see any way other than the sons of my spiritual guide to help me achieve my purpose.

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधाः परमा गतिः । तस्मादनन्तरं सर्वे भवन्तो दैवतं मम ।।
data.es: For all the descendants of Ikshvakus the spiritual preceptor is the supreme resort for salvation. Learned spiritual preceptors have always liberated kings. Hence you are all gods to me only next to Vasishta".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततस्त्रिशङ्कोर्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधसमन्वितम् । ऋषिपुत्रशतं राम राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "O Rama to these words of king Trisanku, the hundred sons of the sage angrily reacted:

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽसि दुर्बुद्धे गुरुणा सत्यवादिना । तं कथं समतिक्रम्य शाखान्तरमुपेयिवान् ।।
data.es: 'O Evilminded one having been refused by the Guru true to his word, how could you bypass him and approach us who are mere off shoots (of the main).

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधाः परमा गतिः । न चातिक्रमितुं शक्यं वचनं सत्यवादिनः ।।
data.es: For all the kings of the Ikshvakus race, their chief priest is their Guru. It is not possible to bypass the spiritual preceptor who is true to his word preceptor.

data.v: अशक्यमिति चोवाच वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः । तं वयं वै समाहर्तुं क्रतुं शक्ताः कथं तव ।।
data.es: When an adorable sage like Vasishta has already said, it is not possible, how can we help you conduct such a sacrifice?

data.v: बालिशस्त्वं नरश्रेष्ठ गम्यतां स्वपुरं पुनः । याजने भगवाञ्शक्तस्त्रैलोक्यस्यापि पार्थिव ।।
data.es: O Best one among men you are childish. Return to your capital. O Monarch the most venerable Vasishta is capable of conducting sacrifices performed by anybody in the three worlds. How can we dishonour him'?

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् । स राजा पुनरेवैतानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the confused words uttered by the sages in a state of anger, the king said again:

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च । अन्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु तपोधनाः ।।
data.es: "O Men endowed with the wealth of asceticism I was rejected by my guru and now by his sons. I shall seek another way. Farewell to you".

data.v: ऋषिपुत्रास्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा वाक्यं घोराभिसंहितम् । शेपुः परमसंक्रुद्धाश्चण्डालत्वं गमिष्यसि । एवमुक्त्वा महात्मानो विविशुस्ते स्वमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Having seen his fierce intent, the saint's sons were infuriated. They cursed him saying, "Be a Chandala"

data.v: अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां राजा चण्डालतां गतः । नीलवस्त्रधरो नीलः परुषो ध्वस्तमूर्धजः । चित्यमाल्यानुलेपश्च आयसाभरणोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: The king was tranformed into a darkcomplexioned dirty man with dishevelled hair. His body was besmeared with ashes and on his robes lay wreath collected from the cemetery. He had on him dark (soiled) clothes, and ornaments made of iron.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा मन्त्रिणः सर्वे त्यक्त्वा चण्डालरूपिणम् । प्राद्रवन्सहिता राम पौरा येऽस्यानुगामिनः ।।
data.es: "O Rama seeing him in the form of a chandala, all his counsellors, inhabitants of the city including his followers fled away.

data.v: एको हि राजा काकुत्स्थ जगाम परमात्मवान् । दह्यमानो दिवारात्रं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ।।
data.es: O Descendant of Kakustha wandering alone burning with distress night and day the king went to Viswamitra who was rich in asceticism.

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा राजानं विफलीकृतम् । चण्डालरूपिणं राम मुनिः कारुण्यमागतः ।।
data.es: O Rama on seeing the king reduced to a useless a chandala, sage Viswamitra was touched with pity".

data.v: कारुण्यात्स महातेजा वाक्यं परम धार्मिकः । इदं जगाद भद्रं ते राजानं घोरदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: Exceedingly energetic and deeply pious, he looked at the king who was frightful in appearance and addressed him with compassion saying, "welfare to you".

data.v: किमागमनकार्यं ते राजपुत्र महाबल । अयोध्याधिपते वीर शापाच्चण्डालतां गतः ।।
data.es: "O Mighty prince what brings your here, for you are the heroic lord of Ayodhya? Whose curse turned you into a chandala"?

data.v: अथ तद्वाक्यमाकर्ण्य राजा चण्डालतां गतः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् ।।
data.es: In response to his words the king, who had fallen into the state of a chandala yet proficient in expression, spoke to one (Viswamitra) expert in speech, with folded hands.

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च । अनवाप्यैव तं कामं मया प्राप्तो विपर्ययः ।।
data.es: "O Men endowed with the wealth of asceticism I was rejected by my guru and now by his sons. I shall seek another way. Farewell to you".

data.v: सशरीरो दिवं यायामिति मे सौम्यदर्शनम् । मया चेष्टं क्रतुशतं तच्च नावाप्यते फलम् ।।
data.es: O Gentle sage it is my intention to enter heaven with my physical body. I performed a hundred sacrifices but did not reap its fruit.

data.v: अनृतं नोक्त पूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन । कृच्छ्रेष्वपि गतः सौम्य क्षत्रधर्मेण ते शपे ।।
data.es: O Gentle sage I have never told a lie in spite of troubled circumstances, I shall never dabble in falsehood. I swear upon it by kshatriya morality .

data.v: यज्ञैर्बहुविधैरिष्टं प्रजा धर्मेण पालिताः । गुरवश्च महात्मानः शीलवृत्तेन तोषिताः ।।
data.es: I have performed various sacirifices and ruled over my people guided by the law of righteousness. I have pleased eminent elders with my conduct and character.

data.v: धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य यज्ञं चाहर्तुमिच्छतः । परितोषं न गच्छन्ति गुरवो मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: O Preeminent among sages I endeavour to do my duty. I intend to perform a sacrifice. My gurus do not appreciate this.

data.v: दैवमेव परं मन्ये पौरुषं तु निरर्थकम् । दैवेनाक्रम्यते सर्वं दैवं हि परमा गतिः ।।
data.es: I consider destiny to be allpowerful. The effort of a man goes in vain. Everything is controlled by destiny. It is the supreme resort.

data.v: तस्य मे परमार्तस्य प्रसादमभिकाङ्क्षतः । कर्तुमर्हसि भद्रं ते दैवोपहतकर्मणः ।।
data.es: My merits have been destroyed by destiny. Deeply afflicted, I crave a favour from you. You are fit to grant it. Wish you well

data.v: नान्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि नान्यः शरणमस्ति मे । दैवं पुरुषकारेण निवर्तयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: I will not take refuge in anybody. There is no other protector for me. You are capable of averting my reverses in fate with human effort". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: उक्तवाक्यं तु राजानं कृपया कुशिकात्मजः । अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं साक्षाच्चण्डालरूपिणम् ।।
data.es: What the king said was proved by his chandala form which the son of Kushika (Viswamitra) heard and out of compassion spoke these sweet words:

data.v: इक्ष्वाको स्वागतं वत्स जानामि त्वां सुधार्मिकम् । शरणं ते भविष्यामि मा भैषीर्नृपपुंगव ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Ikshvakus, O child, welcome. I know you as highly righteous. O eminent among kings fear not. I offer you refuge.

data.v: अहमामन्त्रये सर्वान्महर्षीन्पुण्यकर्मणः । यज्ञसाह्यकरान्राजंस्ततो यक्ष्यसि निर्वृतः ।।
data.es: O king I shall invite pious maharshis to assist you in the sacrifice which you will be able to perform with great relief.

data.v: गुरुशापकृतं रूपं यदिदं त्वयि वर्तते । अनेन सह रूपेण सशरीरो गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: With the present physical body disfigured by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, you shall go to heaven.

data.v: हस्तप्राप्तमहं मन्ये स्वर्गं तव नरेश्वर । यस्त्वं कौशिकमागम्य शरण्यं शरणं गतः ।।
data.es: O King since you have taken refuge in Viswamitra who is the protector of those who resort to him, I think heaven is already within your reach".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः पुत्रान्परमधार्मिकान् । व्यादिदेश महाप्राज्ञान्यज्ञसंभारकारणात् ।।
data.es: Most brilliant Viswamitra having thus spoken, ordered his deeply religious and highly learned sons to make preparations for the sacrifice.

data.v: सर्वाञ्शिष्यान्समाहूय वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
सर्वानृषिवरान्वत्सा आनयध्वं ममाज्ञया । सशिष्यान्सुहृदश्चैव सर्त्विजः सुबहुश्रुतान् ।।
data.es: He summoned all his disciples, and said, "Children bring here hosts of rishis along with their disciples and friends, officiating priests and persons wellversed in the Srutis. This is my order.

data.v: यदन्यो वचनं ब्रूयान्मद्वाक्यबलचोदितः । तत्सर्वमखिलेनोक्तं ममाख्येयमनादृतम् ।।
data.es: If any one should speak with disrespect in response to my order, you may report the matter to me in full".

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिशो जग्मुस्तदाज्ञया । आजग्मुरथ देशेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यो ब्रह्मवादिनः ।।
data.es: At his command the disciples set out in different directions. And as a result, expounders of the vedas began arriving from various countries.

data.v: ते च शिष्याः समागम्य मुनिं ज्वलिततेजसम् । ऊचुश्च वचनं सर्वे सर्वेषां ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ।।
data.es: All the disciples on their return, communicated to the sage shining in splendour what the expounders of the vedas had said.

data.v: श्रुत्वा ते वचनं सर्वे समायान्ति द्विजातयः । सर्वदेशेषु चागच्छन्वर्जयित्वा महोदयम् ।।
data.es: Having heard your words, all brahmins except Mahodaya have arrived from all countries.

data.v: वासिष्ठं तच्छतं सर्वं क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् । यदाह वचनं सर्वं शृणु त्वं मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: O Preeminent among ascetics Here is what the hundred sons of Vasishta spoke in anger.

data.v: क्षत्रियो याजको यस्य चण्डालस्य विशेषतः । कथं सदसि भोक्तारो हविस्तस्य सुरर्षयः ।।
data.es: When a kshatriya acts as a priest for the sacrifice, particularly for a chandala, how can gods and sages partake the offerings?

data.v: ब्राह्मणा वा महात्मानो भुक्त्वा चण्डालभोजनम् । कथं स्वर्गं गमिष्यन्ति विश्वामित्रेण पालिताः ।।
data.es: Joining Viswamitra, (in chanting the mantras during the yaga) how will the great brahmins attain heaven after partaking the food offered by of Chandala?

data.v: एतद्वचनं नैष्ठुर्यमूचुः संरक्तलोचनाः । वासिष्ठा मुनिशार्दूल सर्वे ते समहोदयाः ।।
data.es: O Best among ascetics all the sons of Vasishta along with Mahodaya with their eyes reddened in anger spoke these harsh words":

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां मुनिपुंगवः । क्रोधसंरक्तनयनः सरोषमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the confused words uttered by the sages in a state of anger, the king said again:

data.v: यद्दूषयन्त्यदुष्टं मां तप उग्रं समास्थितम् । भस्मीभूता दुरात्मानो भविष्यन्ति न संशयः ।।
data.es: "I am blameless. I have practised rigorous penance. These wicked ones who have abused (a sage like me) will be reduced to ashes.

data.v: अद्य ते कालपाशेन नीता वैवस्वतक्षयम् । सप्तजातिशतान्येव मृतपाः सन्तु सर्वशः ।।
data.es: Caught by the noose of death this day, they shall be brought to the abode of Yama and for seven hundred births, feed on corpses.

data.v: श्वमांसनियताहारा मुष्टिका नाम निर्घृणाः । विकृताश्च विरूपाश्च लोकाननुचरन्त्विमान् ।।
data.es: Reborn as the merciless race of mushtikas, feeding on the flesh of dogs, hideous and deformed, they shall wander in these worlds.

data.v: महोदयश्च दुर्बुद्धिर्मामदूष्यं ह्यदूषयत् । दूषिटः सर्वलोकेषु निषादत्वं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: The wicked Mahodaya, who blamed a sage like me so faultless shall be reborn in the race of the nishadas vulnerable to abuse by all.

data.v: प्राणातिपातनिरतो निरनुक्रोशतां गतः । दीर्घकालं मम क्रोधाद्दुर्गतिं वर्तयिष्यति ।।
data.es: As a consequence of my anger that Mahodaya, devoid of mercy and taking pleasure in depriving others of their life, will pursue a wretched life for a long time".

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । विरराम महातेजा ऋषिमध्ये महामुनिः ।।
data.es: The most powerful sage Viswamitra of fierce asceticism fell silent after after uttering this curse in the assembly of rishis.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तपोबलहतान्कृत्वा वासिष्ठान्समहोदयान् । ऋषिमध्ये महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.es: The most brilliant Viswamitra, having destroyed the sons of Vasishta including Mahodaya by his ascetic power, said this in the midst of saints:

data.v: अयमिक्ष्वाकुदायादस्त्रिशङ्कुरिति विश्रुतः । धर्मिष्ठश्च वदान्यश्च मां चैव शरणं गतः । स्वेनानेन शरीरेण देवलोकजिगीषया ।।
data.es: "This religious and generous king born in the Ikshvaku race, wellknown as Trisanku sought my refuge to gain heaven with his physical body,

data.v: यथायं स्वशरीरेण देवलोकं गमिष्यति । तथा प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञो भवद्भिश्च मया सह ।।
data.es: Join me in the performance of this sacrifice in a manner by which he (Trisanku) attains heaven with his physical body".

data.v: विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा सर्व एव महर्षयः । ऊचुः समेत्य सहिता धर्मज्ञा धर्मसंहितम् ।।
data.es: Agreeing to these words of Viswamitra all the rishis, knowers of spiritual order and endowed with righteousness assembled there said:

data.v: अयं कुशिकदायादो मुनिः परमकोपनः । यदाह वचनं सम्यगेतत्कार्यं न संशयः ।।
data.es: "Born in the line of Kusika, this sage is extremely cholerictempered. Whatever he says must be properly carried out. There should be no resitation on this score. The venerable sage is like fire. He will curse us if angered.

data.v: अग्निकल्पो हि भगवाञ्शापं दास्यति रोषितः । तस्मात्प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञः सशरीरो यथा दिवम् । गच्छेदिक्ष्वाकुदायादो विश्वामित्रस्य तेजसा ।।
data.es: Hence let the sacrifice be performed in such a manner that the descendant of the Ikshvakus would attain heaven with his physical body through the spiritual power of Viswamitra. All of you commence the sacrifice".

data.v: ततः प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञः सर्वे समधितिष्ठते ।।
एवमुक्त्वा महर्षयः संजह्रुस्ताः क्रियास्तदा । याजकाश्च महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभवत्क्रतौ ।।
data.es: The maharshis having resolved performed their respective activities relating to the sacrifice. The brilliant Viswamitra acted as the chief officiating priest.

data.v: ऋत्विजश्चानुपूर्व्येण मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रकोविदाः । चक्रुः सर्वाणि कर्माणि यथाकल्पं यथाविधि ।।
data.es: The officiating priests proficient in chanting mantras performed in order of their respective ranks all the rites in accordance with the Yojanakalpa adhering to codes and traditions.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । चकारावाहनं तत्र भागार्थं सर्वदेवताः ।।
data.es: Long after, the mighty ascetic Viswamitra invoked all the gods to partake their share of offerings.

data.v: नाह्यागमंस्तदाहूता भागार्थं सर्वदेवताः । ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टो विश्वमित्रो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: When, the gods invited by him did not come to receive their share of offerings, the great ascetic Viswamitra seized with anger lifted the sacrificial ladle and said to Trisanku:

data.v: स्रुवमुद्यम्य सक्रोधस्त्रिशङ्कुमिदमब्रवीत् । पश्य मे तपसो वीर्यं स्वार्जितस्य नरेश्वर ।।
एष त्वां स्वशरीरेण नयामि स्वर्गमोजसा । दुष्प्रापं स्वशरीरेण दिवं गच्छ नराधिप ।।
data.es: "O King behold the prowess of my selfearned asceticism. With my spiritual might, I shall send you to heaven with your physical body O King go to heaven with physical body which is not possible for anybody to accomplish.

data.v: स्वार्जितं किंचिदप्यस्ति मया हि तपसः फलम् । राजंस्त्वं तेजसा तस्य सशरीरो दिवं व्रज ।।
data.es: By the power of what little fruit of austerities I have earned, I shall send to heaven with your body".

data.v: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्सशरीरो नरेश्वरः । दिवं जगाम काकुत्स्थ मुनीनां पश्यतां तदा ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) when the sage had said these words, the king with his physical body ascended to heaven in the presence of the sages.

data.v: देवलोकगतं दृष्ट्वा त्रिशङ्कुं पाकशासनः । सह सर्वैः सुरगणैरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On ascending to heaven Trisanku saw Indra (destroyer of Paka) along with hosts of gods. Indra said to him:

data.v: त्रिशङ्को गच्छ भूयस्त्वं नासि स्वर्गकृतालयः । गुरुशापहतो मूढ पत भूमिमवाक्शिराः ।।
data.es: "O Trisanku you are not fit to inhabit heaven. Go back, you fool Doomed by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, fall on earth, head down.

data.v: एवमुक्तो महेन्द्रेण त्रिशङ्कुरपतत्पुनः । विक्रोशमानस्त्राहीति विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ।।
data.es: Thus spoken to by Indra, Trisanku crying, "O Viswamitra, Protect me, Protect me" started falling down.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य क्रोशमानस्य कौशिकः । रोषमाहारयत्तीव्रं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the wailing Trisanku, the enraged Viswamitra shouted, "Stay, Stay".

data.v: ऋषिमध्ये स तेजस्वी प्रजापतिरिवापरः । सृजन्दक्षिणमार्गस्थान्सप्तर्षीनपरान्पुनः ।।
data.es: Standing in the midst of the ascetics, that mighty sage who conjured up a constellation of seven new rishis (stars) looked like another creator Brahma. Overcome by anger the illustrious sage created a new group of stars in the southern direction.

data.v: नक्षत्रमालामपरामसृजत्क्रोधमूर्छितः । दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय मुनिमध्ये महायशाः ।।
data.es: Standing in the midst of the ascetics, that mighty sage who conjured up a constellation of seven new rishis (stars) looked like another creator Brahma. Overcome by anger the illustrious sage created a new group of stars in the southern direction.

data.v: सृष्ट्वा नक्षत्रवंशं च क्रोधेन कलुषीकृतः । अन्यमिन्द्रं करिष्यामि लोको वा स्यादनिन्द्रकः । दैवतान्यपि स क्रोधात्स्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Having created a constellation of stars, Viswamitra out of anger said, "I will create another Indra or this world will be without Indra" and commenced to create even gods.

data.v: ततः परमसंभ्रान्ताः सर्षिसंघाः सुरर्षभाः । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानमूचुः सानुनयं वचः ।।
data.es: Struck with wonder and fear, hosts of rishis, suras and asuras humbly addressed Viswamitra.

data.v: अयं राजा महाभाग गुरुशापपरिक्षतः । सशरीरो दिवं यातुं नार्हत्येव तपोधन ।।
data.es: "O Glorious maharshi, this king cursed by his spiritual preceptor is not worthy of going to heaven with his physical body".

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा देवानां मुनिपुंगवः । अब्रवीत्सुमहद्वाक्यं कौशिकः सर्वदेवताः ।।
data.es: "O Rama incensed to fury at the words of his sons, magnanimous king Sagara replied":

data.v: सशरीरस्य भद्रं वस्त्रिशङ्कोरस्य भूपतेः । आरोहणं प्रतिज्ञाय नानृतं कर्तुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: "I wish you well Having promised king Trisanku ascent to heaven with his physical form, I do not wish to go back on my word.

data.v: सर्गोऽस्तु सशरीरस्य त्रिशङ्कोरस्य शाश्वतः । नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि मामकानि ध्रुवाण्यथ ।।
data.es: Let this heaven be an eternal abode for Trisanku in his physical form All these stars created by me shall endure as long as the worlds survive. O gods it behoves of you to accord consent to this".

data.v: यावल्लोका धरिष्यन्ति तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वशः । मत्कृतानि सुराः सर्वे तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ।।
data.es: Let this heaven be an eternal abode for Trisanku in his physical form All these stars created by me shall endure as long as the worlds survive. O gods it behoves of you to accord consent to this".

data.v: एवमुक्ताः सुराः सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
एवं भवतु भद्रं ते तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वशः । गगने तान्यनेकानि वैश्वानरपथाद्बहिः ।।
नक्षत्राणि मुनिश्रेष्ठ तेषु ज्योतिःषु जाज्वलन् । अवाक्शिरास्त्रिशङ्कुश्च तिष्ठत्वमरसंनिभः ।।
विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा सर्वदेवैरभिष्टुतः । ऋषिभिश्च महातेजा बाढमित्याह देवताः ।।
data.es: In this manner extolled by all devatas and rishis, mighty and righteous Viswamitra said, 'well let it be so'.

data.v: ततो देवा महात्मानो मुनयश्च तपोधनाः । जग्मुर्यथागतं सर्वे यज्ञस्यान्ते नरोत्तम ।।
data.es: "O Best among men (Rama) then at the conclusion of the sacrifice the great gods and saints went the way they had come".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: विश्वामित्रो महात्माथ प्रस्थितान्प्रेक्ष्य तानृषीन् । अब्रवीन्नरशार्दूल सर्वांस्तान्वनवासिनः ।।
data.es: O Tiger among men (Rama) thereafter great Viswamitra seeing the departing sages of the forest said:

data.v: महाविघ्नः प्रवृत्तोऽयं दक्षिणामास्थितो दिशम् । दिशमन्यां प्रपत्स्यामस्तत्र तप्स्यामहे तपः ।।
पश्चिमायां विशालायां पुष्करेषु महात्मनः । सुखं तपश्चरिष्यामः परं तद्धि तपोवनम् ।।
data.es: "O Highsouled sages, there is lake Pushkara in the vast western region. There in the forest fit for austerities we shall practise penance peacefully".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः पुष्करेषु महामुनिः । तप उग्रं दुराधर्षं तेपे मूलफलाशनः ।।
data.es: With this the most powerful sage Viswamitra reached Pushkara where living on fruits and roots, he carried out intense, unsurpassable, austerities.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु अयोध्याधिपतिर्नृपः । अम्बरीष इति ख्यातो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: At this time Ambarisha, a wellknown king of Ayodhya, launched preparations for a sacrifice.

data.v: तस्य वै यजमानस्य पशुमिन्द्रो जहार ह । प्रनष्टे तु पशौ विप्रो राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While he was performing the sacrifice Indra stole away the sacrificial animal. The animal could not be traced. Hence the priest said to the king:

data.v: पशुरद्य हृतो राजन्प्रनष्टस्तव दुर्नयात् । अरक्षितारं राजानं घ्नन्ति दोषा नरेश्वर ।।
data.es: "O King the animal has been stolen away and because of your inability to enforce law, it could not be traced. O Lord of men the king who fails to protect (his dependents) perishes by his own faults.

data.v: प्रायश्चित्तं महद्ध्येतन्नरं वा पुरुषर्षभ । आनयस्व पशुं शीघ्रं यावत्कर्म प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: "O Best of men you must pay a big price for this. Bring either the beast or a man immediately so that the sacrifice can be completed".

data.v: उपाध्याय वचः श्रुत्वा स राजा पुरुषर्षभ । अन्वियेष महाबुद्धिः पशुं गोभिः सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: "O Best of men (Rama) hearing the words of the high priest, the highly intellectual king searched for a human victim in exchange for thousands of cows.

data.v: देशाञ्जनपदांस्तांस्तान्नगराणि वनानि च । आश्रमाणि च पुण्यानि मार्गमाणो महीपतिः ।।
data.es: O Dear Rama, the delight of Raghu clan the king scoured countries, villages, cities, forests, sacred hermitages till he saw sage Richika in the Bhrigutunda mountain sitting with his sons and wie.

data.v: स पुत्रसहितं तात सभार्यं रघुनन्दन । भृगुतुङ्गे समासीनमृचीकं संददर्श ह ।।
data.es: O Dear Rama, the delight of Raghu clan the king scoured countries, villages, cities, forests, sacred hermitages till he saw sage Richika in the Bhrigutunda mountain sitting with his sons and wie.

data.v: तमुवाच महातेजाः प्रणम्याभिप्रसाद्य च । ब्रह्मर्षिं तपसा दीप्तं राजर्षिरमितप्रभः । पृष्ट्वा सर्वत्र कुशलमृचीकं तमिदं वचः ।।
data.es: The most brilliant king(Ambarisha) bowing to sage Richika, a brahmarshi who looked extremely resplendent with penance, propitiated him, enquired about the welfare of all and finally said":

data.v: गवां शतसहस्रेण विक्रिणीषे सुतं यदि । पशोरर्थे महाभाग कृतकृत्योऽस्मि भार्गव ।।
data.es: "O Fortunate descendent of the Bhrigu race if your son is sold as a sacrificial animal in exchange for a hundred thousand cows, my purpose will be answered.

data.v: सर्वे परिसृता देशा यज्ञियं न लभे पशुम् । दातुमर्हसि मूल्येन सुतमेकमितो मम ।।
data.es: I have roamed all countries but could not final the sacrificial animal. Should'nt you spare one of your sons for a price"?

data.v: एवमुक्तो महातेजा ऋचीकस्त्वब्रवीद्वचः । नाहं ज्येष्ठं नरश्रेष्ठं विक्रीणीयां कथंचन ।।
data.es: Thus addressed the exceedingly brilliant Richika said, "O Best among men in no way shall I sell my first born".

data.v: ऋचीकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा तेषां माता महात्मनाम् । उवाच नरशार्दूलमम्बरीषं तपस्विनी ।।
data.es: Having heard Richika, the miserable mother of great sons, addressed Ambarisha, the foremost of men, saying:

data.v: ममापि दयितं विद्धि कनिष्ठं शुनकं नृप ।।
प्रायेण हि नरश्रेष्ठ ज्येष्ठाः पितृषु वल्लभाः । मातॄणां च कनीयांसस्तस्माद्रक्षे कनीयसम् ।।
data.es: "O Best among men generally, the eldest sons are the favourites of their fathers, the youngest their mothers: For that reason, I shall keep my youngest son.

data.v: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्मुनिपत्न्यां तथैव च । शुनःशेपः स्वयं राम मध्यमो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: O Rama the sage and his wife having spoken thus, their middle son Sunassepha said on his own:

data.v: पिता ज्येष्ठमविक्रेयं माता चाह कनीयसम् । विक्रीतं मध्यमं मन्ये राजन्पुत्रं नयस्व माम् ।।
data.es: O King my father says his eldest son cannot be sold, mother says that her youngest son cannot be spared. From this I think middle son is already sold away. Therefore, take me"

data.v: गवां शतसहस्रेण शुनःशेपं नरेश्वरः । गृहीत्वा परमप्रीतो जगाम रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: "O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) having purchased Sunassepha for a hundred thousands of cows the king refurned immensely pleased.

data.v: अम्बरीषस्तु राजर्षी रथमारोप्य सत्वरः । शुनःशेपं महातेजा जगामाशु महायशाः ।।
शुनःशेपं नरश्रेष्ठ गृहीत्वा तु महायशाः । व्यश्राम्यत्पुष्करे राजा मध्याह्ने रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O Foremost of men, O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) the illustrious king (Ambarisha) took Sunassepha with him. (On the way) at Pushkara he took some rest at noon.

data.v: तस्य विश्रममाणस्य शुनःशेपो महायशाः । पुष्करं श्रेष्ठमागम्य विश्वामित्रं ददर्श ह ।।
data.es: While the king was resting at Pushkara, the famous Sunassepha, very much distressed, happened to see his maternal uncle Viswamitra in the company of other sages performing austerities.

data.v: विषण्णवदनो दीनस्तृष्णया च श्रमेण च । पपाताङ्के मुने राम वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: With his face discoloured due to thirst and fatigue, he (Sunassepha) immediately fell into the sage's lap in a pitiable condition and said:

data.v: न मेऽस्ति माता न पिता ज्ञातयो बान्धवाः कुतः । त्रातुमर्हसि मां सौम्य धर्मेण मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: "O Noble man O Preeminent among ascetics I have no mother nor father nor friends nor relatives. You should protect me according to dharma.

data.v: त्राता त्वं हि मुनिश्रेष्ठ सर्वेषां त्वं हि भावनः । राजा च कृतकार्यः स्यादहं दीर्घायुरव्ययः ।।
data.es: O Best among ascetics you are the protecor of everybody. You are promoter of others' welfare. May the king fulfil his purpose. May I live long and become immortal and attain heaven after performing great penance. May I enjoy heaven.

data.v: स्वर्गलोकमुपाश्नीयां तपस्तप्त्वा ह्यनुत्तमम् । स मे नाथो ह्यनाथस्य भव भव्येन चेतसा । पितेव पुत्रं धर्मात्मंस्त्रातुमर्हसि किल्बिषात् ।।
data.es: O Virtuous one with a kind heart protect this orphan. Like a father who protects his son, save me from this peril".

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रो महातपाः । सान्त्वयित्वा बहुविधं पुत्रानिदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having heard Sunassepha, mighty ascetic Viswamitra consoled him in many ways and said to his sons:

data.v: यत्कृते पितरः पुत्राञ्जनयन्ति शुभार्थिनः । परलोकहितार्थाय तस्य कालोऽयमागतः ।।
अयं मुनिसुतो बालो मत्तः शरणमिच्छति । अस्य जीवितमात्रेण प्रियं कुरुत पुत्रकाः ।।
data.es: O sons of the sage this young boy has sought my protection. O Sons you may grant him his desire by merely offering your life.

data.v: सर्वे सुकृतकर्माणः सर्वे धर्मपरायणाः । पशुभूता नरेन्द्रस्य तृप्तिमग्नेः प्रयच्छत ।।
data.es: Engaged in the observance of righteousness, all of you have done virtuous deeds. By becoming sacrificial animals for the king, you may satisfy Agni.

data.v: नाथवांश्च शुनःशेपो यज्ञश्चाविघ्नतो भवेत् । देवतास्तर्पिताश्च स्युर्मम चापि कृतं वचः ।।
data.es: Then Sunassepha will be protected. The king's sacrifice will continue without hindrance. The gods will be gratified. My words also will come true".

data.v: मुनेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा मधुष्यन्दादयः सुताः । साभिमानं नरश्रेष्ठ सलीलमिदमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: "O Best of men (Rama) in response to the words of the sage Madhuchanda and others said thus in a casual way with selfesteem.

data.v: कथमात्मसुतान्हित्वा त्रायसेऽन्यसुतं विभो । अकार्यमिव पश्यामः श्वमांसमिव भोजने ।।
data.es: O Lord protecting other's son by abandoning one' own is like partaking the flesh of a dog. We consider it a prohibited act".

data.v: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पुत्राणां मुनिपुंगवः । क्रोधसंरक्तनयनो व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Having listened to the words of the elephant, Anshuman started enquring the well being of each of the guardians (elephants) of the quarters successively with due respect:

data.v: निःसाध्वसमिदं प्रोक्तं धर्मादपि विगर्हितम् । अतिक्रम्य तु मद्वाक्यं दारुणं रोमहर्षणम् ।।
data.es: "(You have) not only trangressed my words but also (you are) censurable according to dharma. You have uttered such audacious and dreadrul words causing the hair to stand on end.

data.v: श्वमांसभोजिनः सर्वे वासिष्ठा इव जातिषु । पूर्णं वर्षसहस्रं तु पृथिव्यामनुवत्स्यथ ।।
data.es: All of you shall live on earth for a thousand years, like the sons of Vasishta feeding on the flesh of dogs".

data.v: कृत्वा शापसमायुक्तान्पुत्रान्मुनिवरस्तदा । शुनःशेपमुवाचार्तं कृत्वा रक्षां निरामयाम् ।।
data.es: Viswamitra the best of ascetics, thus cursed his sons. Sunassepha, (now) was filled with distress. To relieve him of his pain he said:

data.v: पवित्रपाशैरासक्तो रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः । वैष्णवं यूपमासाद्य वाग्भिरग्निमुदाहर ।।
data.es: "Bedaubing your person with red sandal paste and adorned with red garlands, you will be bound to a Vaishnava, sacrificial post with sacred ropes. There invoke Agni with these hymns.

data.v: इमे तु गाथे द्वे दिव्ये गायेथा मुनिपुत्रक । अम्बरीषस्य यज्ञेऽस्मिंस्ततः सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ।।
data.es: O Son of sage chant thse two sacred mantras in the sacrifice of Ambarisha.There after you will achieve success (long life)".

data.v: शुनःशेपो गृहीत्वा ते द्वे गाथे सुसमाहितः । त्वरया राजसिंहं तमम्बरीषमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Sunassepha memorized the two verses with concentration of mind and hastened towards Amabarisha, a lion among kings. And said:

data.v: राजसिंह महासत्त्व शीघ्रं गच्छावहे सदः । निवर्तयस्व राजेन्द्र दीक्षां च समुपाहर ।।
data.es: "Endowed with great strength, you are a lion among kings. We shall go to the sacrificial assembly without delay. O Indra among monarchs, take up initiatory rites and perform the sacrifice".

data.v: तद्वाक्यमृषिपुत्रस्य श्रुत्वा हर्षं समुत्सुकः । जगाम नृपतिः शीघ्रं यज्ञवाटमतन्द्रितः ।।
data.es: At the words of the sage's son, the king, eager with delight hastened towards the sacrificial ground.

data.v: सदस्यानुमते राजा पवित्रकृतलक्षणम् । पशुं रक्ताम्बरं कृत्वा यूपे तं समबन्धयत् ।।
data.es: With the consent of the officiating priests the king invested Sunasepha with the sacred symbols with Kusa grass, dressed him in red apparel and tied him to the sacrificial post as a sacrificial animal.

data.v: स बद्धो वाग्भिरग्र्याभिरभितुष्टाव वै सुरौ । इन्द्रमिन्द्रानुजं चैव यथावन्मुनिपुत्रकः ।।
data.es: Thus bound, the son of the sage praised the two devatas, Indra and Upendra with moving words.

data.v: ततः प्रीतः सहस्राक्षो रहस्यस्तुतितर्पितः । दीर्घमायुस्तदा प्रादाच्छुनःशेपाय राघव ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Raghu (Rama) Indra, gratified with the secret hymn granted Sunassepha long life.

data.v: स च राजा नरश्रेष्ठ यज्ञस्य च समाप्तवान् । फलं बहुगुणं राम सहस्राक्षप्रसादजम् ।।
data.es: O Foremost of men O Rama the king also obtained from the sacrifics innumerable rewards by the grace of Indra several times greater than expected.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि धर्मात्मा भूयस्तेपे महातपाः । पुष्करेषु नरश्रेष्ठ दशवर्षशतानि च ।।
data.es: O Best among men the righteous and mighty ascetic Viswamitra also continued his austerities at Pushkara for a thousand years".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु व्रतस्नातं महामुनिम् । अभ्यागच्छन्सुराः सर्वे तपःफलचिकीर्षवः ।।
data.es: All the gods wanted to bestow the fruits of austerties on the mighty ascetic (Viswamitra). They approached him after a thousand years of penace and his final ritual bath.

data.v: अब्रवीत्सुमहातेजा ब्रह्मा सुरुचिरं वचः । ऋषिस्त्वमसि भद्रं ते स्वार्जितैः कर्मभिः शुभैः ।।
data.es: Exceedingly effulgent Brahma spoke to him, "You have become a rishi through the selfearned sacred deeds. Fare you well".

data.v: तमेवमुक्त्वा देवेशस्त्रिदिवं पुनरभ्यगात् । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा भूयस्तेपे महत्तपः ।।
data.es: Brahma, the lord of the gods, having said this returned to heaven. The brilliant Viswamitra continues his austerities.

data.v: ततः कालेन महता मेनका परमाप्सराः । पुष्करेषु नरश्रेष्ठ स्नातुं समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: "O Foremost of men after a long lapse of time a chief nymph called Menaka came to bathe at Pushkara.

data.v: तां ददर्श महातेजा मेनकां कुशिकात्मजः । रूपेणाप्रतिमां तत्र विद्युतं जलदे यथा ।।
data.es: There the most brilliant son of Kusika Viswamitra saw Menaka whose beauty was incomparable. She looked like lightning in the clouds.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा कन्दर्पवशगो मुनिस्तामिदमब्रवीत् । अप्सरः स्वागतं तेऽस्तु वस चेह ममाश्रमे । अनुगृह्णीष्व भद्रं ते मदनेन सुमोहितम् ।।
data.es: On seeing her (Menaka) Viswamitra came under the influence of the god of love (fell in love with her). He said, O Apsara welcome to my hermitage stay here. I am infatuated with you: Oblige me. Wish you well.

data.v: इत्युक्ता सा वरारोहा तत्रावासमथाकरोत् । तपसो हि महाविघ्नो विश्वामित्रमुपागतः ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Raghu while that woman of an exalted race lived in the hermitage of Viswamitra, ten years rolled by happily".

data.v: तस्यां वसन्त्यां वर्षाणि पञ्च पञ्च च राघव । विश्वामित्राश्रमे सौम्य सुखेन व्यतिचक्रमुः ।।
data.es: "O Descendant of Raghu while that woman of an exalted race lived in the hermitage of Viswamitra, ten years rolled by happily".

data.v: अथ काले गते तस्मिन्विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । सव्रीड इव संवृत्तश्चिन्ताशोकपरायणः ।।
data.es: As the period passed, Viswamitra the mighty ascetic was filled with grief, anxiety and remorse.

data.v: बुद्धिर्मुनेः समुत्पन्ना सामर्षा रघुनन्दन । सर्वं सुराणां कर्मैतत्तपोऽपहरणं महत् ।।
data.es: O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) a sense of indignation filled the mind of the ascetic. 'All this is the conspiracy of the gods to deprive me of my great austerities', he thought.

data.v: अहोरात्रापदेशेन गताः संवत्सरा दश । काममोहाभिभूतस्य विघ्नोऽयं प्रत्युपस्थितः ।।
data.es: Night and day deluded by lust I have wasted ten years. A hindrance has been posed (to my tapas).

data.v: विनिःश्वसन्मुनिवरः पश्चात्तापेन दुःखितः ।।
भीतामप्सरसं दृष्ट्वा वेपन्तीं प्राञ्जलिं स्थिताम् । मेनकां मधुरैर्वाक्यैर्विसृज्य कुशिकात्मजः । उत्तरं पर्वतं राम विश्वामित्रो जगाम ह ।।
data.es: "O Rama Viswamitra, the best of ascetics sighed with repentance, distressed with grief. On seeing him, the apsara started trembling in fear. She stood before him with folded palms. (But) with sweet words the son of Kushika left her and proceeded towards the northern mountains.

data.v: स कृत्वा नैष्ठिकीं बुद्धिं जेतुकामो महायशाः । कौशिकीतीरमासाद्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम् ।।
data.es: Illustrious Viswamitra took a vow of celibacy in order to control his senses. And performed rigid austerities on reaching the bank of river Kausiki.

data.v: तस्य वर्षसहस्रं तु घोरं तप उपासतः । उत्तरे पर्वते राम देवतानामभूद्भयम् ।।
data.es: O Rama while he was performing rigorous penance for a thousand years on the northern mountains, the gods were gripped with fear. (lest he should exceed them).

data.v: अमन्त्रयन्समागम्य सर्वे सर्षिगणाः सुराः । महर्षिशब्दं लभतां साध्वयं कुशिकात्मजः ।।
data.es: After consultations the gods and sages decided that this son of Kushika (Viswamitra) deserved the status of a Maharshi".

data.v: देवतानां वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहः । अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of the devatas, Brahma, the Grandsire of all the worlds consoled the devatas with sweet words, saying:

data.v: महर्षे स्वागतं वत्स तपसोग्रेण तोषितः । महत्त्वमृषिमुख्यत्वं ददामि तव कौशिक ।।
data.es: "O Maharshi O Child welcome Pleased with your intense austerities, O Son of Kushika I confer upon you the eminent rank of a great rishi (maharshi)".

data.v: ब्रह्मणः स वचः श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रस्तपोधनः । प्राञ्जलिः प्रणतो भूत्वा प्रत्युवाच पितामहम् ।।
data.es: After listening to the manly command of ascetic Viswamitra, Rama, of the lineage of Raghu, the son of the foremost of men and firm in determination, replied with folded palms:

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षि शब्दमतुलं स्वार्जितैः कर्मभिः शुभैः । यदि मे भगवानाह ततोऽहं विजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: "O Adorable one, if you have conferred the incomparable title of 'Maharshi' earned by my auspicious deeds, I feel I have conquered the senses."

data.v: तमुवाच ततो ब्रह्मा न तावत्त्वं जितेन्द्रियः । यतस्व मुनिशार्दूल इत्युक्त्वा त्रिदिवं गतः ।।
data.es: Then Brahma said to him, 'You have not conquered the senses yet. O Tiger among ascetics, strive still.' Having said this he went toward heaven.

data.v: विप्रस्थितेषु देवेषु विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । ऊर्ध्वबाहुर्निरालम्बो वायुभक्षस्तपश्चरन् ।।
data.es: After the departure of the gods, mighty ascetic Viswamitra raised his arms up, stood without support, subsisting on air, continuing with his austerities.

data.v: धर्मे पञ्चतपा भूत्वा वर्षास्वाकाशसंश्रयः । शिशिरे सलिलस्थायी रात्र्यहानि तपोधनः ।।
data.es: Viswamitra whose wealth was his penance carried on his rigid austerities for a thousand years amidst five fires, in summer, under the open sky in monsoon, and immersed in ater night and day in winter.

data.v: एवं वर्षसहस्रं हि तपो घोरमुपागमत् ।।
तस्मिन्संतप्यमाने तु विश्वामित्रे महामुनौ । संभ्रमः सुमहानासीत्सुराणां वासवस्य च ।।
data.es: When the mighty asetic Viswamitra was peforming penance, the gods as well as Indra got deeply perturbed.

data.v: रम्भामप्सरसं शक्रः सह सर्वैर्मरुद्गणैः । उवाचात्महितं वाक्यमहितं कौशिकस्य च ।।
data.es: Indra along with all the maruts spoke to the celestial nymph Rambha, words that augured well for them and not for kaushika (Viswamitra).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: सुरकार्यमिदं रम्भे कर्तव्यं सुमहत्त्वया । लोभनं कौशिकस्येह काममोहसमन्वितम् ।।
data.es: "O Rambha you must entice Viswamitra by lust and passion. This important work must be done by you in the interest of the gods".

data.v: तथोक्ता साप्सरा राम सहस्राक्षेण धीमता । व्रीडिता प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा प्रत्युवाच सुरेश्वरम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, to these words of the sagacious, thousandeyed Lord of the gods (Indra) that apsara with folded hands bashfully replied:

data.v: अयं सुरपते घोरो विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । क्रोधमुत्स्रक्ष्यते घोरं मयि देव न संशयः । ततो हि मे भयं देव प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Lord of the devatas this mighty ascetic Viswamitra is a terrible person. He will ceratinly release on his dreadful anger (curse me). O Lord this is my apprehension. You should excuse me'.

data.v: तामुवाच सहस्राक्षो वेपमानां कृताञ्जलिम् । मा भैषि रम्भे भद्रं ते कुरुष्व मम शासनम् ।।
कोकिलो हृदयग्राही माधवे रुचिरद्रुमे । अहं कन्दर्पसहितः स्थास्यामि तव पार्श्वतः ।।
data.es: 'O Rambha have no fear. Feel safe. Carry out my order. When the trees look so beautiful in spring I shall in captivating the form of a cuckoo, stay by your side in the company of Kamadeva (Cupid).

data.v: त्वं हि रूपं बहुगुणं कृत्वा परमभास्वरम् । तमृषिं कौशिकं रम्भे भेदयस्व तपस्विनम् ।।
data.es: O Rambha displaying many (romantic) gestures and assuming a fascinating form, distract the mighty ascetic, Kausika (Viswamitra)'.

data.v: सा श्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा रूपमनुत्तमम् । लोभयामास ललिता विश्वामित्रं शुचिस्मिता ।।
data.es: At these words (of Indra), Rambha, assumed any form of excellent beauty and with a bright smile set out to allure Viswamitra.

data.v: कोकिलस्य तु शुश्राव वल्गु व्याहरतः स्वनम् । संप्रहृष्टेन मनसा तत एनामुदैक्षत ।।
data.es: Excited by the charming warble of the cuckoo, Viswamitra opened his eyes.

data.v: अथ तस्य च शब्देन गीतेनाप्रतिमेन च । दर्शनेन च रम्भाया मुनिः संदेहमागतः ।।
data.es: On hearing the sound of the incomparable song of the cuckoo along with the sight of Rambha, a doubt arose in the mind of the ascetic.

data.v: सहस्राक्षस्य तत्कर्म विज्ञाय मुनिपुंगवः । रम्भां क्रोधसमाविष्टः शशाप कुशिकात्मजः ।।
data.es: Son of Kushika, the eminent ascetic knew it was the work of Indra. Seized with anger, he cursed Rambha:

data.v: यन्मां लोभयसे रम्भे कामक्रोधजयैषिणम् । दशवर्षसहस्राणि शैली स्थास्यसि दुर्भगे ।।
data.es: 'O luckless Rambha, since you have endeavoured to distract me from my desire to conquer wrath and passion, you shall turn into a rock and remain so for ten thousand years'.

data.v: ब्राह्मणः सुमहातेजास्तपोबलसमन्वितः । उद्धरिष्यति रम्भे त्वां मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृताम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rambha an effulgent brahmin, endowed with the power of asceticism, will liberate you from this state into which you have fallen on account of my anger'.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । अशक्नुवन्धारयितुं कोपं संतापमागतः ।।
data.es: The brilliant Viswamitra, the great ascetic, now experienced remorse for his inability to contain anger.

data.v: तस्य शापेन महता रम्भा शैली तदाभवत् । वचः श्रुत्वा च कन्दर्पो महर्षेः स च निर्गतः ।।
data.es: This mighty curse, of the great saint transformed Rambha into a rock and sent Kamadeva and Indra to their heels.

data.v: कोपेन स महातेजास्तपोऽपहरणे कृते । इन्द्रियैरजितै राम न लेभे शान्तिमात्मनः ।।
data.es: "O Rama highly powerful Viswamitra was deprived of his ascetic merit due to his anger. He had no peace of mind for his inability to control his senses.

data.v: अथ हैमवतीं राम दिशं त्यक्त्वा महामुनिः । पूर्वां दिशमनुप्राप्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम् ।।
data.es: "O Rama thereafter the great ascetic (Viswamitra), abandoning the north of the Himavat mountain reached the eastern quarter and performed rigorous austerities.

data.v: मौनं वर्षसहस्रस्य कृत्वा व्रतमनुत्तमम् । चकाराप्रतिमं राम तपः परमदुष्करम् ।।
data.es: Having observed a unique vow of silence for a thousand years, O Rama he practised unprecedented and extremely difficult austerities.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु काष्ठभूतं महामुनिम् । विघ्नैर्बहुभिराधूतं क्रोधो नान्तरमाविशत् ।।
data.es: After completion of a thousand years the great ascetic became a piece of wood. In spite of many impediments, he was unshaken, anger did not enter into his mind. O Rama with firm determination he practised austerities.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः पन्नगासुरराक्षसाः । मोहितास्तेजसा तस्य तपसा मन्दरश्मयः । कश्मलोपहताः सर्वे पितामहमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Thereupon devatas along with gandharvas, pannagas, uragas, and rakshasas, stood bewildered by his ascetic energy. Their own glory was dimmed in his lustre". Afflicted with anguish, they spoke to the Grandsire (Brahma):

data.v: बहुभिः कारणैर्देव विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । लोभितः क्रोधितश्चैव तपसा चाभिवर्धते ।।
data.es: "O Lord the great sage Viswamitra was lured and angered in various ways. But his austerities continued to grow:

data.v: न ह्यस्य वृजिनं किंचिद्दृश्यते सूक्ष्ममप्यथ । न दीयते यदि त्वस्य मनसा यदभीप्सितम् । विनाशयति त्रैलोक्यं तपसा सचराचरम् । व्याकुलाश्च दिशः सर्वा न च किंचित्प्रकाशते ।।
data.es: His penance was flawless. If his wishes were not granted, he will surely destroy by his austerities the three worlds with all movables and immovables.

data.v: सागराः क्षुभिताः सर्वे विशीर्यन्ते च पर्वताः । प्रकम्पते च पृथिवी वायुर्वाति भृशाकुलः ।।
बुद्धिं न कुरुते यावन्नाशे देव महामुनिः । तावत्प्रसाद्यो भगवानग्निरूपो महाद्युतिः ।।
data.es: O Lord before this mighty, venerable ascetic, effulgent like fire decides to destroy the three worlds, he should be appeased.

data.v: कालाग्निना यथा पूर्वं त्रैलोक्यं दह्यतेऽखिलम् । देवराज्ये चिकीर्षेत दीयतामस्य यन्मतम् ।।
data.es: All the three worlds are burning as though with the fire Pralaya (dissolution). His desire may be granted even if he wants to rule the kingdom of the gods.

data.v: ततः सुरगणाः सर्वे पितामहपुरोगमाः । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं वाक्यं मधुरमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, with Brahma in the forefront, the gods spoke to Viswamitra in pleasing words:

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षे स्वागतं तेऽस्तु तपसा स्म सुतोषिताः । ब्राह्मण्यं तपसोग्रेण प्राप्तवानसि कौशिक ।।
data.es: "Welcome, O Brahmarshi. We are immensely pleased with your austerities. O Kausika you have attained brahminhood by means of your intense penance.

data.v: दीर्घमायुश्च ते ब्रह्मन्ददामि समरुद्गणः । स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भद्रं ते गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: O Brahmana I along with the maruts grant you long life. May you prosper O Gentle one now you may go happily".

data.v: पितामहवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां च दिवौकसाम् । कृत्वा प्रणामं मुदितो व्याजहार महामुनिः ।।
data.es: Mighty ascetic Viswamitra was delighted to hear the words of the Grandsire and the gods. Bowing to all of them he thus spoke:

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यं यदि मे प्राप्तं दीर्घमायुस्तथैव च । ओंकारोऽथ वषट्कारो वेदाश्च वरयन्तु माम् ।।
data.es: "If brahminhood and long life have been acquired by me by your grace, Omkara, Vashatkara and the Vedas shall accept me as Brahmarshi. (I shall acquire the right to interpret the Vedas and to perform sacrifices.)

data.v: क्षत्रवेदविदां श्रेष्ठो ब्रह्मवेदविदामपि । ब्रह्मपुत्रो वसिष्ठो मामेवं वदतु देवताः । यद्ययं परमः कामः कृतो यान्तु सुरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: "O gods let the son of Brahma and eminent Vasishta who is knowledgeable in the vedas worthy of brahmins and archery worthy of kshatriyas address me as 'Brahmarshi'. If this supreme desire is granted, O Best of devatas all of you can go".

data.v: ततः प्रसादितो देवैर्वसिष्ठो जपतां वरः । सख्यं चकार ब्रह्मर्षिरेवमस्त्विति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereupon, pleased by the gods, Vasishta, the best among ascetics, lovingly said to Viswamitra "You are a Brahmarshi, let it be so".

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षित्वं न संदेहः सर्वं संपत्स्यते तव । इत्युक्त्वा देवताश्चापि सर्वा जग्मुर्यथागतम् ।।
data.es: "You are a Brahmarshi, no doubt. You will achieve ascetic perfection", said the gods and returned to their respective places from where they had come.

data.v: विश्वामित्रोऽपि धर्मात्मा लब्ध्वा ब्राह्मण्यमुत्तमम् । पूजयामास ब्रह्मर्षिं वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम् ।।
data.es: Virtuous Viswamitra also, having attained excellent brahminhood, worshipped Brahmrshi Vasishta who was the best of those who recite hymns".

data.v: कृतकामो महीं सर्वां चचार तपसि स्थितः । एवं त्वनेन ब्राह्मण्यं प्राप्तं राम महात्मना ।।
data.es: This illustrious sage having fulfilled his desire, wandered over the earth fixed in asceticism. O Rama thus he acquired brahminhood.

data.v: एष राम मुनिश्रेष्ठ एष विग्रहवांस्तपः । एष धर्मः परो नित्यं वीर्यस्यैष परायणम् ।।
data.es: O Rama he is the foremost of ascetics, an embodiment of asceticism, always intent on virtue. He is the ultimate repository of ascetic energy".

data.v: शतानन्दवचः श्रुत्वा रामलक्ष्मणसंनिधौ । जनकः प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमुवाच कुशिकात्मजम् ।।
data.es: The thousandeyed Indra, slayer of Bala, on hearing Diti's words, addressed her with folded palms, saying:

data.v: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे मुनिपुंगव । यज्ञं काकुत्स्थ सहितः प्राप्तवानसि धार्मिक ।।
data.es: "O Sage no one is more blessed than me since you have favoured me with your arrival in my country."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: पावितोऽहं त्वया ब्रह्मन्दर्शनेन महामुने । गुणा बहुविधाः प्राप्तास्तव संदर्शनान्मया ।।
data.es: O Excellent ascetic O Brahmana I am sanctified with your presence. I have derived immense benefits from your visit.

data.v: विस्तरेण च ते ब्रह्मन्कीर्त्यमानं महत्तपः । श्रुतं मया महातेजो रामेण च महात्मना ।।
data.es: O powerful Brahmarshi distinguished Rama and I have heard your great austerities which were related in detail (by Satananda).

data.v: सदस्यैः प्राप्य च सदः श्रुतास्ते बहवो गुणाः ।।
अप्रमेयं तपस्तुभ्यमप्रमेयं च ते बलम् । अप्रमेया गुणाश्चैव नित्यं ते कुशिकात्मज ।।
data.es: Many of your virtues have been heard by the members of the assembly present at the sacrifice. Your austerities are immeasurable, your power is immense. O Son of Kushika (Viswamitra), your virtues cannot be measured.

data.v: तृप्तिराश्चर्यभूतानां कथानां नास्ति मे विभो । कर्मकालो मुनिश्रेष्ठ लम्बते रविमण्डलम् ।।
data.es: O Lord I am never tired of listening to your marvellous deeds. O Excellent among ascetics the Sun has set and it is time for evening prayers.

data.v: श्वः प्रभाते महातेजो द्रष्टुमर्हसि मां पुनः । स्वागतं तपसां श्रेष्ठ मामनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: O Sage of great austerities come to me tomorrow at dawn. O Excellent ascetic welcome And allow me to leave".

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिश्रेष्ठं वैदेहो मिथिलाधिपः । प्रदक्षिणं चकाराशु सोपाध्यायः सबान्धवः ।।
विश्वामित्रोऽपि धर्मात्मा सहरामः सलक्ष्मणः । स्वं वाटमभिचक्राम पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः ।।
data.es: Virtuous Viswamitra also, having attained excellent brahminhood, worshipped Brahmrshi Vasishta who was the best of those who recite hymns".

data.v: ततः प्रभाते विमले कृतकर्मा नराधिपः । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानमाजुहाव सराघवम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter the destroyers of foes, Rama and Lakshmana offering their morning oblations on that bright dawn arrived at the bank of the river (Ganga) with Viswamitra ahead of them.

data.v: तमर्चयित्वा धर्मात्मा शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा । राघवौ च महात्मानौ तदा वाक्यमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: The virtuous Janaka paid respects to Viswamitra and the highsouled Rama and Lakshmana in accordance with the sastras and spoke:

data.v: भगवन्स्वागतं तेऽस्तु किं करोमि तवानघ । भवानाज्ञापयतु मामाज्ञाप्यो भवता ह्यहम् ।।
data.es: "Welcome, O Venerable one O Irreproachable one what can I do for you? Worthy of being commanded, I seek your orders.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स धर्मात्मा जनकेन महात्मना । प्रत्युवाच मुनिर्वीरं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: At the words of the magnanimous Janaka, the virtuous sage wellversed in speech replied to the heroic king:

data.v: पुत्रौ दशरथस्येमौ क्षत्रियौ लोकविश्रुतौ । द्रष्टुकामौ धनुः श्रेष्ठं यदेतत्त्वयि तिष्ठति ।।
data.es: Dasaratha's sons, (Rama and Lakshmana), kshatriyas renowned in the world are eager to see that great bow in your possession.

data.v: एतद्दर्शय भद्रं ते कृतकामौ नृपात्मजौ । दर्शनादस्य धनुषो यथेष्टं प्रतियास्यतः ।।
एवमुक्तस्तु जनकः प्रत्युवाच महामुनिम् । श्रूयतामस्य धनुषो यदर्थमिह तिष्ठति ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by the mighty ascetic Janaka replied, "I shall tell you how this bow came to be deposited here".

data.v: देवरात इति ख्यातो निमेः षष्ठो महीपतिः । न्यासोऽयं तस्य भगवन्हस्ते दत्तो महात्मना ।।
data.es: "O Adorable one there was a famous king named Devarata, sixth in line from Nimi. This bow was kept with him in trust by the exalted lord (Shiva).

data.v: दक्षयज्ञवधे पूर्वं धनुरायम्य वीर्यवान् । रुद्रस्तु त्रिदशान्रोषात्सलीलमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Earlier at the time of destruction of Daksha's sacrifice, Rudra endowed with great prowess lifted this bow sportively and spoke to the gods.

data.v: यस्माद्भागार्थिनो भागान्नाकल्पयत मे सुराः । वराङ्गानि महार्हाणि धनुषा शातयामि वः ।।
data.es: 'O gods in your anxiety to partake your share of the sacrifie, you have failed to provide mine in the sacrificial offerings. Therefore, I shall sever your jewelled heads and beautiful limbs with this bow'.

data.v: ततो विमनसः सर्वे देवा वै मुनिपुंगव । प्रसादयन्ति देवेशं तेषां प्रीतोऽभवद्भवः ।।
data.es: "O Eminent ascetic thereafter all the gods with agitated minds propitiated lord of the gods, Siva and he was pleased with them.

data.v: प्रीतियुक्तः स सर्वेषां ददौ तेषां महात्मनाम् ।।
तदेतद्देवदेवस्य धनूरत्नं महात्मनः । न्यासभूतं तदा न्यस्तमस्माकं पूर्वके विभो ।।
data.es: O Lord that gem of a bow belonging to Siva was given to the great gods who in turn got it deposited in trust with our ancestor.

data.v: अथ मे कृषतः क्षेत्रं लाङ्गलादुत्थिता मम । क्षेत्रं शोधयता लब्ध्वा नाम्ना सीतेति विश्रुता ।।
data.es: Thereupon while I was ploughing and cleaing the (sacrificial) ground, Sita, a wellknown name, was lifted up by the blade of the plough. Thus she was obtained by me.

data.v: भूतलादुत्थिता सा तु व्यवर्धत ममात्मजा । वीर्यशुल्केति मे कन्या स्थापितेयमयोनिजा ।।
data.es: Arisen from the earth and not from a mother's womb, she grew up as my daughter. I made a stipulation that (this shall be the means to win this maiden as a gift) this shall be given in marriage only to the prince whose prowess is fully tried.

data.v: भूतलादुत्थितां तां तु वर्धमानां ममात्मजाम् । वरयामासुरागम्य राजानो मुनिपुंगव ।।
data.es: O Eminent ascetic arisen from the earth and reared as my daughter, she has been sought after in marriage by many princes.

data.v: तेषां वरयतां कन्यां सर्वेषां पृथिवीक्षिताम् । वीर्यशुल्केति भगवन्न ददामि सुतामहम् ।।
data.es: O Worshipful one all those monarchs sought this maiden but I did not offer my daughter saying that the 'marriage offer' could be made only through the tried and tested prowess of a suitor.

data.v: ततः सर्वे नृपतयः समेत्य मुनिपुंगव । मिथिलामभ्युपागम्य वीर्यं जिज्ञासवस्तदा ।।
data.es: O Preeminent among ascetics thereafter many kings together came to Mithila to test their prowess.

data.v: तेषां जिज्ञासमानानां वीर्यं धनुरुपाहृतम् । न शेकुर्ग्रहणे तस्य धनुषस्तोलनेऽपि वा ।।
data.es: The bow was brought and placed before those who were curious to test their strength but none was able to grasp or lift the bow.

data.v: तेषां वीर्यवतां वीर्यमल्पं ज्ञात्वा महामुने । प्रत्याख्याता नृपतयस्तन्निबोध तपोधन ।।
data.es: O great ascetic I knew those mighty kings had little strength, so rejected them.

data.v: ततः परमकोपेन राजानो मुनिपुंगव । अरुन्धन्मिथिलां सर्वे वीर्यसंदेहमागताः ।।
data.es: O Mighty ascetic, thereafter all the kings doubting their own strength in stringing the bow were inflamed with anger and laid siege on Mithila.

data.v: आत्मानमवधूतं ते विज्ञाय मुनिपुंगव । रोषेण महताविष्टाः पीडयन्मिथिलां पुरीम् ।।
data.es: Those eminent kings felt humiliated. Inflamed with anger, they tormented the city of Mithila.

data.v: ततः संवत्सरे पूर्णे क्षयं यातानि सर्वशः । साधनानि मुनिरेष्ठ ततोऽहं भृशदुःखितः ।।
data.es: O Best among ascetics thus one year passed. Everywhere in the city all the means of living were exhausted. I felt deeply sad over this situation.

data.v: ततो देवगणान्सर्वांस्तपसाहं प्रसादयम् । ददुश्च परमप्रीताश्चतुरङ्गबलं सुराः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, I propitiated the gods by my austerities. Highly pleased, they gave me an army of four divisions (chariots, elephants, horses and infantry ).

data.v: ततो भग्ना नृपतयो हन्यमाना दिशो ययुः । अवीर्या वीर्यसंदिग्धा सामात्याः पापकारिणः ।।
data.es: Then those wicked kings who were exhausted were doubtful about their energy. They were beaten and defeated. They fled away along with their ministers in different directions.

data.v: तदेतन्मुनिशार्दूल धनुः परमभास्वरम् । रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि दर्शयिष्यामि सुव्रत ।।
data.es: O Sage you are a tiger among asceties, you are faithful to your vows, I shall show this effulgent bow to your Rama and Lakshmana .

data.v: यद्यस्य धनुषो रामः कुर्यादारोपणं मुने । सुतामयोनिजां सीतां दद्यां दाशरथेरहम् ।।
data.es: O Sage if Rama could lift and string this bow I shall give my daughter Sita, not born from a woman, to him (son of Dasaratha)". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: जनकस्य वचः श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः । धनुर्दर्शय रामाय इति होवाच पार्थिवम् ।।
data.es: Great ascetic Viswamitra, hearing Rama's words, chose a nottoocrowded place near a watersource for encampment.

data.v: ततः स राजा जनकः सचिवान्व्यादिदेश ह । धनुरानीयतां दिव्यं गन्धमाल्यविभूषितम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter king Janaka said to his feudatories, "Let the divine bow adorned with flowers and sandalpaste be brought".

data.v: जनकेन समादिष्ठाः सचिवाः प्राविशन्पुरीम् । तद्धनुः पुरतः कृत्वा निर्जग्मुः पार्थिवाज्ञया ।।
data.es: Commanded by (king) Janaka, the ministers went to the city, put the bow in front of them and carried it as per the orders of the king.

data.v: नृपां शतानि पञ्चाशद्व्यायतानां महात्मनाम् । मञ्जूषामष्टचक्रां तां समूहुस्ते कथंचन ।।
data.es: Five thousand mighty stalwarts drew with great difficulty the eightwheeled cart on which the bow was placed in a box.

data.v: तामादाय तु मञ्जूषामायतीं यत्र तद्धनुः । सुरोपमं ते जनकमूचुर्नृपतिमन्त्रिणः ।।
data.es: The counsellors of the king, brought the iron casket containing the bow and said these words to Janaka comparable to a celestial:

data.v: इदं धनुर्वरं राजन्पूजितं सर्वराजभिः । मिथिलाधिप राजेन्द्र दर्शनीयं यदीच्छसि ।।
data.es: 'O Indra among kings O lord of Mithila here is the great bow, worshipped by all kings, which you intend to show (to Rama)'.

data.v: तेषां नृपो वचः श्रुत्वा कृताञ्जलिरभाषत । विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं तौ चोभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Having heard this, the king with folded hands said to the great soul Viswamitra sitting with the two princes Rama and Lakshmana:

data.v: इदं धनुर्वरं ब्रह्मञ्जनकैरभिपूजितम् । राजभिश्च महावीर्यैरशक्यं पूरितुं तदा ।।
data.es: "O Brahman in the olden days, this great bow was worshipped by my forefathers. Powerful kings failed to string this bow.

data.v: नैतत्सुरगणाः सर्वे नासुरा न च राक्षसाः । गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवराः सकिंनरमहोरगाः ।।
data.es: No gods nor sages nor asuras in rakshasas nor kinnaras nor mighty serpents nor gandharvas nor the best of yakshas (will be able to know)

data.v: क्व गतिर्मानुषाणां च धनुषोऽस्य प्रपूरणे । आरोपणे समायोगे वेपने तोलनेऽपि वा ।।
data.es: How then can men bend, string, fix the arrow, pull the string and lift it?

data.v: तदेतद्धनुषां श्रेष्ठमानीतं मुनिपुंगव । दर्शयैतन्महाभाग अनयो राजपुत्रयोः ।।
data.es: O Eminent ascetic such heaviest bow is brought here, O Highly accomplished sage show this to the two princes".

data.v: विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा श्रुत्वा जनकभाषितम् । वत्स राम धनुः पश्य इति राघवमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the words of Janaka, the righteous Viswamitra said: "O Child O Descendant of Raghu look at this bow".

data.v: महर्षेर्वचनाद्रामो यत्र तिष्ठति तद्धनुः । मञ्जूषां तामपावृत्य दृष्ट्वा धनुरथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: At the words of the great rishi Viswamitra, Rama opened the casket, beheld the bow and said:

data.v: इदं धनुर्वरं ब्रह्मन्संस्पृशामीह पाणिना । यत्नवांश्च भविष्यामि तोलने पूरणेऽपि वा ।।
data.es: "O Brahmarshi, shall I touch this great bow with my hands lift and string it".

data.v: बाढमित्येव तं राजा मुनिश्च समभाषत । लीलया स धनुर्मध्ये जग्राह वचनान्मुनेः ।।
data.es: The king as also the rishi said "Be it so". At the words of the sage (Viswamitra), he (Rama) took hold of the bow by the its middle with ease:

data.v: पश्यतां नृषहस्राणां बहूनां रघुनन्दनः । आरोपयत्स धर्मात्मा सलीलमिव तद्धनुः ।।
data.es: Virtuous Rama, the delight of the Raghus, in the presence of several thousands of men fixed the string to the bow and drew it as though with ease.

data.v: आरोपयित्वा मौर्वीं च पूरयामास वीर्यवान् । तद्बभञ्ज धनुर्मध्ये नरश्रेष्ठो महायशाः ।।
data.es: Rama, the best among men, righteous and famous lifted the bow. Stringing it with a twang he drew it and broke it into two in the middle.

data.v: तस्य शब्दो महानासीन्निर्घातसमनिस्वनः । भूमिकम्पश्च सुमहान्पर्वतस्येव दीर्यतः ।।
data.es: It generated a loud sound like the clap of thunder, like the trembling of the earth and the splitting of a mountain.

data.v: निपेतुश्च नराः सर्वे तेन शब्देन मोहिताः । वर्जयित्वा मुनिवरं राजानं तौ च राघवौ ।।
data.es: On hearing the sound, except Janaka, Viswamitra and the two raghavas (Rama and Lakshmana) the rest of the people around fell down and fainted.

data.v: प्रत्याश्वस्ते जने तस्मिन्राजा विगतसाध्वसः । उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो मुनिपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: When the people recovered the king skilful in the use of words addressed the eminent ascetic without apprehension with folded palms in the following words:

data.v: भगवन्दृष्टवीर्यो मे रामो दशरथात्मजः । अत्यद्भुतमचिन्त्यं च अतर्कितमिदं मया ।।
data.es: "O Worshipful one I have witnessed the prowess of Rama, son of Dasaratha. I had not imagined that this marvellous feat could be ever accomplished.

data.v: जनकानां कुले कीर्तिमाहरिष्यति मे सुता । सीता भर्तारमासाद्य रामं दशरथात्मजम् ।।
data.es: By receiving Rama, son of Dasaratha, as her husband, my daughter Sita will bring glory to my dynasty.

data.v: मम सत्या प्रतिज्ञा च वीर्यशुल्केति कौशिक । सीता प्राणैर्बहुमता देया रामाय मे सुता ।।
data.es: O Son of Kausika I announce Sita to be the 'Reward of prowess'. My vow has come true. She is more valuable than my life and fit to be given to Rama.

data.v: भवतोऽनुमते ब्रह्मञ्शीघ्रं गच्छन्तु मन्त्रिणः । मम कौशिक भद्रं ते अयोध्यां त्वरिता रथैः ।।
data.es: O Brahmarshi Kausika, be blessed With your consent my ministers will take the chariots to Ayodhya immediately.

data.v: राजानं प्रश्रितैर्वाक्यैरानयन्तु पुरं मम । प्रदानं वीर्यशुल्कायाः कथयन्तु च सर्वशः ।।
data.es: That Sita, the reward of prowess is to be given to Rama be reventially communicated in detail to king Dasaratha and he may be conveyed here.

data.v: मुनिगुप्तौ च काकुत्स्थौ कथयन्तु नृपाय वै । प्रीयमाणं तु राजानमानयन्तु सुशीघ्रगाः ।।
data.es: The welfare of the descendant of Kausika (Rama and Lakshmana) under the protection of sage (Viswamitra) be reported to the king. The king who will be happy to hear this be brought here by swiftfooted men".

data.v: कौशिकश्च तथेत्याह राजा चाभाष्य मन्त्रिणः । अयोध्यां प्रेषयामास धर्मात्मा कृतशासनात् ।।
data.es: The son of Kausika (Viswamitra) also said, "So be it". The virtuous king, having consulted his ministers, despatched counsellors to Ayodhya to communicate to king Dasaratha all that had taken place and bring him (to Mithila).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: जनकेन समादिष्टा दूतास्ते क्लान्तवाहनाः । त्रिरात्रमुषित्वा मार्गे तेऽयोध्यां प्राविशन्पुरीम् ।।
data.es: Commanded by Janaka the messengers travelled for three days, rested for three nights on the way and entered the city of Ayodhya along with their horses tired.

data.v: ते राजवचनाद्दूता राजवेश्मप्रवेशिताः । ददृशुर्देवसंकाशं वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम् ।।
data.es: Having heard their words, the doorkeepers informed the descendant of Raghu (king Dasaratha). Thereafter, with the the king's permission, the messengers entered the royal palace and beheld the aged king Dasaratha who shone like a god.

data.v: बद्धाञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वे दूता विगतसाध्वसाः । राजानं प्रयता वाक्यमब्रुवन्मधुराक्षरम् ।।
